Udupfukamunwa dukoreshwa kwa muganga ni two twiza ku bashobora kuba baranduye, kuko kwambara agapfukamunwa bikumira ingano n’intera by’amatembabuzi arekurwa igihe uvuze, witsamuye unakoroye.
The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
OMS yatangaje amabwiriza yerekeye igihe n’uburyo bwo kwambara udupfukamunwa.

According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.

Nk’uko Stephen Griffin, impuguke mu bumenyi bwa virusi wo muri Kaminuza ya Leeds, abivuga, “Kwambara agapfukamunwa bigabanya uko abantu bakunda kwikora mu maso, ari ho indwara ikunda kwinjirira igihe intoki zidasukuye mu buryo bukwiye”. Udupfukamunwa tunakoreshwa n’abita ku muntu ushobora kuba urwaye.

The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.

OMS isaba abantu batarwaye kwambara udupfukamunwa gusa iyo bafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura, nk’abita ku muntu ufite COVID-19, kandi inemera ko kwambara udupfukamunwa birinda abantu kwikora mu maso.
Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
Ibihugu byinshi byatangiye gushishikariza abaturage babyo gukoresha udupfukamunwa.

In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.

Muri Amerika, CDC isaba abantu kwambara udupfukamunwa dukoze mu myenda tutari utwo kwa muganga. By’umwihariko, Ubushinwa busaba abaturage batarwaye gukoresha udupfukamunwa two kwa muganga tujugunywa tumaze gukoreshwa cyane cyane iyo begereye abandi mu ntera itageze muri metero 1.
Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
Hongukongo isaba abantu kwambara udupfukamunwa two ka muganga igihe bari gukora ingendo cyangwa bari ahahurira abantu benshi.
Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
Abayobozi b’inzego z’ubuzima muri Tayilandi bari gushishikariza abantu gukorera mu rugo udupfukamunwa dukoze mu myenda no kutumesa buri munsi.
The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
Muri Repubulika ya Ceke na Silovakiya babujije abantu kujya hanze batambaye agapfukamunwa cyangwa batipfutse amazuru n’umunwa.
On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
Ku ya 16 Werurwe, Viyetinamu yasabye buri wese kwambara agapfukamunwa agiye ahahurira abantu benshi mu kwirinda no kurinda abandi.
The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
Leta ya Ositaraliya yategetse ko buri wese winjiye mu iduka ry’ibiribwa agomba kwambara agapfukamunwa.
Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
Isiraheli yasabye abaturage bose kwambara agapfukamunwa igihe bari ahahurira abantu benshi.
Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
Tariki ya 1 Mata; Tayiwani, ikora udupfukamunwa turenga miriyoni icumi ku munsi, yasabye abagenda muri gari ya moshi na bisi zihuza imijyi kwambara agapfukamunwa.
Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
Panama yashyizeho itegeko ryo kwambara agapfukamunwa igihe cyose ugiye hanze, inasaba ko hakorwa udupfukamunwa dukorewe mu rugo ku badafite ubushobozi bwo kugura utwakorewe mu nganda.
Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
Udupfukamunwa tunakoreshwa henshi mu Buyapani, Koreya y’Epfo, Maleziya na Singapuru.
Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
Kwirinda kwegerana (binazwi nko gusiga intera hagati yawe n’undi) hakubiyemo ibikorwa bigamije kwirinda kwandura mu rwego rwo kugabanya ikwirakwira rya virusi hongerwa intera hagati y’abantu.
Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
Uburyo burimo akato, guhagarika ingendo no gufunga amashuri, ahakorerwa akazi, amasitade, aho bakinira ikinamico cyangwa amaduka.
Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.

Abantu ku giti cyabo bashobora gukoresha uburyo bwo kwirinda kwegerana baguma mu rugo, bagabanya ingendo, birinda kujya ahahurira abantu benshi, bakoresha uburyo bwo gusuhuzanya badakoranyeho no gusiga intera hagati yabo n’abandi.
Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
Kuri ubu, ibihugu byinshi biri gutegeka cyangwa gusaba abantu bari mu turerere twiganjemo icyorezo kwirinda kwegerana.

The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.

Umubare ntarengwa w’abantu bateraniye hamwe usabwa n’inzego za leta muri Amerika n’ibigo by’ubuzima wagabanyijwe byihuse uva ku bantu 250 (igihe bizwi ko nta bwandu bwa COVID-19 buri muri ako gace) baba 50, nyuma baragabanywa baba abantu 10.

On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.

Tariki ya 22 Werurwe 2020, Ubudage bwabujije abantu guterana barenze babiri. Abageze mu zabukuru n’abafite izindi ndwara nka diyabete, indwara y’umutima, indwara y’ubuhumekero, umuvuduko w’amaraso ukabije, n’abasirikare b’umubiri badakora neza bafite ibyago byo kuzahazwa n’indwara n’ingorane z’ubuzima bagiriwe inama n’Ikigo cya CDC yo kuguma mu rugo bishoboka mu gihe bashobora kwanduzwa na bagenzi babo. Mu mpera za Werurwe 2020, OMS n’indi miryango y’ubuzima yatangiye gusimbuza ikoreshwa ry’ijambo "kwirinda kwegerana" riba "gusiga intera hagati yawe na mugenzi wawe", mu gusobanura neza ko ikigamijwe ari kwirinda gukoranaho mu gihe muri gusabana hasigwa intera igaragara hagati y’abantu.

The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.

Ikoreshwa ry’ijambo "kwirinda kwegerana" ryatumye abantu batekereza ko bagomba kwigunga, aho kubashishikariza gukomeza gusabana n’abandi hakoreshejwe ubundi buryo. Zimwe mu nzego zatangaje amabwiriza agenga ibikorwa mpuzabitsina mu buryo bwiza muri iki gihe cy’icyorezo.
These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
Ayo mabwiriza arimo ko ugomba gukorana imibonano mpuzabitsina n’uwo mubana gusa, udafite virusi cyangwa ibimenyetso bya virusi.
Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
Kwishyira mu kato mu rugo ni ngombwa ku bantu bapimwe bagasanga bafite COVID-19 n’abekwa kuba baranduye.
Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
Ibigo by’ubuzima byatanze amabwiriza asobanuye neza ku buryo bwiza bwo kwishyira mu kato. Ibihugu byinshi byategetse cyangwa byasabye ko abantu bose baba mu duce turimo ubwandu bishyira mu kato.
The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
Amabwiriza yo kwishyira mu kato akomeye yahawe abari mu matsinda afite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura.

Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.

Abashobora kuba barahuye n’umuntu ufite COVID-19 n’abaherutse kugirira ingendo mu bihugu cyangwa uturere turangwamo ubwandu bagiriwe inama yo kwishyira mu kato iminsi 14 bahereye ku munsi wa nyuma bashobora kuba barahuye n’ubwandu.
Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
Ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo ni ukugikumira cyangwa guhagarika no kugabanya ikwirakwira ryacyo.

Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.

Gukumira bikorwa icyorezo kigitangira kandi bigamije gukurikirana no gushyira abanduye mu kato ndetse no kuzana izindi ngamba zo kurwanya ubwandu no gushaka inkingo mu guhagarika indwara ntikomeze gukwirakwira mu bandi baturage.

When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.

Iyo bitagishoboka gukumira ikwirakwira ry’icyorezo, noneho imbaraga zishyirwa mu kugabanya ikwirakwira: ingamba zifatwa mu kugabanya ikwirakwira no kugabanya ingaruka z’icyorezo ku nzego z’ubuvuzi na sosiyete.
A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
Ingamba zo gukumira no kugabanya ikwirakwira bishobora gufatirwa icyarimwe.

Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.

Guhagarika icyorezo byo bisaba ingamba zikomeye zo guhagarika icyorezo hagabanywa umubare w’abandura bashya ukaba munsi ya 1. Kimwe mu bigize ibikorwa byo guhangana n’icyorezo cy’indwara yandura ni ukugerageza kugabanya ubwiyongere bukabije bw’abandura bizwi nko kugabanya imibare mishya y’ubwandu.
This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
Bigabanya ibibazo bya serivisi z’ubuzima byo kurengerwa n’umubare w’abarwayi no kubona igihe gihagije cyo gushaka urukingo n’umuti.

Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.

Uburyo bwo kurwanya ubwandu hadakoreshejwe imiti harimo guhangana n’icyorezo hakoreshejwe ingamba bwite zo kwirinda nko kugira isuku y’inkoti, kwambara udupfukamunwa no kwishyira mu kato; ingamba mu baturage zo kutegerena nko gufunga amashuri no guhagarika ibikorwa rusange; bisaba kubikangurira abaturage bakabyumva bakanabyitabira; n’ingamba zijyanye n’ibidukikije nko guhanagura ahakorwa cyane. Hari izindi ngamba zikomeye zafashwe mu rwego rwo gukurwanya icyerozo mu Bushinwa ubwo ubukana bw’icyorezo bwari butangiye kugaragara nko gushyira mu kato imijyi yose no gushyiraho amabwiriza akaze yo guhagarika ingendo.
Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
Ibindi bihugu na byo byagiye bikoresha ingamba zitandukanye zigamije guhagarika ikwirakwira rya virusi.
South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
Koreya y’Epfo yatangiye gupima abantu benshi no gushyira mu kato ibice bimwe na bimwe no gutangaza ingendo z’abanduye.
Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
Singapuru yahaye inkunga y’amafaranga abanduye bishyize mu kato inashyiraho amande menshi ku batabikoze.

Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.

Tayiwani yongereye ikorwa ry’udupfukamunwa no guhana abikubira ibikoresho by’ubuvuzi. Ni na ko Ubwongereza n’Amerika byagaragaje ko kugabanya ubwandu (kugabanya umubare w’abandura bitari guhagarika ikwirakwira ry’icyorezo) no kubuuhagarika (kugabanya umubare mushya w’abandura) byagiye bigira imbogamizi zikomeye.
Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.

Ingamba zo kugabanya umubare w’abandura zishobora kugabanya ubwiyongereye bukabije bw’abakenera serivisi z’ubuvuzi ho 2/3 n’umubare w’abapfa ukagabanukaho icya kabiri, ariko ntibibuza ibihumbi n’ibihumbi by’abantu gupfa na serivisi z’ubuvuzi zikomeza kwakira umubare mwinshi w’abarwayi.

Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.

Guhagarika icyorezo ni byo byaba byiza ariko bigomba gukomeza gukorwa igihe cyose visuri igitembera mu bantu (cyangwa kugeza igihe habonekeye urukingo, bitewe n’icyabaye mbere), ibanduza naho ubundi virusi ihita igaruka iyo izo ngamba zorohejwe.
Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
Ibikorwa by’igihe kirekire mu guhagarika icyorezo bibangamira imibereho n’ubukungu.
There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
Nta miti yihariye yemejwe ko igabanya ubukana bwa COVID-19, ariko ibikorwa byo kuyikora birakomeje, harimo gusuzuma imiti isanzwe igabanya ubukana bwa virusi.
Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
Gufata imiti y’ibicurane utandikiwe na muganga, kunywa amazi menshi no kuruhuka bishobora kugufasha kugabanya ibimenyetso.
Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
Bitewe n’ubukana, kuvurwa hifashishijwe ogisijeni, guterwa imiti y’amazi no gufashwa mu guhumeka biba ari ngombwa.
The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
Gukoresha imiti ya siteroyide bishobora gutuma uremba.
Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
Imiti myinshi yari yaremejwe ko ivura izindi ndwara ziterwa na virusi iri gukorwaho ubushakashatsi harebwa niba yakoreshwa mu kuvura COVID-19.
The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
OMS yatangaje ko: “imiti ya gakondo n’ikorerwa mu rugo” ishobora kugabanya ubukana bw’ibimenyetso biterwa na SARS-CoV-19.
Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
Kongera ubushobozi no guhindura imikorere harebwa ibyo inzego z’ubuvuzi zikeneye mu kuvura abarwayi ba COVID-19 bisobanurwa na OMS nk’ingamba z’ibanze mu kurwanya icyorezo.

The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.

ECDC n’Ibiro by’akarere k’Uburayi bya OMS byatangaje amabwiriza agenewe ibitaro n’abatanga serivisi z’ubuvuzi b’ibanze mu guhindura ibyakoreshwaga mu bikorwa by’izindi nzego, nko gutuma serivisi za raboratwari zibanda ku gupima COVID-19, guhagarika ibikorwa by’ubuvuzi bitari ngombwa, gutandukanya no gushyira mu kato abagaragaweho COVID-19, no kongerera ubushobozi serivisi zita ku ndembe hahugurwa abaganga no kongera umubare w’ibyuma byongerera umwuka abarwayi n’ibitanda.
There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
Hari amakuru atandukanye avuga aho ubwandu bwa mbere (uwagaragaweho bwa mbere virusi) bwakomotse.
The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
Ubwandu bwa mbere buzwi bwa koronavirusi nshya ni ubwo ku ya 1 Ukuboza 2019 muri Wuhan, Hubei, mu Bushinwa.
Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
Mu kwezi kumwe, umubare w’abanduye koronavirusi muri Hubei wagiye wiyongera.

These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.

Ahanini, abo banduye bari bafite aho bahuriye n’isoko rya Huanan Seafood Wholesale rinagurisha inyamaswa nzima, naho andi makuru avuga ko virusi yavuye kuri zimwe muri izo nyamaswa; mu yandi magambo, yakomotse ku nyamaswa. Abarwaye umusonga watewe n’ikintu kitazwi bikaba byarasuzumwe ku ya 26 Ukuboza maze bavurwa na muganga Zhang Jixian ukorera mu bitaro by’intara ya Hubei, abitangariza Ikigo cya Wuhan Jianghan CDC tariki ya 27 Ukuboza.
On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
Ku ya 30 Ukuboza, itsinda ry’abaganga b’ibitaro bya Wuhan Central Hospital bamenyesheje bagenzi babo ko hari indwara ya "SARS imeze nka koronavirusi".
Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
Umunani muri abo baganga, harimo Li Wenliang, baganirijwe na Polisi ku bwo gukwiza ibihuha, naho undi witwa Ai Fen, yihanangirijwe n’abayobozi be ku bwo kugaragaza icyo kibazo.
The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
Komisiyo ishinzwe ubuzima mu mujyi wa Wuhan yaje gusohora itangazo rusange tariki ya 31 Ukuboza inaha amakuru OMS.

Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.

Inzego z’ubuzima zamenyeshejwe ko hari abantu benshi barwaye umusonga hatazwi ikiwutera muri Wuhan, bituma hatangizwa isuzuma mu ntangiriro za Mutarama. Icyorezo kigitangira, abacyanduye bagiye bikuba kabiri hafi buri minsi irindwi n’igice.
In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.

Mu ntangiriro no hagati muri Mutarama 2020, virusi yakwiriye mu zindi ntara z’Ubushinwa, ibifashijwemo n’ingendo z’ubunani mu Bushinwa no kuba Wuhan ari yo ihuriramo kandi ari yo ikomeye mu ngendo za gari ya moshi zijya mu ntara zitandukanye.
On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
Ku ya 20 Mutarama, Ubushinwa bwatangaje ko hafi abantu bashya 140 banduye mu munsi umwe, harimo babiri bo muri Beijing n’umwe wo muri Shenzhen.

Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.

Nyuma amakuru yatangajwe na leta yagaragaje ko abantu 6 174 bagaragaje ibimenyetso tariki ya 20 Mutarama 2020. Kugeza tariki ya 26 Werurwe, Amerika yari imaze kurenga ku Bushinwa n’Ubutaliyani mu kugira umubare munini w’abemejwe ko banduye ku isi. Kugeza tariki ya 9 Mata 2020, hatangajwe ko abantu barenga miriyoni 1,61 banduye ku isi; aho abarenga 97 000 bapfuye abandi barenga 364 000 barakira.
Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
Hafi ibihugu n’intara 200 byari birimo byibuze umuntu umwe wanduye.
Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
Kubera icyorezo cyageze mu Burayi, ibihugu biri mu karere ka Schengen byagabanyije ingendo binashyiraho uburyo bwo gukumira indwara ku mipaka.

National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.

Ibihugu byashyizeho ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo nk’akato (binazwi nka gahunda ya guma mu rugo) n’imikwabo. Kugeza tariki ya 2 Mata, hafi miriyoni 300 z’abantu cyangwa hafi 90% by’abaturage bari bari kubahiriza gahunda imeze nk’iya guma mu rugo muri Amerika, naho abarenga miriyoni 50 muri Filipine, hafi miriyoni 59 z’abantu muri Afurika y’Epfo n’abantu miriyari 1,3 mu Buhinde bari bari muri gahunda ya guma mu rugo.
On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.

Ku wa 26 Werurwe, abantu miriyari 1,7 ku isi bari bari muri gahunda imeze nk’iya guma mu rugo, aho biyongeye bagera kuri miriyari 2,6 nyuma y’imitsi ibiri, hafi kimwe cya gatatu cy’abaturage b’isi yose.
The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
Uwa mbere byemejwe ko yanduye COVID-19 yagaragaye bwa mbere tariki ya 1 Ukuboza 2019 muri Wuhan; amakuru adafitiwe gihamya avuga ko uwa mbere yagaragaye tariki ya 17 Ugushyingo.
Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
Muganga Zhang Jixian yakurikiranye abantu barwaye umusonga watewe n’ikintu kitazwi ku ya 26 Ukuboza, ibitaro akorera bibimenyesha ikigo cya Wuhan Jianghan CDC ku wa 27 Ukuboza.
Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
Isuzuma ry’ibanze rya jene ryakorewe abarwayi ku ya 27 Ukuboza 2019 rigaragaza ko harimo SARS imeze nka koronavirusi.
A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
Itangazo rusange ryasohowe na Komisiyo y’ubuzima y’umujyi wa Wuhan tariki ya 31 Ukuboza.
The WHO was informed on the same day.
OMS na yo yahawe ayo makuru kuri uwo munsi.
As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
Muri uko gutangaza ibyabaye, abaganga bo muri Wuhan bihanangirijwe na Polisi kubera "gukwirakwiza ibihuha" byerekeye icyorezo.
The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
Komisiyo y’igihugu y’ubuzima mu Bushinwa yabanje gutangaza ko nta "bimenyetso bifatika" by’uko umuntu ayanduza mugenzi we.
In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.

Mu mpera za Mutarama, leta y’Ubushinwa yatangaje ko yatangiye ubukangurambaga bukomeye, bwaje gusobanurwa n’Umunyamabanga Mukuru w’Ishyaka rya gikomunisite ry’Ubushinwa, Xi Jinping, ko "abantu ari bo bagomba kurwana intambara" yo gukumira ikwirakwira rya virusi.

In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.

Mu byasobanuwe nk’"akato k’abantu benshi mu mateka ya muntu", ingamba zo guhagarika ingendo zatangajwe ku ya 23 Mutarama zihagarika ingendo zijya cyangwa ziva muri Wuhan, aho zongerewe zigera mu mijyi 15 yo muri Hubei, bigera ku bantu hafi miriyoni 57.
Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
Imodoka z’abantu ku giti cyabo zarahagaritswe mu mujyi.
Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
Ibirori byo kwizihiza umwaka mushya w’Ubushinwa (25 Mutarama) byahagaritswe ahantu henshi.
The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
Abayobozi banatangaje ko hagiye kubakwa ibitaro by’agateganyo bya Huoshenshan, byubatswe mu minsi 10.
Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
Ibindi bitaro byarubatswe nyuma y’aho nk’ibitaro bya Leishenshan, kugira ngo byite ku bandi barwayi.

In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.

Usibye ibitaro bishya byubatswe, Ubushinwa bwanahinduye izindi nyubako 14 zo muri Wuhan, nk’inyubako ziberamo inama n’amasitade mo ibitaro by’agateganyo. Ku ya 26 Mutarama, leta yatanze andi mabwiriza yo kurwanya icyorezo cya COVID-19, harimo gutanga amabwiriza y’ubuzima agenewe abakora ingendo no kongera ikiruhuko cy’iserukiramuco (Spring Festival).
Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
Kaminuza n’amashuri mu gihugu na byo byarafunzwe.
The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
Uturere twa Hongukongo na Makawu byafashe ingamba zitandukanye; by’umwihariko, izijyanye n’amashuri na kaminuza.
Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
Ingamba zo gukora hakoreshejwe iyakure zafashwe mu turere dutandukanye two mu Bushinwa.
Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
Amabwiriza ahagarika ingendo yatangiye kubahirizwa imbere no hanze ya Hubei.
Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
Gutwara abantu mu buryo rusange byarahinduwe n’inzu ndangamurage zo mu Bushinwa zirafungwa by’agateganyo.

Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.

Kugenzura imigendekere y’ingendo rusange byarakozwe mu mijyi myinshi, aho bivugwa ko hafi abantu miriyoni 760 (icya kabiri kirenga cy’abaturage bose) bagiye bahabwa amabwiriza yo kutava mu rugo. Nyuma y’aho icyorezo kimaze kuba rusange muri Werurwe, inzego z’ubuyobozi mu Bushinwa zafashe ingamba zikomeye zo gukumira virusi ngo "itinjira mu gihugu" iturutse mu bindi bihugu.

For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.

Urugero, Beijing yashyizeho akato gategetswe k’iminsi 14 ku bantu bose bavuye mu mahanga binjira muri uwo mujyi. Ku ya 23 Werurwe, umuntu umwe mu Bushinwa ni we wanduriye imbere mu gihugu mu minsi itanu yari yabanje, yari agarutse i Guangzhou avuye i Istanbul.
On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
Ku ya 24 Werurwe 2020, Minisitiri w’Intebe w’Ubushinwa, Li Keqiang, yatangaje ko kwanduzanya kw’abantu imbere mu gihugu byakumiriwe, ubu icyorezo kikaba cyararwanyijwe mu Bushinwa.

The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.

Uwo munsi amabwiriza yo gukumira ingendo yarorohejwe muri Hubei nyuma y’amezi abiri hashyizweho gahunda ya guma mu rugo ariko muri Wuhan agumishwaho. Tariki ya 26 Werurwe 2020, Minisiteri y’ububanyi n’amahanga yo mu Bushinwa yatangaje ko abinjira bagendeye kuri viza cyangwa uruhushya rwo gutura mu gihugu bihagaritswe guhera tariki ya 28 Werurwe gukomeza, ntihatangwa ibisobanuro byihariye by’igihe aya mabwiriza azarangirira.
Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
Abifuza kwinjira mu Bushinwa bagomba gusaba viza muri ambasade cyangwa konsira z’Ubushinwa.

The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.

Tariki ya 30 Werurwe; leta y’Ubushinwa yasabye abakora ibikorwa by’ubucuruzi n’inganda kongera gufungura, inatanga inkunga y’amafaranga yo kuzahura ibikorwa by’ibigo by’ubucuruzi. Inteko ya leta yatangaje ko umunsi w’icyunamo uzatangira igihugu cyose gifata iminota itatu yo kwibuka bikaba ku isaha ya 10:00 ku ya 4 Mata, uhurirana n’Iserukiramuco rya Qingming, ni ho leta yasabye imiryango kunamira abapfuye hakoreshejwe interineti mu kwirinda kwegerana no kwirinda ko hongera kwaduka icyorezo cya COVID-19.
COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
Ku ya 20 Mutarama, hemejwe ko COVID-19 yageze muri Koreya y’Epfo ivuye mu Bushinwa.

The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.

Ku ya 20 Gashyantare, Urwego rw’igihugu rw’ubuzima rwatangaje ko hari ubwiyongere bw’abemejwe ko barwaye, ahanini bitewe n’igiterane cyabereye i Daegu cy’idini rishya rizwi nka Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
Abayoboke ba Shincheonji baje gusura Daegu bavuye i Wuhan ni bo baketsweho guteza icyorezo.
As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.

Kugeza ku ya 22 Gashyantare, mu bayoboke bose b’iryo dini bagera ku 9 336, muri bo 1 261 cyangwa hafi 13% batangaje ko bafite ibimenyetso. ku ya 23 Gashyantare 2020, Koreya y’Epfo yatangaje ko ari wo mubare munini w’abanduye.
On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
Ku ya 28 Gashyantare, abantu barenga 2 000 bemejwe ko banduye muri Koreya, ku ya 29 Gashyantare uwo mubare ugera kuri 3 150.
All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
Ibigo bya gisirikare bya Koreya y’Epfo byose byashyizwe mu kato nyuma yo gupima bikemezwa ko abasirikare batatu bafite virusi.

Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.

Gahunda z’ingendo z’indege na zo zagizweho ingaruka bityo zirahindurwa. Koreya y’Epfo yatangije gahunda yo gupima ubwandu, ifatwa nka gahunda ngari kandi iteguye neza ku isi yose mu gupima abaturage ubwandu bwa virusi, no gukurikirana no gushyira mu kato abahuye n’abanduye.

Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.

Uburyo bwo gupima burimo kwigaragaza igihe ufite ibimenyetso ku baje baturutse mu mahanga binyuze muri porogaramu ya telefone igendanwa, gupima virusi abantu batavuye mu modoka aho ibisubizo biboneka umunsi ukurikiyeho, no kongera ubushobozi bwo gupima kugira ngo hapimwe abantu 20 000 buri munsi.

South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.

Gahunda ya Koreya y’Epfo ifatwa nk’iyagenze neza mu gukumira icyorezo bidasabye ko imijyi yose ishyirwa mu kato. Abaturage ba Koreya y’Epfo babanje kutavuga rumwe ku buryo perezida Moon Jae-in yitwaye mu kurwanya icyorezo.
Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
Abanyakoreya benshi basinye inyandiko basaba ko Moon aburanishwa kubera ko leta yitwaye nabi mu guhangana n’icyorezo abandi bashimira uko yitwaye mu kurwanya icyorezo.
On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
Ku ya 23 Werurwe, hatangajwe ko Koreya y’Epfo yagize umubare muto w’abanduye mu munsi umwe mu byumweru bine byose.
On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
Ku ya 29 Werurwe, hatangajwe ko guhera ku ya 1 Mata abinjira bashya baturutse hanze bagomba kujya mu kato k’ibyumweru bibiri.
Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
Ku ya 1 Mata, hakurikijwe ibyatangajwe n’ibinyamakuru Koreya y’Epfo yasabwe n’ibihugu birenga 121 kubifasha gupima virusi.
Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.

Ku ya 18 Gashyantare, Irani yatangaje ko abantu ba mbere byemejwe ko banduye SARS-CoV-2 muri Qom, uwo munsi abantu babiri bakaba barapfuye, hakurikijwe ibyavuzwe na Minisiteri y’ubuzima n’uburezi bw’ubuvuzi.

Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
Ingamba za mbere zatangajwe na leta harimo guhagarika ibitaramo n’ibindi bikorwa bijyanye n’umuco, imikino, amasengesho yo ku wa gatanu, gufunga za kaminuza, koreje n’ibigo by’amashuri.
Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
Irani yatanze tiriyari eshanu z’amariyari yo kurwanya virusi.
President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
Ku ya 26 Gashyantare 2020, Perezida Hassan Rouhani yavuze ko nta gahunda zihari zo gushyira uturere turimo icyorezo mu kato, ahubwo abanduye ari bo bonyine bakwiye gushyirwa mu kato.
Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
Gahunda zo kugabanya ingendo zikorerwa mu mijyi zatangajwe muri Werurwe, nubwo ingendo nyinshi hagati y’imijyi zakomeje mbere yo kwizihiza ubunani bw’umwaka w’abaperise witwa Nowruz.
Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
Urusengero rwa Shia rwo muri Qom rwakomeje gufungura ku bakora ingendo nyobokamana kugeza tariki ya 16 Werurwe 2020. Muri Gashyantare, Irani yagize umubare munini w’abanduye virusi nyuma y’Ubushinwa.

Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.

Irani ikomeje kuvugwaho guhisha umubare w’abanduye, aho kugeza tariki ya 28 Gashyantare ibihugu birenga icumi byakurikiranye abanduye bisanga baravuye muri Irani; bikagaragaza ko icyorezo gishobora kuba gikaze cyane kurusha abantu 388 batangajwe ko banduye na leta ya Irani kugeza iyo tariki.
The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
Inteko Nshingamategeko ya Irani yahagaritse imirimo, aho 23 muri 290 bayigize bavuzweho kwandura virusi tariki ya 3 Werurwe.

On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.

Ku ya 12 Werurwe, Umuryango uharanira uburenganzira bwa muntu (HRW) wasabye inzego zishinzwe amagereza muri Irani kurekura nta yandi mananiza abaharanira uburenganzira bwa muntu bafunzwe bazira kutavuga rumwe na leta badakoresheje intwaro ndetse no gufungura by’agateganyo imfungwa zose zibyemerewe.
It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
Ukomeza uvuga ko byateza ibyago byinshi virusi ikwiriye ahantu hato hari abantu benshi nk’amagereza, aho n’ubuvuzi buba butaboneka bihagije.
On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
Ku ya 15 Werurwe, leta ya Irani yatangaje ko abantu 100 bapfuye mu munsi umwe, akaba ari wo mubare munini mu gihugu kuva icyorezo cyatangira.
At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
17 Werurwe, abanyapolitiki cyangwa abakozi ba leta bakora cyangwa bahoze bakorera Irani byibuze 12 bishwe n’indwara.
By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
Kugeza ku ya 23 Werurwe, muri Irani habonekaga abanduye bashya 50 buri saha naho umwe agapfa buri minota icumi yishwe na koronavirusi.
According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
Umukozi wa OMS yatangaje ko bishoboka ko abarwaye muri Irani bikubye gatanu umubare w’abatangazwa.
It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
Hanatangajwe ko ibihano Amerika yafatiye Irani bishobora kuba biri kugira ingaruka ku bushobozi bw’ubukungu mu kurwanya icyorezo cya virusi.
The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
Komisiyo y’uburenganzira bwa muntu mu Muryango w’Abibumbye yasabye ko ibihano by’ubukungu byakoroshywa ku bihugu byugarijwe n’icyorezo harimo na Irani.
The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
Ku ya 31 Mutarama, ni bwo byemejwe ko icyorezo cyageze mu Butaliyani ubwo abashinwa babiri ba mukerarugendo bapimwe bakabasangamo virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 i Roma.
Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
Abanduye batangiye kwiyongera ku buryo bukabije, aho byatumye leta y’Ubutaliyani ihagarika ingendo z’indege zose ziva mu Bushinwa maze itangaza ko igihugu kinjiye mu bihe bidasanzwe.

An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.

Haje gutahurwa abantu batandukanye banduye COVID-19 aho tariki ya 21 Gashyantare, hagaragaye abantu 16 byemejwe ko banduye muri Lombardy. Ku ya 22 Gashyantare, Inama y’abaminisitiri yatangaje itegekoteka rishya ryo kurwanya icyorezo, harimo gushyira mu kato abantu barenga 50 00 bo mu mijyi itandukanye yo mu majyaruguru y’Ubutaliyani.
Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
Minisitiri w’Intebe, Giuseppe Conte, yagize ati: “Birabujijwe kwinjira no gusohoka mu turere turangwamo icyorezo.

Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.

Imirimo n’ibikorwa bya siporo byari byamaze gusabwa guhagarikwa muri utwo turere. Ku ya 4 Werurwe, leta y’Ubutaliyani yasabye ko hafungwa amashuri na za kaminuza mu gihugu hose ubwo Ubutaliyani bwari bumaze gupfusha abantu 100.
All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.

Ibikorwa by’imikino byose bikomeye, harimo n’imikino ya shampiyona y’umupira w’amaguru mu Butaliyani, byakinwe nta bafana kugeza muri Mata; ariko ku ya 9 Werurwe, hatangajwe ko ibikorwa byose bya siporo bihagaritswe burundu byibuze mu kwezi kumwe.

On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.

Ku ya 11 Werurwe, Minisitiri w’Intebe Conte yasabye ko hahagarikwa hafi ibikorwa byose by’ubucuruzi keretse amaduka y’ibiribwa na farumasi. Ku ya 6 Werurwe, Koleje ya SIAARTI mu Butaliyani yatangaje amabwiriza agenga ubuvuzi ajyanye na porotokore zo gupima zishobora gukoreshwa.
On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
Ku ya 19 Werurwe, Ubutaliyani bwarenze ku Bushinwa buba igihugu cyapfushije abantu benshi bishwe na koronavirusi ku isi nyuma yo gutangaza ko hapfuye abantu 3 405 bazize icyorezo.
On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
Ku ya 22 Werurwe, hatangajwe ko Uburusiya bwohereje indege za gisirikare icyenda zikoreye ibikoresho by’ubuvuzi bigiye mu Butaliyani.
As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
Kugeza ku ya 5 Mata, abantu 128 948 bari bamaze kwemezwa ko banduye, 15 887 bari bamaze gupfa, naho 21 815 bari bamaze gukira mu Butaliyani; abenshi muri bo ari abo mu karere ka Lombardy.
A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.

Amakuru ya CNN yagaragaje ko kuba Ubutaliyani bufite abaturage bageze mu zabukuru benshi n’ubushobozi buke bwo kutabasha gupima abantu bose bafite virusi kugeza icyo gihe bishobora kuba ari byo byatumye hagaragara igipimo cy’abapfa kinini.

The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.

Ingamba z’Ubwongereza zo kurwanya virusi zabanje kugaragara nk’izoroheje ugereranyije n’ibihugu byose byagaragayemo abanduye; no kugeza tariki ya 18 Werurwe 2020, leta y’Ubwongereza ntiyari yagashyizeho ingamba zo kutegerana cyangwa kuguma mu rugo.

As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.

Bityo, leta irabinengerwa kuko hatabayeho kwihutisha ibikorwa no gukaza ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo cyugarije abaturage. Ku ya 16 Werurwe; Minisitiri w’intebe w’Ubwongereza, Boris Johnson, yatangaje ko ingendo zitari ngombwa zose no kwegerena mu bantu bitemewe, asaba abantu gukorera mu rugo aho bishoboka no kwirinda kujya ahahurira abantu benshi nko mu tubari, resitora n’aho berekanira sinema.

On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.

Ku ya 20 Werurwe, leta yatangaje ko aho kwidagadurira hose nko mu tubari, ahakorerwa imyitozo ngororamubiri hagomba gufungwa vuba bishoboka, kandi isezeranya kwishyura kugeza kuri 80% by’umushahara w’abakozi no kutarenza amapawundi 2 500 ku kwezi kugira ngo abantu baticwa n’ubushomeri mu gihe cy’icyorezo. Ku ya 23 Werurwe, Minisitiri w’Intebe yatangaje ko hakajijwe ingamba zo kwirinda kwegerana, abuza guhura kw’abantu barenze babiri, ahagarika ingendo n’ibikorwa bikorerwa hanze hagakorwa gusa ibikenewe cyane.
Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
Izi ngamba zitandukanye n’izari zarafashwe mbere, aho izi zo zubahirizwaga na Polisi harimo guca abantu amande no kwirukana abateranye.
Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.

Ibikorwa by’ubucuruzi byinshi byasabwe gufunga, usibye ibikorwa bifatwa nk’ibiri ngombwa", harimo amasoko y’ibiribwa, farumasi, amabanki, amaduka y’ibikoresho by’ubwubatsi, sitasiyo z’ibikomoka kuri peterori n’amagaraje.
On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.

Ku ya 20 Mutarama, umuntu wa mbere uzwiho kuba yaranduye COVID-19 yemejwe mu gace ka Pasifika y’amajyaruguru y’uburengerazuba muri leta ya Washington, akaba yari umugabo wari ugarutse mu gihugu avuye i Wuhan tariki ya 15 Mutarama.
The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on 29 January.
Tariki ya 29 Mutarama, hashyizweho Itsinda rishinzwe kurwanya koronavirusi rya perezidansi y’Amerika.
On 31 January, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and placed restrictions on entry for travellers from China.
Ku ya 31 Mutarama, ubuyobozi bwa Trump bwatangaje ko hari amakuba abangamiye ubuzima rusange, maze bushyiraho amabwiriza yo gukumira abinjira mu gihugu bavuye mu Bushinwa.
On 28 January 2020, the Center for Disease Control—the leading public health institute of the U.S. government—announced they had developed their own testing kit.
Ku ya 28 Mutarama 2020, Ikigo cya CDC gikomeye muri Amerika gishinzwe ubuzima rusange, cyatangaje ko kikoreye ibikoresho byifashishwa mu gupima virusi.
Despite doing so, the United States had a slow start in testing, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.
Nubwo hakozwe ibyo, Amerika yatangiye gahoro gupima virusi, bikaba bitaragaragaje neza uko icyorezo gihagaze icyo gihe.

Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).

Gupima virusi byakomwe mu nkokora n’ibikoresho bitakoraga neza byakozwe na leta y’Amerika muri Gashyantare, kuba leta y’Amerika itaremeje ibikoresho bitakozwe na yo (nk’ibyakozwe na za kaminuza, amasosiyete n’ibitaro) kugeza mu mpera za Gashyantare, n’amabwiriza abemerewe gupimwa kugeza mu ntangiriro za Werurwe basabwaga gukurikiza (nyuma y’aho hasabwaga orudonanse ya muganga).
By 27 February, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.
Kugeza ku ya 27 Gashyantare, ikinyamakuru cya The Washington Post cyatangaje ko hapimwe gusa abantu 4 000 muri Amerika.
By 13 March, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
Kugeza ku ya 13 Werurwe, ikinyamakuru cya The Atlantic cyatangaje ko hamaze gupimwa gusa abantu 14 000.

On 22 March, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited hours or days for a test."After the first death in the United States was reported in Washington state on 29 February, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was soon followed by other states.

Ku ya 22 Werurwe, ikinyamakuru cya Associated Press cyatangaje ko: "Abantu benshi bafite ibimenyetso na orudonanse ya muganga bategereje amasaha cyangwa iminsi kugira ngo bapimwe”. Nyuma y’aho umuntu wa mbere apfiriye muri Amerika muri Washington tariki ya 29 Gashyantare, Guverineri Jay Inslee yatangaje ibihe bidasanzwe muri leta, izindi leta na zo zihita zibitangaza.

Schools in the Seattle area cancelled classes on 3 March, and by mid-March, schools across the country were shutting down.On 6 March 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.

Amashuri yo mu gace ka Seattle yahagaritse amasomo tariki ya 3 Werurwe, naho hagati muri Werurwe, amashuri yo mu gihugu yose yarafunze. Ku ya 6 Werurwe 2020, Amerika yagiriwe inama n’itsinda ry’impuguke mu by’ibyorezo ryo muri Imperial College London ku ngaruka koronavirusi nshya yagira ku gihugu.

On the same day President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding for federal agencies to respond to the outbreak.
Kuri uwo munsi Perezida Trump yashyize umukono ku Itegeko ryo kurwanya koronavirusi, ryatanze miriyari 8,3 z’amadorali yo gufasha ibikorwa byihutirwa by’ibigo by’Amerika mu kurwanya icyorezo.
Corporations imposed employee travel restrictions, cancelled conferences, and encouraged employees to work from home.
Amasosiyete yahagaritse ingendo z’abakozi, ahagarika inama, anashishikariza abakozi ba yo gukorera mu rugo.
Sports events and seasons were cancelled.On 11 March, Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe, excluding the United Kingdom, for 30 days, effective 13 March.
Ibikorwa bya siporo na za shampiyona byarahagaritswe. Ku ya 11 Werurwe, Trump yatangaje ko ahagaritse ingendo ziva mu Burayi, hatarimo Ubwongereza mu minsi 30 bigatangira ku ya 13 Werurwe.
The following day, he expanded the restrictions to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.
Umunsi wakurikiyeho, mu bihugu bibujijwe yongeyeho Ubwongereza na Irelande.
On 13 March, he declared a national emergency, which made federal funds available to respond to the crisis.
Ku ya 13 Werurwe, yatangaje ko igihugu kiri mu bihe bidasanzwe, byatumye haboneka inkunga y’Amerika mu kurwanya icyorezo.
Beginning on 15 March, many businesses closed or reduced hours throughout the U.S. to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
Guhera ku ya 15 Werurwe, ibikorwa by’ubucuruzi byinshi byarafunze cyangwa bigabanya amasaha y’akazi muri Amerika yose mu rwego rwo kugabanya ikwirakwira rya virusi.

By 17 March, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and in the District of Columbia.On 23 March, it was reported that New York City had 10,700 cases of the coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.

Kugeza ku ya 17 Werurwe, hari hamaze kwemezwa ko icyerezo cyageze muri leta zose uko ari 50 n’Akarere ka Columbia. Ku ya 23 Werurwe, hatangajwe ko umujyi wa New York wari ufite abantu 10 700 banduye koronavirusi, baruta abanduye bose muri Koreya y’Epfo.
On 25 March, the governor said that social distancing seemed to be working, as estimates of case doubling slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.
Ku ya 25 Werurwe, guverineri yavuze ko kwirinda kwegerana bisa nk’aho biri kugenda neza, aho kugira ngo imibare y’abanduye yikube kabiri byasabaga iminsi 2,0 noneho bikaba bisaba iminsi 4,7.

As of 28 March, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus.On 26 March, the United States was reported to have more confirmed coronavirus infection cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.

Ku ya 28 Werurwe, abantu 32 308 bari bamaze kwemezwa ko banduye mu mujyi wa New York, aho muri bo 672 bishwe na virusi. Ku ya 26 Werurwe, Amerika yatangaje ko ifite abantu banduye koronavirusi kurusha ikindi gihugu cyose cyo ku isi, harimo Ubushinwa n’Ubutaliyani. Kugeza ku ya 8 Mata, hemejwe ko handuye abantu 400 335 muri Amerika, naho abantu 12 841 barapfa.
Per media reports on 30 March, U.S. President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until 30 April.
Hakurikijwe amakuru tariki ya 30 Werurwe, Perezida w’Amerika Trump yafashe icyemezo cyo kongera amabwiriza yo kwirinda kwegerana kugeza ku ya 30 Mata.
On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, made anchor in New York.
Kuri uwo munsi, ubwato bwa USNS Comfort burimo ibitaro n’ibitanda 1000, bwageze ku mwaro w’i New York.
On 3 April, the U.S. had a record 884 deaths due to the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.
Ku ya 3 Mata, muri Amerika hari hamaze gupfa abantu 884 bishwe na koronavirusi mu masaha 24.

In the state of New York the cases have exceeded 100,000 people on 3 April.The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling the messaging by directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications related to the virus with the office of Vice-President Mike Pence.

Ku ya 3 Mata, muri leta ya New York abanduye bari bamaze kurenga ku 100 000. Perezidansi y’Amerika yanenzwe gupfobya icyorezo no kugenzura ubutumwa butangwa maze igaha amabwiriza abayobozi b’ibigo by’ubuzima n’impuguke mu by’ubuvuzi kugenzura amagambo n’inyandiko bigenewe rubanda n’ibitangazwa n’Ibiro bya Visi Perezida, Mike Pence.
Overall approval of Trump's management of the crisis has been polarized along partisan lines.
Muri rusange, kwemeza uko Trump yitwaye muri iki cyorezo ntibyagiye bivugwaho rumwe n’abamushyigikiye.
Some U.S. officials and commentators criticized the U.S. reliance on importation of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.
Bamwe mu bayobozi b’Amerika n’abanyamakuru bagiye banenga Amerika ku kuba yitabaza gutumiza mu Bushinwa ibikoresho bya ngombwa, harimo ibikoresho by’ubuvuzi by’ibanze.
An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.
Hasesenguwe ingendo z’indege mu kumenya no guteganya uko icyorezo kizakwirakwira maze bitangazwa mu kinyamakuru cya The Journal of Travel Medicine hagati muri Mutarama 2020.
Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the largest volume of travellers from Wuhan.
Hashingiwe ku makuru yo mu 2018 yatanzwe n’Ishyirahamwe ry’ingendo z’indege (IATA), Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo na Taipei byagize umubare munini w’abakora ingendo bava muri Wuhan.
Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
Dubai, Sydney, na Melbourne na byo byavuzweho kuba bikunda gusurwa n’abavuye muri Wuhan.

Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.

Bali yavuzweho kuba umwe mu mijyi 20 ikunda gusurwa ariko utiteguye neza guhangana n’icyorezo, mu gihe imijyi yo muri Ositaraliya yo yari yiteguye neza. Ku ya 7 Gashyantare, Ositaraliya yatangaje Gahunda yo kurwanya ubwoko bushya bwa koronavirusi (COVID-19).
It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
Yavuze ko hari byinshi bikwiye gushakishwa ku byerekeye COVID-19, kandi Ositaraliya ikaba igiye kwibanda cyane ku kugenzura imipaka no guhanahana amakuru ku kurwanya icyorezo.
On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
Ku ya 21 Werurwe, Ositaraliya yatangaje itegeko rigenga kurwanya virusi no kurinda abaturage.

Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.

Hakurikijwe umusaruro wavuye mu guhagarika ingendo rusange muri Wuhan muri Hubei, ibihugu byinshi byateganyije gucyura abaturage n’abadiporomate babyo, ahanini hakoreshejwe indege zibacyura mu bihugu byabo, naho inzego z’Ubushinwa zigatanga ibyangombwa bikenewe.
Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
Kanada, Amerika, Ubuyapani, Ubuhinde, Siri Lanka, Ositaraliya, Ubufaransa, Arijantina, Ubudage na Tayilande biri mu bihugu bya mbere byateguye gucyura abaturage babyo.
Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
Pakisitani yavuze ko itazacyura abaturage bayo bavuye mu Bushinwa.
On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
Ku ya 7 Gashyantare, Burezili yacyuye abanyaburezili 34 cyangwa abagize imiryango biyongera ku banyapolonye bane, umushinwa n’umuhinde.
The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
Abaturage ba Polonye, Ubushinwa n’Ubuhinde bahinduriwe indege muri Polonye, aho indege yo muri Burezili yahagaze gato mbere yo gukomeza urugendo igana muri Burezili.
Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
Abanyaburezili bagiye muri Wuhan bashyizwe mu kato mu kigo cya gisirikare kiri hafi y’umujyi wa Brasília.
On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.

Kuri uwo munsi, abanyakanada 215 (176 bo mu ndege ya mbere na 39 bo mu ndege ya kabiri yatanzwe na leta y’Amerika) bacyuwe bavuye muri Wuhan bajya i CFB Trenton kugira ngo bashyirwe mu kato k’ibyumweru bibiri.
On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
Ku ya 11 Gashyantare, indi ndege itwaye abanyakanada 185 ivuye Wuhan yaguye muri CFB Trenton.
Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
Ku ya 3 no ku ya 4 Gashyantare, inzego za Ositaraliya zacyuye abaturage 277 zibajyana muri gereza ya Christmas Island, yahinduwemo ahashyirwa abari mu kato, bakahaguma iminsi 14.
A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.

Indege yari icyuye abasubiye muri Nuveli Zelande yageze ku kibuga cy’indege cya Auckland ku ya 5 Gashyantare; abari bayirimo (harimo n’abaturuka muri Ositaraliya n’ibirwa bya Pasifika) bashyizwe mu kato ku kigo cya gisirikare cya Whangaparoa, mu majyaruguru ya Auckland.
On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
Ku ya 15 Gashyantare, Amerika yatangaje ko izacyura abanyamerika bari mu bwato bwa Diamond Princess.
On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
Ku ya 21 Gashyantare, indege yari itwaye abagenzi b’abanyakanada 129 ibacyuye ibakuye mu bwato bwa Diamond Princess yaguye i Trenton, muri Ontario.

In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.

Mu ntangiriro za Werurwe, leta y’Ubuhinde yatangiye gucyura abaturage bayo ibakuye muri Irani. Ku ya 14 Werurwe, indege y’isosiyete ya South African Airways yatanzwe na leta y’Afurika y’Epfo yacyuye abanyafurika y’Epfo112.
Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
Habanje gukorwa ibizamini byo kwa muganga, aho abanyafurika y’Epfo bane bagaragaje ibimenyetso bya koronavirusi basizwe mu rwego rwo kugabanya ibyago.
Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
Abanyafurika y’Epfo batagaragaje ibimenyetso ni bo bonyine bacyuwe.

Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.

ibisubizo by’ibizamini byagaragaje ko abanyafurika y’Epfo bose, harimo abakozi bo mu ndege, abapirote, abakora muri hoteri n’abasirikare bari mu bikorwa by’ubutabazi bose, mu rwego rwo kwirinda, bakomeje kugenzurwa banashyirwa mu kato k’iminsi 14 mu nyubako ya The Ranch Resort.
On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
Ku ya 20 Werurwe, Amerika yatangiye kugarura mu gihugu igice kimwe cy’abasirikare bari muri Irake bitewe n’icyorezo.
On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
Ku ya 5 Gashyantare, Minisiteri w’ububanyi n’amahanga w’Ubushinwa yavuze ko ibihugu 21 (harimo Belarusi, Pakisitani, Tirinidadi na Tobago, Misiri na Irani) byoherereje imfashanyo Ubushinwa.

Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.

Bamwe mu banyeshuri b’abashinwa biga muri kaminuza zo muri Amerika bahuje imbaraga mu gufasha kohereza imfashanyo mu bice by’Ubushinwa byugarijwe n’icyorezo, aho itsinda rigari ryo muri Chicago ryakusanyije udupfukamunwa two mu bwoko bwa N95 tugera ku 50 000 duhabwa ibitaro byo mu ntara ya Hubei tariki ya 30 Mutarama. Umuryango w’ubutabazi wa Direct Relief, ufatanyije na FedEx, wohereje udupfukamunwa 200 000 n’indi myambaro yo kwikingira yabugenewe, harimo uturindantoki n’amakanzu, byajyanywe mu ndege idasanzwe yabijyanye ku bitaro bya Wuhan Union ku ya 30 Mutarama.
On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".

Ku ya 5 Gashyantare, Bill na Melinda Gates batangaje ko bahaye inkunga ya miriyoni 100 z’amadorari OMS mu gufasha mu bikorwa byo gukora ubushakashatsi ku rukingo n’umuti ndetse no kurinda "abaturage bafite ibyago byinshi bo muri Afurika na Aziya".
Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.

Tereviziyo ya Interaksyon yatangaje ko leta y’Ubushinwa yahaye udupfukamunwa 200 000 Filipine ku itariki ya 6 Gashyantare, nyuma y’aho Senateri Richard Gordon yohereje udupfukamunwa miriyoni 3,16 muri Wuhan.
On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.
Ku ya 19 Gashyantare, Umuryango wa Singapore Red Cross watangaje ko uzohereza imfashanyo ifite agaciro ka miriyoni 2,26 z’amadorari mu Bushinwa.

Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey dispatched medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries.After cases in China seemed to stabilize, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.

Ubuyapani bwatanze miriyoni imwe y’udupfukamunwa muri Wuhan, Turikiya yohereje ibikoresho by’ubuvuzi, Uburusiya bwohereza izindi toni z’ibikoresho by’ubuvuzi muri Wuhan, Maleziya itangaza ko itanze inkunga ya miriyoni 18 z’udupfukamunwa mu Bushinwa, Ubudage bwatanze ibikoresho by’ubuvuzi bitandukanye harimo 10 000 by’imyambaro yo kwikingira yabugenewe naho Amerika itanga toni 17,8 z’ibikoresho by’ubuvuzi mu Bushinwa inasezeranya gutanga izindi miriyoni 100 z’amadorari yo gufasha mu rwego rw’ubukungu ibindi bihugu byahuye n’icyorezo. Umubare w’abandura mu Bushinwa umaze kugabanuka, iki gihugu kikaba kiri kohereza imfashanyo mu bihugu bitandukanye byazahajwe n’icyorezo.
In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.
Muri Werurwe, Ubushinwa, Kiba n'Uburusiya byohereje ibikoresho by'ubuvuzi n'inzobere zo gufasha Ubutaliyani guhangana n'icyorezo cya koronavirusi.
Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.

Umunyemari Jack Ma yohereje ibikoresho byo gupima indwara miriyoni 1,1, udupfukamunwa miriyoni 6, ndetse n'imyambaro y'ubwirinzi 60 000 i Addis Abeba, muri Etiyopiya kugira ngo bikwirakwizwe n'Umuryango w'Ubumwe bw'Afurika.
He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.
Nyuma yanohereje muri Panama ibikoresho byo gupima indwara 5 000, udupfukamunwa 100 000 n'imashini zifasha guhumeka 5.
Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada.The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.

Ma yanahaye kandi Kanada ibikoresho by'ubuvuzi. Ubuholandi, Esipanye, Turukiya, Jeworujiya, na Repubulika ya Ceki byagaragaje impungenge zabyo kubera udupfukamunwa n'ibikoresho byo gupima indwara byakorewe mu Bushinwa.
For instance, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.

Nk'urugero, Esipanye yahagaritse ikoreshwa ry'ibikoresho 58 000 bipima koronavirusi byakorewe mu Bushinwa byari bifite ubuziranenge ku kigero cya 30%, hagati aho, Ubuholandi bwavanye ku isoko udupfukamunwa 600 000 twakorewe mu Bushinwa kuko twari dufite inenge.
Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.
Ububiligi bwavanye ku isoko udupfukamunwa 100 000 tudashobora gukoreshwa bikekwa ko twavuye mu Bushinwa, ariko mu by'ukuri twaturutse muri Kolombiya.
On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.

Ku rundi ruhande, imfashanyo zatanzwe n'Ubushinwa zakiriwe neza mu bice by'Amerika y'Epfo n'Afurika. Ku ya 2 Mata, Banki y'Isi yatangije ibikorwa byo gutabara byihutirwa mu bihugu biri mu nzira y'amajyambere.
The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku Buzima ryashimye ibikorwa by'abayobozi b'Ubushinwa mu gucunga no gukumira icyorezo.

The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".

Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku Buzima ryavuze ko hari itandukaniro hagati y'icyorezo cya SARS cyo mu 2002-2004, aho abayobozi b'Ubushinwa bashinjwaga kukigira ibanga bikabangamira ingamba zo kucyirinda no kugikumira, ndetse n'icyorezo kiriho ubu aho leta "yagiye itanga amakuru ahoraho kugira ngo abantu batagira ubwoba mbere y'ibiruhuko by'Umwaka mushya".

On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.

Ku ya 23 Mutarama, nyuma y'icyemezo cy'ubuyobozi bukuru cyo gushyira mu bikorwa icyemezo cyo guhagarika ubwikorezi muri Wuhan, uhagarariye Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku Buzima, Gauden Galea, yavuze ko nubwo "atari icyifuzo cyatanzwe na OMS ", ko na byo byari "ikimenyetso gikomeye cy'ubushake bwo gukumira iki cyorezo aho kimaze kugaragara cyane" maze acyita "akataraboneka mu mateka y'ubuzima rusange". Ku ya 30 Mutarama, nyuma y'uko hemejwe ko abantu banduza abandi hanze y'Ubushinwa ndetse ko n'imibare y'abanduye ikomeje kwiyongera mu bindi bihugu, Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku Buzima ryatangaje ko iki cyorezo ari Ikibazo cyihutirwa cy'ubuzima rusange gisaba Ubutabazi Mpuzamahanga (PHEIC), ikibazo nk'iki kikaba ari ubwa gatandatu kibayeho kubera ko ingamba nk'izi zafashwe mu gihe cy'icyorezo cy'ibicurane by'ingurube mu 2009.
WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that the PHEIC was due to "the risk of global spread, especially to low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.

Umuyobozi mukuru w'Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku Buzima, Tedros Adhanom, yavuze ko PHEIC iterwa n'ibyago byo gukwirakwira ku isi, cyane cyane mu bihugu bikennye n'ibifite ubukungu buciriritse bidafite inzego z'ubuzima zikomeye.

In response to the implementations of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that the "WHO doesn't recommend limiting trade and movement."

Mu bijyanye n'ishyirwa mu bikorwa ry'ingamba zo guhagarika ingendo, Tedros yavuze ko "nta mpamvu yo gushyiraho ingamba zitari ngombwa zibangamira urujya n'uruza rw'abantu ndetse n'ubucuruzi" kandi ko "OMS idasaba ko habaho guhagarika ubucuruzi n'ingendo."

On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".

Ku ya 5 Gashyantare, OMS yasabye ibihugu gutanga inkunga ingana na miriyoni 675 z'amadorari zo gutera inkunga ingamba zo kwitegura iki cyorezo mu bihugu bikennye, ivuga ko byihutirwa gutera inkunga ibyo bihugu "bidasanzwe bifite gahunda zo gutahura abantu banduye virusi, ndetse n'ubwo yaba izagaragara".

Tedros further made statements declaring that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay more later".On 11 February, the WHO in a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.

Tedros yanatangaje ko "twese twagira imbaraga nk'uko duhuriye ku kugira intege nke" kandi asaba amahanga "gushora imari uyu munsi cyangwa akazishyura byinshi nyuma yaho". Ku ya 11 Gashyantare, mu kiganiro n'abanyamakuru, OMS yemeje ko COVID -19 ari ryo zina ry'iyi ndwara.
On the same day, Tedros stated that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide the "power of the entire UN system in the response".
Kuri uwo munsi, Tedros yatangaje ko Umunyamabanga Mukuru w'Umuryango w'Abibumbye António Guterres yemeye gutanga "imbaraga zose z'Umuryango w'Abibumbye mu gushaka igisubizo".

A UN Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental implications of the outbreak".

Bityo hashyizweho Itsinda ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye rishinzwe guhangana n'ibibazo, rigahuza ibikorwa byose by'Umuryango w'Abibumbye, Ishami ry'uwo Muryango ryita ku Buzima rivuga ko bizatuma "bibanda cyane ku butabazi mu rwego rw'ubuzima mu gihe andi mashami ashobora kuzana ubunararibonye bwayo mu guhangana n'ingaruka zatewe n'icyorezo mu rwego rw'imibereho myiza, ubukungu, n'iterambere muri rusange".

On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".

Ku wa 14 Gashyantare, hashyizweho Itsinda rihuriweho riyobowe na OMS rifatanyije n'Ubushinwa hagamijwe gutoranya inzobere zo ku rwego mpuzamahanga n'iza OMS zoherejwe mu Bushinwa kugira ngo zizabafashe gucunga no kugenzura ibijyanye n'ubukana n'ikwirakwira ry'indwara" hakorwa amahugurwa n'inama n'inzego z'ingenzi mu gihugu no gusura ahantu hatandukanye mu rwego rwo gusuzuma "ingaruka ibikorwa byo kurwanya indwara bishobora kugira ku rwego rw'intara n'uturere harimo n'ibice by'icyaro ndetse n'imijyi." Ku wa 25 Gashyantare, OMS ryatangaje ko "isi ikwiye gukora ibirenzeho mu kwitegura guhangana indwara ya koronavirusi," itangaza ko nubwo hakiri kare mu kuba iyi virusi yakwitwa icyorezo, ibihugu bigomba "gutangira kwitegura".

In response to a developing outbreak in Iran, the WHO sent a Joint Mission Team there to assess the situation.On 28 February, WHO officials said that the coronavirus threat assessment at the global level would be raised from "high" to "very high", its highest level of alert and risk assessment.

Mu rwego rwo guhangana n'icyorezo kigenda cyiyongera muri Irani, OMS yoherejeyo itsinda rihuriweho kugira ngo risuzume uko ibintu bimeze. Ku wa 28 Gashyantare, abayobozi ba OMS bavuze ko isuzuma ry'ubukana bwa koronavirusi ku rwego rw'isi rizazamurwa rikava ku rwego rwo "hejuru" rikagera ku rwego rwo "hejuru cyane", ari na rwo rwego rwayo rwo hejuru rwo kuburira no gusuzuma ingaruka.
Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned in a statement that "This is a reality check for every government on the planet: Wake up.
Mike Ryan, umuyobozi nshingwabikorwa ushinzwe gahunda z'ubutabazi za OMS, yaburiye abantu avuga ko "Iki ari igipimo nyakuri kuri buri gihugu cyo ku isi yose: Mukanguke.
This virus may be on its way and you need to be ready," urging that the right response measures could help the world avoid "the worst of it".
Iyi virusi iri kudusatira kandi mugomba kwitegura," ashimangira ko ingamba zihamye zo guhangana na yo zishobora gufasha mu kwirinda "akaga katewe na yo".

Ryan further stated that the current data did not warrant public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration would mean "we're essentially accepting that every human on the planet will be exposed to that virus."

Ryan yanakomeje avuga ko amakuru yari ariho atigeze atuma abashinzwe ubuzima rusange batangaza ko ari icyorezo cyugarije isi, avuga ko kubitangaza byaba bisobanuye ko "mu by'ukuri twemera ko buri muntu wese ku isi azagerwaho n'iyo virusi."
On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.
Ku itariki ya 11 Werurwe, OMS yatangaje ko koronavirusi ari icyorezo.
