The Director-General said that the WHO was "deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction".The WHO has faced significant criticism for what is seen as inadequate handling of the pandemic, including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.

Umuyobozi Mukuru yavuze ko OMS "ihangayikishijwe cyane n'ubwiyongere bw'umuvuduko ukabije ndetse no kutagira ingamba zifatwa". OMS yanenzwe bikomeye ibyagaragaraga nko kutagira ingamba zihamye zo gukumira icyorezo, twavuga nk'itangazo ryavugaga ku bijyanye n'amakuba y'ubuzima rusange no gushyira iyi virusi mu ndwara z'ibyorezo.
The backlash included a petition for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of 6 April.
Mu byamaganwe harimo icyifuzo gisaba ko Umuyobozi Mukuru wa OMS, Tedros Adhanom yegura, kugeza tariki ya 6 Mata, ubu busabe bukaba bwari bumaze gushyirwaho umukono n'abantu 733 000.
On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Ku ya 26 Werurwe 2020, impuguke z'Umuryango w'Abibumbye zita ku burenganzira bwa muntu zashimangiye kubahiriza uburenganzira bwa buri muntu mu gihe cy'icyorezo cya COVID-19.
The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.
Iri tsinda ry'impuguke ryatangaje ko buri muntu afite uburenganzira ku bikorwa bitabara ubuzima bwe kandi ko ari ishingano ya leta.
The group stressed that the lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.
Iri tsinda ryashimangiye ko kubura amikoro cyangwa ubwishingizi bw'ubuzima bitagomba na rimwe kuba impamvu yo kuvangura itsinda ryihariye.

The experts underscored that every individual has the right to health, including people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, older people, internally displaced people, the homeless, those living in extremely poor conditions, people in detention, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups in need of government support.

Izi mpuguke zashimangiye ko buri muntu afite uburenganzira ku buzima, harimo n'abafite ubumuga, abo mu matsinda ya banyamuke, abantu bakuze, abavuye mu byabo, abatagira aho baba, ababa mu bukene bukabije, abantu bafunzwe, ndetse n'impunzi n'andi matsinda atihariye baba bakeneye ubufasha bwa leta.
International governmental organizations are addressing the economic and social impacts of the COVID-19 crisis.
Imiryango mpuzamahanga ihuriweho na za leta iri gukemura ibibazo by'ubukungu n'imibereho myiza byatewe n'icyorezo cya COVID-19.

The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched a platform to provide timely and comprehensive information on policy responses in countries around the world, as well as viewpoints and advice.

Umuryango w'Ubufatanye mu Bukungu n'Iterambere watangije urubuga rwo gutanga amakuru yuzuye kandi abonekera ku gihe ku bijyanye na politiki zitanga ibisubizo kuri iki kibazo mu bihugu byo ku isi, n'ibitekerezo n'inama binyuranye.

From policies to strengthen health systems and the world economy to addressing the effects of lockdown and restrictions on travel, the digital hub includes a Country Policy Tracker, and aims to help countries learn from each other and to facilitate a co-ordinated global response to the coronavirus challenge.

Uhereye kuri politiki zo kongerera ubushobozi inzego z'ubuzima n'iz'ubukungu ku rwego rw'isi hagamijwe gukumira ingaruka ziterwa na gahunda ya guma mu rugo no kugabanya urujya n'uruza rw'abantu, ingamba zafashwe zishingiye ku ikoranabuhanga zirimo Uburyo bwo gushakisha abahuye n'ubwandu, kandi zigamije no gufasha ibihugu kwigira ku bindi no kubifasha guhuriza hamwe ingamba mpuzamahanga zigamije guhangana na koronavirusi.

The Chinese government has been criticized by the United States, UK Minister for the Cabinet Office Michael Gove, and Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro's son Eduardo Bolsonaro for its handling of the pandemic, which began in the Chinese province of Hubei.

Guverinoma y'Ubushinwa yanenzwe na Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika, Minisitiri w'Ubwongereza ushinzwe Inama y'Abaminisitiri, Michael Gove, na Eduardo Bolsonaro, umuhungu wa Perezida wa Burezile, Jair Bolsonaro, kubera uburyo bwitwaye muri iki cyorezo cyatangiriye mu ntara ya Hubei.

A number of provincial-level administrators of the Communist Party of China (CPC) were dismissed over their handling of the quarantine efforts in Central China, a sign of discontent with the political establishment's response to the outbreak in those regions.

Abayobozi benshi bo ku rwego rw'intara mu Ishyaka rya gikomunisiti ry'Ubushinwa (CPC) birukanwe kubera uko bitwaye mu kibazo cyo gushyira abantu mu kato mu Bushinwa bwo hagati, kikaba ari ikimenyetso cy'uko batishimiye ingamba inzego za politiki zafashe mu rwego rwo kurwanya icyorezo muri utwo turere.
Some commentators believe that this move was intended to protect Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping from the public's anger over the coronavirus outbreak.

Bamwe mu batanze ibitekerezo bemeza ko iki cyemezo cyari kigamije kurinda Umunyamabanga Mukuru w'Ishyaka rya Gikomunisiti ry'Abashinwa Xi Jinping uburakari bw'abaturage kubera icyorezo cya koronavirusi.

Some Chinese officials, e.g. Zhao Lijian rejected an earlier acknowledgement of the coronavirus outbreak starting in Wuhan, in favour of conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 originating from the U.S. or Italy.

Bamwe mu bayobozi b'Abashinwa, barimo Zhao Lijian banze ko hamenyekana mbere ko icyorezo cya koronavirusi cyatangiriye i Wuhan, bashyigikira inyigisho zo kuyobya uburari zerekeye COVID-19 zikomoka muri Amerika cyangwa mu Butaliyani.

The U.S. administration of Donald Trump has referred to the coronavirus as "Chinese virus" or "Wuhan virus" saying that China's "censorship supercharged a virus that has now turned into a global pandemic", which has in turn been criticized by some critics as racism and "distract[ing] from his administration's failure to contain the disease".

Ubuyobozi bwa Donald Trump muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika bwise koronavirusi "virusi y'Abashinwa" cyangwa "Virusi y'i Wuhan" buvuga ko Ubushinwa bwahishe amakuru bigatuma virusi igira ingufu ziyigira icyorezo mpuzamahanga. Ibi ariko byagawe cyane n'abantu bamwe babifashe nk'ivangura no kurangaza abantu ngo batabona ko ubutegetsi bwe bwagize intege nke mu gukumira icyo cyorezo.

The Daily Beast obtained a U.S. government cable outlining a communications stratagem with apparent origins in the National Security Council, with the strategy being quoted as "Everything is about China.

Urubuga rwitwa "The Daily Beast" rwabonye amakuru ya Guverinoma ya Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika yerekeye ingamba z'itumanaho bikekwa ko yakomotse mu Kanama gashinzwe Umutekano w'igihugu, aho izo ngamba zavuzweho ko "Zose zerekeye Ubushinwa.

We're being told to try and get this messaging out in any way possible, including press conferences and television appearances."Outlets such as Politico, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg have claimed that China's efforts to send aid to virus-stricken countries is part of a propaganda push for global influence.

Tubwirwa ko tugomba gukora ibishoboka byose, ubu butumwa tukabukwiza aho ari ho hose nko mu biganiro n'abanyamakuru na za televiziyo. "Ibinyamakuru nka Politico, Foreign Policy, na Bloomberg byagaragaje ko imbaraga Ubushinwa bukoresha bwohereza inkunga mu bindi bihugu ari uburyo bwo kugira ngo bugire ijambo rikomeye ku isi.
EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell warned that there is "a geo-political component including a struggle for influence through spinning and the 'politics of generosity'".

Umuyobozi ushinzwe politiki mpuzamahanga mu Muryango w'Ubumwe bw'Uburayi, Josep Borrell yaburiye abantu avuga ko harimo ikibazo cy'imibanire ya politiki hagati y'ibihugu harimo no kurwanira kuganza ibindi bihugu binyuze mu kwigaragaza neza ndetse 'na politiki y'ubugiraneza'".
Borrell also said that "China is aggressively pushing the message that, unlike the US, it is a responsible and reliable partner."
Borrell yanavuze kandi ko "Ubushinwa bwatanze ubutumwa bweruye ko, bitandukanye na Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika, bwo ari umufatanyabikorwa mwiza kandi wo kwiringirwa."
China has also called for the US to lift its sanctions off of Syria, Venezuela and Iran, while reportedly sending aid to the latter two countries.
Ubushinwa kandi bwasabye ko Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika zikuraho ibihano zafatiye Siriya, Venezuwela na Irani, mu gihe kandi bivugwa ko Ubushinwa bwanohereje inkunga muri Venezuwela na Irani.
Jack Ma's donation of 100,000 masks to Cuba was blocked by US sanctions on 3 April.
Ku ya 3 Mata, impano ya Jack Ma y'udupfukamunwa 100 000 twagombaga kujya muri Kiba twarafatiriwe kubera ibihano bya Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika.
US authorities have also been accused of diverting aid meant for other nations to their own country.
Abayobozi ba Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika barashinjwa kandi kuba barayobereje iwabo inkunga yari igenewe ibindi bihugu.
And there have been mask-related disputes reported between other countries, such as Germany, Austria and Switzerland; and the Czech Republic and Italy.
Hari kandi izindi mpaka zerekeye udupfukamunwa zavutse hagati y'ibindi bihugu; nk'Ubudage, Otirishe n'Ubusuwisi; ndetse no hagati ya Repubulika ya Ceki n'Ubutaliyani.
In addition, Turkey seized hundreds of ventilators destined for Spain.
Na none kandi, Turukiya yafatiriye imashini amagana zifasha guhumeka zari zigiye muri Esipanye.
In early March, the Italian government criticized the European Union's lack of solidarity with coronavirus-affected Italy.
Mu ntangiriro za Werurwe, Leta y'Ubutaliyani yanenze Umuryango w'Ubumwe bw'Uburayi kuba utaragaragarije Ubutaliyani ubufatanye mu gihe bwari buzahajwe na koronavirusi.
Maurizio Massari, Italy's ambassador to the EU, said that "Only China responded bilaterally.
Maurizio Massari, ambasaderi w'Ubutaliyani mu Muryango w'Ubumwe bw'Uburayi yavuze ko "Ubushinwa bwonyine ari bwo bwafashije Ubutaliyani.
Certainly, this is not a good sign of European solidarity."
Mu by'ukuri, ibi si ikimenyetso cyiza cy'ubufatanye bw'Uburayi."

On 22 March, after a phone call with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, Russian president Vladimir Putin arranged the Russian army to send military medics, special disinfection vehicles, and other medical equipment to Italy.

Ku ya 22 Werurwe, nyuma yo kuganira kuri telefoni na Minisitiri w'Intebe w'Ubutaliyani Giuseppe Conte, Perezida w'Uburusiya Vladimir Putin yateguye igisirikare cy'Uburusiya kugira ngo cyohereze mu Butaliyani abasirikare b'abaganga, ibinyabiziga bitera imiti yica udukoko twanduza, n'ibindi bikoresho byo mu buvuzi.
Italy's La Stampa newspaper cited an anonymous "high-level political source" that 80 percent of Russia's aid was "useless or of little use to Italy".

Ikinyamakuru cyo mu Butaliyani cyitwa La Stampa cyifashishije "amakuru gikuye ku muyobozi wo mu rwego rwo hejuru" kitavuze izina avuga ko 80% by'inkunga y'Uburusiya "ari imfabusa cyangwa ntacyo imariye cyane Ubutaliyani".
The source accused Russia of embarking on a "geopolitical and diplomatic" charm offensive.
Uwatanze ayo makuru yashinjaga Uburusiya kuba bushaka gutera "ikibazo cya politiki na dipolomasi" hagati y'ibihugu.
The President of Lombardy, Attilio Fontana, and Italian Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio dismissed the media reports and expressed their gratitude.
Perezida wa Lombaridi, Attilio Fontana, na Minisitiri w'Ububanyi n'Amahanga w'Ubutaliyani, Luigi Di Maio, bahakanye ibitangazwa mu itangazamakuru kandi bagaragara bashimira Uburusiya.
Russia also sent a cargo plane with medical aid to the United States.
Uburusiya kandi bwohereje muri Amerika indege itwara imizigo irimo ubufasha bw'ibikoresho byo mu buvuzi.

Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that "when offering assistance to US colleagues, [Putin] assumes that when US manufacturers of medical equipment and materials gain momentum, they will also be able to reciprocate if necessary."

Umuvugizi wa Perezidansi y'Uburusiya, Dmitry Peskov, yaravuze ati "iyo Putin atanga ubufasha kuri bagenzi be bo muri Amerika, aba atekereza ko igihe Abanyamerika bakora ibikoresho by'ubuvuzi bagira imbaraga cyane bagatera imbere, na bo bazashobora kudufasha igihe bibaye ngombwa."
The planned NATO "Defender 2020" military exercise in Germany, Poland, and the Baltic states, the largest NATO war exercise since the end of the Cold War, will be held on a reduced scale.

Imyitozo ya gisirikare ya OTAN "Defender 2020" yari iteganijwe mu Budage, Polonye, no mu bihugu bya Balitike, akaba ari yo myitozo y'intambara ikomeye ya OTAN kuva intambara y'ubutita irangiye, izakorwa ku rugero ruto.

The Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament's general secretary Kate Hudson criticized the Defender 2020 exercise: "In the current public-health crisis, it jeopardizes the lives not only of the troops from the US and the many European countries participating but the inhabitants of the countries in which they are operating."The Iranian government has been heavily affected by the virus, with around two dozen parliament members infected as well as fifteen other current or former political figures.

Umunyamabanga Mukuru w'Ubukangurambaga bugamije kurwanya ikoreshwa ry'intwaro za kirimbuzi, Kate Hudson yanenze iyo myitozo ya gisirikare yiswe ‘Defender 2020': "Muri iki kibazo cy'ubuzima rusange turimo, ntikiri gushyira mu kaga ubuzima bw'abasirikare baturuka muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika n'ibindi bihugu byinshi byo mu Burayi gusa ahubwo n'ubw'abaturage batuye mu bihugu abo basirikare bakoreramo." Iyi virusi yibasiye bikomeye leta ya Irani, aho intumwa za rubanda zibarirwa muri makumyabiri n'enye ndetse n'abandi bantu bahoze ari abanyapolitiki bakomeye bayanduye.

Iran's President Hassan Rouhani wrote a public letter to world leaders asking for help on 14 March 2020, saying that his country is struggling to fight the outbreak due to lack of access to international markets as a result of the United States sanctions against Iran.The outbreak has prompted calls for the United States to adopt social policies common in other wealthy countries, including universal health care, universal child care, paid family leave, and higher levels of funding for public health.

Tariki ya 14 Werurwe 2020, Perezida wa Irani, Hassan Rouhani, yandikiye ibaruwa rusange abayobozi b'Isi abasaba ubufasha, yavugaga ko igihugu cye gifite ikibazo cyo guhangana n'icyorezo kubera ko kitabasha guhahirana n'amasoko mpuzamahanga bitewe n'ibihano Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika zafatiye Irani. Iki cyorezo cyatumye Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika zisabwa gushyiraho politiki zo guteza imbere imibereho myiza zisanzweho mu bindi bihugu bikize, harimo ubuvuzi rusange, kwita ku bana ku isi hose, ikiruhuko cy'imiryango gihemberwa, ndetse no gutera inkunga ku rwego rwo hejuru ubuzima rusange.

Political analysts anticipated it may negatively affect Donald Trump's chances of re-election in the 2020 presidential election.Diplomatic relations between Japan and South Korea worsened due to the pandemic.

Abasesenguzi mu bya politiki batekereje ko bishobora kugira ingaruka mbi ku mahirwe ya Donald Trump yo kongera gutorwa mu matora ya perezida yo mu 2020. Umubano w'ububanyi n'amahanga hagati y'Ubuyapani na Koreya y'Epfo warushijeho kuba mubi kubera iki cyorezo.
South Korea criticized Japan's "ambiguous and passive quarantine efforts" after Japan announced anybody coming from South Korea will be placed in two weeks' quarantine at government-designated sites.

Koreya y'Epfo yanenze Ubuyapani kubera "imbaraga bwakoresheje mu buryo budasobanutse bushyira abantu mu kato" nyuma y'uko Ubuyapani butangaje ko umuntu wese uzava muri Koreya y'Epfo azashyirwa mu kato mu byumweru bibiri ahantu hashyizweho na guverinoma.
The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
Abaturage ba Koreya y'Epfo babanje kutumva kimwe uburyo Perezida Moon Jae-in ari kwitwara muri iki kibazo.

Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.The pandemic has allowed countries to pass emergency legislation in response.

Abanyakoreya benshi bashyize umukono ku cyifuzo basaba ko Moon avanwa ku buyobozi kubera ibyo bavuga ko guverinoma yitwaye nabi mu guhangana n'iki cyorezo, cyangwa bagashimira uko yitwaye. Icyorezo cyatumye ibihugu bitora amategeko yihutirwa kugira ngo bihangane na cyo.
Some commentators have expressed concerns that it could allow governments to strengthen their grip on power.
Bamwe mu batanze ibitekerezo bagaragaje impungenge z'uko bishobora gutuma guverinoma itsimbarara ku butegetsi.

In Hungary, its parliament voted to allow the prime minister, Viktor Orbán, to rule by decree indefinitely, suspend parliament as well as elections and punish those deemed to have spread false information about the virus and the government's handling of the crisis.

Muri Hongiriya, Inteko Ishinga Amategeko yaho yatoye yemerera Minisitiri w'Intebe, Viktor Orbán, gutegeka mu gihe kitazwi, guhagarika Inteko Ishinga Amategeko ndetse n'amatora no guhana abafatwa nk'aho bakwirakwije amakuru y'ibinyoma kuri virusi ndetse n'uburyo guverinoma ikemura iki kibazo.

The coronavirus outbreak has been blamed for several instances of supply shortages, stemming from globally increased usage of equipment to fight the outbreaks, panic buying, and disruption to factory and logistic operations.

Icyorezo cya koronavirusi cyagiye gitera ingaruka nyinshi z'ibura ry'ibicuruzwa, biturutse ku kuba ku isi hariyongereye ikoreshwa ry'ibikoresho byifashishwa mu kurwanya ibyorezo, ku kuba abantu baraguze byinshi kubera ubwoba, no guhungabana kw'inganda n'ibikorwa byazo.
The United States Food and Drug Administration has issued warnings about shortages of drugs and medical equipment due to increased consumer demand and supplier disruption.

Ikigo gishinzwe imicungire y'Ibiribwa n'Imiti muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika cyatanze umuburo ku bijyanye n'ibura ry'imiti n'ibikoresho by'ubuvuzi kubera ko abaguzi babikeneye biyongereye ndetse n'ihungabana ry'abagemura ibicuruzwa.
Several localities also witnessed panic buying that led to shelves being cleared of grocery essentials such as food, toilet paper, and bottled water, inducing supply shortages.

Mu duce twinshi hagaragaye ko abantu baguze byinshi kubera ubwoba bituma bimwe mu bikoresho by'ingenzi bishira mu maduka nk'ibiribwa, impapuro z'isuku, amazi yo mu macupa, bituma habaho ikibazo cy'ibicuruzwa bike ku isoko.
The technology industry in particular has been warning about delays to shipments of electronic goods.
Inganda z'ikoranabuhanga by'umwihariko zateguje abantu ku byerekeye gutinda mu kohereza ibicuruzwa bya elegitoroniki.
According to WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom, the demand for personal protection equipment has risen 100-fold.
Nk'uko Umuyobozi Mukuru w'Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku Buzima, Tedros Adhanom, abitangaza, abakeneye ibikoresho byo kwirinda bikubye incuro 100.
This demand has led to the increase in prices of up to twenty times the normal price and also induced delays on the supply of medical items for four to six months.

Ibi byatumye ibiciro bizamuka byikuba incuro zigera kuri makumyabiri ugereranyije n'igiciro gisanzwe kandi binatera ubukererwe ku itangwa ry'ibikoresho by'ubuvuzi buva ku mezi ane kugeza kuri atandatu.
It has also caused a shortage of personal protective equipment worldwide, with the WHO warning that this will endanger health workers.
Byateje kandi ikibazo cy'ibura ry'ibikoresho byo kwirinda ku isi hose, OMS ivuga ko ibi bizashyira mu kaga ubuzima bw'abakozi bo mu rwego rw'ubuzima.
In Australia, the pandemic provided a new opportunity for daigou shoppers to sell Australian products into China.
Muri Ositaraliya, icyorezo cyatanze amahirwe mashya ku bakora ubucuruzi butemewe n'amategeko yo kugurisha mu Bushinwa ibicuruzwa byo muri Ositaraliya.

The activity has created a shortage of baby formula in some supermarkets and was subsequently banned by the Australian government.Despite the high prevalence of COVID-19 cases in Northern Italy and the Wuhan region, and the ensuing high demand for food products, both areas have been spared from acute food shortages.

Iki gikorwa cyatumye habaho igabanuka ry'amata y'abana mu mahahiro amwe n'amwe kandi nyuma yaho Guverinoma ya Ositaraliya yaje kubihagarika. Nubwo imibare y'abanduye COVID-19 yagiye yiyongera mu majyaruguru y'Ubutaliyani no mu ntara ya Wuhan, bikajyana n'izamuka ry'umubare w'abakeneye ibiribwa, muri utwo duce twombi nta kibazo gikomeye kijyanye n'ibura ry'ibiribwa bigeze bagira.

Measures by China and Italy against the hoarding and illicit trade of critical products have been successful, avoiding acute food shortages that were anticipated in Europe as well as in North America.

Ingamba z'Ubushinwa n'Ubutaliyani mu rwego rwo kurwanya abagura byinshi ku buryo bukabije n'ubucuruzi butemewe, zatanze umusaruro, bikaba byaratumye hatabaho kubura kw'ibiribwa nk'uko byari byitezwe mu Burayi no muri Amerika ya Ruguru.
Northern Italy with its significant agricultural production has not seen a large reduction, but prices may increase according to industry representatives.
Amajyaruguru y'Ubutaliyani asanzwe agira umusaruro mwinshi w'ubuhinzi, ntiwigeze ugabanuka cyane, ariko abahagarariye inganda batangaza ko ibiciro bishobora kuzamuka.
Empty food shelves were only encountered temporarily, even in Wuhan city, while Chinese government officials released pork reserves to assure sufficient nourishment of the population.
Amaduka y'ibiribwa arimo ubusa yabayeho igihe gito, ndetse no mu mujyi wa Wuhan, abayobozi ba Leta y'Ubushinwa bafunguye ahabikwa ibikomoka ku ngurube kugira ngo abaturage babone ibyo kurya bihagije.
Similar laws exist in Italy requiring food producers to keep reserves for such emergencies.
Amategeko nk'ayo asanzwe ariho mu Butaliyani asaba abakora ibiribwa gukomeza kubika mu bigega ibishobora kwitabazwa mu bihe bikomeye.

Damage to the global economy has been felt in China: according to a media report on 16 March, the economy in China was very hard hit in the first two months of 2020 due to the measures taken by the government to curtail virus spread, and retail sales plunged 20.5%.

Igihombo ku bukungu bw'isi cyageze no ku Bushinwa: nk'uko bitangazwa n'ibinyamakuru ku ya 16 Werurwe, ubukungu mu Bushinwa bwarahungabanye cyane mu mezi abiri ya mbere ya 2020 kubera ingamba Leta yafashe zo gukumira ikwirakwizwa rya virusi, n'ubucuruzi buranguza bwagabanutseho 20,5%.
As mainland China is a major economy and manufacturing hub, the viral outbreak has been seen to pose a major destabilizing threat to the global economy.
Kubera ko Ubushinwa bufite ubukungu n'urwego rw'inganda bikomeye, icyorezo cy'iyi virusi cyagaragaye nk'imbogamizi ikomeye ku bukungu bw'isi.
Agathe Demarais of the Economist Intelligence Unit has forecast that markets will remain volatile until a clearer image emerges on potential outcomes.
Agathe Demarais wo mu ishami ry'ubutasi muri ‘The Economist' yatangaje ko amasoko azakomeza guhungabana kugeza igihe hagaragaye ishusho isobanutse neza ku musaruro ushobora kuboneka.
In January 2020, some analysts estimated that the economic fallout of the epidemic on global growth could surpass that of the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak.
Muri Mutarama 2020, abasesenguzi bamwe bagaragaje ko ihungabana ry'ubukungu ritewe n'ingaruka iki cyorezo cyagize ku izamuka ry'ubukungu bw'isi rishobora kurenga iry'icyorezo cya SARS mu 2002-2004.
One estimate from an expert at Washington University in St. Louis gave a $300+ billion impact on the world's supply chain that could last up to two years.

Kimwe mu bigereranyo byatanzwe n'impuguke muri kaminuza ya Washington muri St. Louis kigaragaza ingaruka isaga miriyari 300 z'amadorari ku ruhererekane nyongeragaciro ku isi kandi ibi bishobora kumara imyaka ibiri.
The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) reportedly "scrambled" after a steep decline in oil prices due to lower demand from China.
Biravugwa ko Umuryango Mpuzamahanga w'Ibihugu Bicukura Peterori (OPEC) "wahungabanye bikomeye" nyuma yo kugabanuka gukabije kw'ibiciro bya peterori kubera ko Ubushinwa butari buri kuyisaba.
Global stock markets fell on 24 February due to a significant rise in the number of COVID-19 cases outside mainland China.
Ku itariki ya 24 Gashyantare, amasoko y'imari n'imigabane ku isi yaraguye bitewe n'ukwiyongera gukabije kw'umubare w'abanduye COVID-19 hanze y'Ubushinwa.

On 27 February, due to mounting worries about the coronavirus outbreak, various U.S. stock indexes including the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500 Index, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted their sharpest falls since 2008, with the Dow falling 1,191 points, the largest one-day drop since the financial crisis of 2007–08.

Ku wa 27 Gashyantare, bitewe no kwiyongera kw'ibibazo by'ikwirakwira rya koronavirusi, ibipimo by'ibiciro byo ku isoko ry'imari n'imigabane bitandukanye byo muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika, birimo NASDAQ-100, S&P 500 Index, na Dow Jones Industrial Average byashyize ahagaragara igihombo gikabije byagize guhera 2008, aho Dow yamanutseho amanota 1.191, akaba ari cyo gihombo gikabije mu munsi umwe kuva hatangira ihungabana ry'ubukungu ryo mu 2007-08.
All three indexes ended the week down more than 10%.
Ibipimo byose uko ari bitatu byarangije icyumweru biri munsi ya 10%.
On 28 February, Scope Ratings GmbH affirmed China's sovereign credit rating, but maintained a Negative Outlook.
Ku ya 28 Gashyantare, Scope Ratings GmbH yemeje urwego rw'inguzanyo rw'Ubushinwa, ariko rukomeza kugaragara ko rudashimishije.
Stocks plunged again based on coronavirus fears, the largest fall being on 16 March.
Amasoko y'imari n'imigabane yaraguye kubera gutinya koronavirusi, kugwa gukabije kwayo kwabaye ku ya 16 Werurwe.
Many consider an economic recession to be likely.
Abenshi babona ko hashobora kubaho ihungabana ry'ubukungu.
Economist Mohamed El-Erian praised central banks' and states' timely emergency measures.
Umuhanga mu by'ubukungu Mohamed El-Erian ashima banki nkuru z'ibihugu na za Leta ku bw'ingamba z'ubutabazi zafatiye igihe.
Central banks are reacting more quickly than they did to the 2008 financial crash.
Banki nkuru z'ibihugu zahagurukiye vuba iki cyorezo kurusha uko zabigenje mu gihe cy'ihungabana rikomeye ry'ubukungu mu 2008.
Tourism is one of the worst affected sectors due to travel bans, closing of public places including travel attractions, and advice of governments against any travel all over the world.

Ubukerarugendo ni rumwe mu nzego zashegeshwe cyane n'iki cyorezo bitewe n'ihagarikwa ry'ingendo, gufunga ahantu hahurira abantu benshi harimo ahantu hari ibyiza nyaburanga, ndetse n'inama za Leta zibuza abantu gukora ingendo izo ari zo zose ku Isi.
As a consequence, numerous airlines have cancelled flights due to lower demand, including British Airways, China Eastern Airlines, and Qantas, while British regional airline Flybe collapsed.

Kubera iyo mpamvu, amasosiyete y'indege menshi yahagaritse ingendo kubera ko abagenzi ari bake, harimo British Airways, China Eastern Airlines na Qantas, mu gihe isosiyete y'indege ikorera mu Bwongereza gusa ya Flybe yo yafunze burundu.
The impact on the cruise line industry was at a level never seen before.
Ingaruka ku mato manini cyane atwara abagenzi zari ku rwego rutigeze rubaho mbere.
Several train stations and ferry ports have also been closed.
Gariyamoshi nyinshi hamwe n'ibyambu na byo byarafunzwe.
The epidemic coincided with the Chunyun, a major travel season associated with the Chinese New Year holiday.
Icyorezo cyahuriranye na Chunyun, igihe cy'ingenzi cyo gukora ingendo zijyanye n'ikiruhuko cy'Umwaka mushya w'Ubushinwa.

A number of events involving large crowds were cancelled by national and regional governments, including annual New Year festivals, with private companies also independently closing their shops and tourist attractions such as Hong Kong Disneyland and Shanghai Disneyland.

Ibikorwa byinshi byitabirwa n'abantu benshi byahagaritswe n'ubuyobozi bw'ibihugu n'ubw'uturere, harimo iminsi mikuru y'umwaka mushya, aho ibigo byigenga na byo byafunze amaduka yabyo ndetse n'ahabera ubukerarugendo nka Hong Kong Disneyland na Shanghai Disneyland na ho harafunga.
Many Lunar New Year events and tourist attractions have been closed to prevent mass gatherings, including the Forbidden City in Beijing and traditional temple fairs.

Ibirori byinshi by'umwaka mushya n'ahantu nyaburanga hasurwa na ba mukerarugendo harafunzwe mu rwego rwo kwirinda amateraniro y'abantu benshi, harimo Forbidden City i Beijing n'amamurikagurisha gakondo ategurwa n'insengero.
In 24 of China's 31 provinces, municipalities and regions, authorities extended the New Year's holiday to 10 February, instructing most workplaces not to re-open until that date.

Mu ntara 24 muri 31 zigize Ubushinwa, imijyi mikuru n'uturere, abayobozi bongereye ibiruhuko by'umwaka mushya kugeza ku ya 10 Gashyantare, bategeka ahakorerwa imirimo henshi kutazongera gufungura kugeza kuri iyo tariki.
These regions represented 80% of the country's GDP and 90% of exports.
Utu turere tugize 80% by'Umusaruro mbumbe w'igihugu na 90% y'ibyoherezwa mu mahanga.

Hong Kong raised its infectious disease response level to the highest and declared an emergency, closing schools until March and cancelling its New Year celebrations.The retail sector has been impacted globally, with reductions in store hours or temporary closures.

Hongukongo yongereye ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo ku rwego rwo hejuru, itangaza ibihe bidasanzwe, ifunga amashuri kugeza muri Werurwe inahagarika ibirori byo kwizihiza Umwaka mushya. Urwego rw'ubucuruzi rwagizweho ingaruka muri rusange, habaho kugabanya amasaha yo gufungura amaduka cyangwa se agafungwa mu gihe gito.
Visits to retailers in Europe and Latin America declined by 40%.
Abasura ahakorerwa ubucurzi bw'abadandaza mu Burayi no muri Amerika y'Epfo bagabanutseho 40%.
North America and Middle East retailers saw a 50–60% drop.
Abadandaza muri Amerika y'Amajyaruguru no mu Burasirazuba bwo hagati bagabanutseho 50-60%.
This also resulted in a 33–43% drop in foot traffic to shopping centres in March compared to February.
Ibi kandi byatumye habaho muri Werurwe kugabanuka kwa 33-43% mu bantu binjira mu duce tw'ubucuruzi ugereranije no muri Gashyantare.

Shopping mall operators around the world imposed additional measures, such increased sanitation, installation of thermal scanners to check the temperature of shoppers, and cancellation of events.According to a United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America estimate, the pandemic-induced recession could leave between 14 and 22 million more people in extreme poverty in Latin America than would have been in that situation without the pandemic.

Abacuruzi mu maduka akomeye ku isi bongereye ingamba, nko kongera isuku, gushyiraho ibyuma bipima ubushyuhe mu rwego rwo gupima umuriro w'abaguzi no guhagarika ibikorwa by'iminsi mikuru. Nk'uko bitangazwa na Komisiyo y'Umuryango w'Abibumbye yita ku bukungu bwo mu bihugu by'Amerika y'Amajyepfo, icyorezo kizasiga mu bukene bukabije abantu bari hagati ya miriyoni 14 na 22 bo muri Amerika y'Amajyepfo kurenza uko byari kugenda iyo kitabaho.
In January and February 2020, during the height of the epidemic in Wuhan, about 5 million people in China lost their jobs.
Muri Mutarama na Gashyantare 2020, mu gihe icyorezo cyari kimeze nabi muri Wuhan, abantu bagera kuri miriyoni 5 mu Bushinwa batakaje akazi.

Many of China's nearly 300 million rural migrant workers have been stranded at home in inland provinces or trapped in Hubei province.In March 2020, more than 10 million Americans lost their jobs and applied for government aid.

Benshi mu bakozi b'Ababashinwa bagera kuri miriyoni 300 bakorera mu cyaro bafatiwe mu rugo mu ntara z'imbere cyangwa mu ntara ya Hubei. Muri Werurwe 2020, Abanyamerika barenga miriyoni 10 batakaje akazi basaba ubufasha bwa Leta.

The coronavirus outbreak could cost 47 million jobs in the United States and unemployment rate may hit 32%, according to estimates by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.The lockdown in India has left tens of millions of Indian migrant workers (who are paid through daily wages) unemployed.The survey from the Angus Reid Institute found that 44% of Canadian households have experienced some type of unemployment.Nearly 900,000 workers lost their jobs in Spain since it went into lockdown in mid-March 2020.

Nk'uko bitangazwa na Banki yitwa "Federal Reserve Bank of St.Louis", icyorezo cya koronavirusi gishobora gutuma havaho imirimo ingana na miriyoni 47 muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika kandi igipimo cy'ubushomeri gishobora kugera kuri 32%. Mu Buhinde, Gahunda ya Guma mu rugo yasize amamiriyoni y'Abahinde b'abimukira (ba nyakabyizi) nta kazi bafite. Ubushakashatsi bwakozwe n'ikigo cya Angus Reid bwagaragaje ko 44% by'imiryango yo muri Kanada yahuye n'ikibazo cy'ubushomeri. Hafi abakozi 900 000 batakaje akazi muri Esipanye kuva Gahunda ya Guma mu rugo yatangira muri Werurwe hagati mu mwaka wa 2020.

During the second half of March, 4 million French workers applied for temporary unemployment benefits and 1 million British workers applied for a universal credit scheme.Almost half a million companies in Germany have sent their workers on a government-subsidized short-time working schemes known as Kurzarbeit.

Mu gice cya kabiri cya Werurwe, abakozi b'Abafaransa miriyoni 4 basabye inyungu z'ubushomeri by'agateganyo naho abakozi b'Abongereza miriyoni imwe basaba kujya muri gahunda y'inguzanyo rusange. Nka kimwe cya kabiri cya miriyoni cy'ibigo by'ubucuruzi mu Budage byohereje abakozi babyo muri gahunda z'igihe gito zatewe inkunga na Leta zizwi nka ‘Kurzarbeit'.
The German short-time work compensation scheme has been adopted by France and Britain.
Gahunda y'indishyi z'igihe gito mu Budage yanatangiye gukoreshwa n'Ubufaransa n'Ubwongereza.
The performing arts and cultural heritage sectors have been profoundly affected by the pandemic, impacting organizations' operations as well as individuals—both employed and independent—globally.
Inzego z'ubuhanzi n'umurage ndangamuco zashegeshwe cyane n'icyorezo, kuko cyagize ingaruka ku mikorere y'ibigo ndetse n'abantu ku giti cyabo (baba abafite abakoresha ndetse n'abigenga) ku isi.

Arts and culture sector organizations attempted to uphold their (often publicly funded) mission to provide access to cultural heritage to the community, maintain the safety of their employees and the public, and support artists where possible.

Amashyirahamwe yo mu rwego rw'umuco n'ubugeni yagerageje kwita ku nshingano (akenshi abitewemo inkunga ku mugaragaro) zayo zo kubungabunga ibiranga umuco, kwita ku mutekano w'abakozi n'abaturage no gufasha abanyabugeni aho bishoboka.

By March 2020, across the world and to varying degrees, museums, libraries, performance venues, and other cultural institutions had been indefinitely closed with their exhibitions, events and performances cancelled or postponed.

Muri Werurwe 2020, ku isi hose no ku buryo butandukanye, inzu ndangamurage, amasomero, ahakorerwa ibitaramo, ndetse n'ibindi bigo ndangamuco byari byarafunzwe burundu kandi amamurikagurisha yabyo, ibirori n'ibitaramo byarahagaritswe cyangwa birasubikwa.

In response there were intensive efforts to provide alternative services through digital platforms.Another recent and rapidly accelerating fallout of the disease is the cancellation of religious services, major events in sports, and other social events, such as music festivals and concerts, technology conferences, and fashion shows.

Mu rwego rwo gukemura ikibazo, hafashwe ingamba zo gushyiraho izindi serivisi z'ikoranabuhanga. Ikindi cyemezo gikomeye giheruka gufatwa kandi kiri kwihutisha igabanuka ry'icyorezo, ni uguhagarika ibikorwa byose by'insegero, ibikorwa bikomeye by'imikino n'ibindi bikorwa bihuza abantu benshi birimo ibitaramo bya muzika, inama zifashisha ikoranabuhanga ndetse n'ibijyanye no kumurika imideri.

The film industry has also experienced disruption.The Vatican announced that Holy Week observances in Rome, which occur during the last week of the Christian penitential season of Lent, have been cancelled.
Inganda za firime na zo zarahungabanye. Vatikani yatangaje ko kwizihiza icyumweru gitagatifu i Roma, biba mu cyumweru cya nyuma cy'igihe cy'abakirisitu bihana mu Gisibo, byahagaritswe.

Many dioceses have recommended older Christians to stay at home rather than attending Mass on Sundays; some churches have made church services available via radio, online live streaming or television while others are offering drive-in worship.

Diyosezi nyinshi zasabye abakirisitu bakuze kuguma mu rugo aho kujya mu misa ku cyumweru; amwe mu matorero yanyujije amateraniro kuri radiyo, kuri Interineti cyangwa televiziyo mu gihe abandi bashyizeho uburyo bwo gukurikirana amateraniro bari mu modoka zabo.

With the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rome closing its churches and chapels and St. Peter's Square emptied of Christian pilgrims, other religious bodies also cancelled services and limited public gatherings in churches, mosques, synagogues, temples and gurdwaras.

Ubwo Kiliziya Gatolika yafungaga za Diyosezi na za Shapeli ndetse n'imbuga nini ya Kiliziya yitiriwe Mutagatifu Petero ntihagire n'umwe uhagera mu bahakorera ingendo ntagatifu, andi madini na yo yahagaritse burundu ibiterane kandi agabanya umubare w'abahurira hamwe mu nsengero, imisigiti, amasinagogi n'ahandi nk'aho.

Iran's Health Ministry announced the cancellation of Friday prayers in areas affected by the outbreak and shrines were later closed, while Saudi Arabia banned the entry of foreign pilgrims as well as its residents to holy sites in Mecca and Medina.

Minisiteri y'ubuzima muri Irani yatangaje ko ihagarikwa ry'amasengesho yo ku wa Gatanu mu turere twibasiwe n'iki cyorezo ndetse n'ahantu hatagatifu na ho haje gufungwa nyuma, mu gihe Arabiya Sawudite yabujije abanyamahanga bazaga mu ngendo z'iyobokamana kwinjira ndetse n'abaturage bahatuye ntibemererwa kugera ahantu hatagatifu i Maka na Madina.
The pandemic has caused the most significant disruption to the worldwide sporting calendar since the Second World War.
Icyorezo cyateje guhungabana gukomeye kw'ingengabihe y'imikino ku isi kuva Intambara ya Kabiri y'Isi yose yarangira.
Most major sporting events have been either cancelled or postponed, including the 2019–20 UEFA Champions League, 2019–20 Premier League, UEFA Euro 2020, 2019–20 NBA season, and 2019–20 NHL season.

Amarushanwa y'imikino myinshi yarahagaritswe cyangwa arasubikwa, harimo Imikino y'Amakipe yabaye ayambere iwayo UEFA 2019–20, Shampiyona yo mu Bwongereza 2019–20, Imikino y'Igikombe cy'Uburayi 2020, Shampiyona y'Umukino w'intoki yo muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika 2019–20, na NHL 2019–20.

The outbreak disrupted plans for the 2020 Summer Olympics, which were originally scheduled to start at the end of July; the International Olympic Committee announced on 24 March that the event will be "rescheduled to a date beyond 2020 but not later than summer 2021".Casinos and other gaming venues worldwide have closed and live poker tournaments have been either postponed or cancelled.

Icyorezo kandi cyaburijemo gahunda y'imikino ya Olimpiki yo mu mpeshyi ya 2020 yari iteganyijwe gutangira mu mpera za Nyakanga; ku wa 24 Werurwe Komite Mpuzamahanga y'imikino ya Olimpiki yatangaje ko iyo mikino "izimurirwa ku yindi tariki ya nyuma ya 2020 ariko bitarenze impeshyi ya 2021." Ahantu hakinirwa imikino y'amahirwe imeze nk'urusimbi ndetse n'ahandi hantu hakorerwa imikino ku isi hose harafunzwe yewe n'amarushanwa y'imikino y'amakarita izwi nka Pokeri amwe yabaye yimuwe andi arahagarikwa.

This has led many gamblers to move online, with many online gambling sites reporting significant increases in their rates of new sign-ups.The entertainment industry has also been affected, with various music groups suspending or cancelling concert tours.

Ibi byatumye abantu benshi bakina imikino y'amahirwe bimukira kuri Interineti, aho imbuga nyinshi z'imikino y'amahirwe zivuga ko umubare w'abaziyandikishijeho wiyongereye cyane. Imyidagaduro na yo yagizweho ingaruka, aho amatsinda menshi ya muzika yahagaritse cyangwa agasubika ingendo z'ibitaramo yari afite.
Many large theatres such as those on Broadway also suspended all performances.
Inzu nini ziberamo ibitaramo nk'iziri ahitwa Broadway zahagaritse imyidagaduro yose.

Some artists have explored ways to continue to produce and share work over the internet as an alternative to traditional live performance, such as live streaming concerts or creating web-based "festivals" for artists to perform, distribute, and publicize their work.

Bamwe mu bahanzi bashakishije uburyo bwo gukomeza kubyaza umusaruro no gusangiza abantu ibyo bakora kuri Interineti nk'uburyo bwasimbura ubusanzweho bwo gutaramira abantu imbona nkubone, bakora ibitaramo banyuza kuri Interineti, cyangwa bagakora "ibirori" bishingiye ku mbuga za Interineti bikitabirwa n'abahanzi, bityo bagakwirakwiza, ndetse bakanamenyekanisha ibikorwa byabo.
Online, numerous coronavirus-themed Internet memes have spread as many turn to humour and distraction amid uncertainty.
Kuri Interineti, hakwirakwiye udushusho dusekeje twibanda cyane kuri koronavirusi kuko abantu benshi bashakaga ibyo kubasetsa no kubarangaza mu gihe bataramenya aho ibintu bigana.

Since the outbreak of COVID-19, heightened prejudice, xenophobia, and racism have been noted toward people of Chinese and East Asian descent, and against people from hotspots in Europe, the United States and other countries.

Kuva icyorezo cya COVID-19 cyatangira, habayeho urwikekwe rukabije, urwango ku banyamahanga, n'ivanguramoko ku bantu bakomoka mu Bushinwa no muri Aziya y'Iburasirazuba, ndetse no ku bantu baturuka ahantu hagaragaye cyane ubwandu mu Burayi, Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika ndetse no mu bindi bihugu.
Incidents of fear, suspicion, and hostility have been observed in many countries, particularly in Europe, East Asia, North America, and the Asia-Pacific region.
Kugira ubwoba cyane, urwikekwe, no gushyamirana byagaragaye mu bihugu byinshi, cyane cyane mu Burayi, Aziya y'Iburasirazuba, Amerika y'Amajyaruguru, ndetse no mu karere ka Aziya-Pasifika.

Reports from February (when the majority of the cases had still been confined to China) have documented racist sentiments expressed in various groups worldwide of Chinese people deserving the virus or receiving what has been claimed as justified retribution.

Raporo zo muri Gashyantare (igihe abarwaye benshi bari bakiri mu Bushinwa) zerekanye imyumvire y'ivanguramoko yagaragaye mu matsinda atandukanye ku isi, bavuga ko Abashinwa bakwiriye iyi virusi cyangwa ko bari kubona igihano kibakwiye.
Some countries in Africa have also seen a rise in anti-Chinese sentiment.
Ibihugu bimwe na bimwe muri Afurika na byo byagiye bigaragaramo ukwiyongera kw'urwango ku Bashinwa.
Many residents of Wuhan and Hubei have reported discrimination based on their regional origin.
Abaturage benshi bo muri Wuhan na Hubei bavuze ko bakorewe ivangura hashingiwe ku karere bakomokamo.
There has been support for the Chinese, both on and offline, and towards those in virus-stricken areas.
Habayeho gushyigikira Abashinwa, haba mu buryo busanzwe no kuri Interineti, ndetse n'abari mu turere twibasiwe na virusi.

Following the progression of the outbreak to new hotspot countries, people from Italy, the first country in Europe to experience a serious outbreak of COVID-19, could also be subjected to suspicion and xenophobia.Citizens in countries including Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, and South Korea initially signed petitions lobbying to ban Chinese people from entering their countries in an effort to stop the disease.

Ukurikije uko icyorezo kigenda gikwirakwira mu bihugu bishya, abaturage bo mu Butaliyani, igihugu cya mbere mu Burayi mu kugira umubare munini w'abanduye COVID-19, bashobora kuzagira ikibazo cyo kwishisha no kwanga abanyamahanga. Abaturage bo mu bihugu birimo Maleziya, Nuveli Zelandi, Singapuru na Koreya y'Amajyepfo ku ikubitiro byasinye inyandiko ikangurira ibindi bihugu kutemerera Abashinwa kwinjira mu bihugu byabo mu rwego rwo guhagarika ikwirakwira ry'icyorezo.
In Japan, the hashtag #ChineseDontComeToJapan trended on Twitter.
Mu Buyapani, hashitagi ya #ChineseDontComeToJapan yakwirakwiye cyane kuri Twitter.
Chinese people as well as other Asians in the United Kingdom and the United States have reported increasing levels of racist abuse, as well as assaults.
Abashinwa kimwe n'abandi bantu bakomoka muri Aziya bari mu Bwongereza no muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika bavuze ko ihohoterwa rishingiye ku ivangura ryiyongera, bakaba banagabwaho n'ibitero.
U.S. president Donald Trump has faced criticism for referring to the coronavirus as the "Chinese Virus", a term considered by critics to be racist and anti-Chinese.

Perezida wa Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika, Donald Trump yaranenzwe cyane kubera kuvuga ko koronavirusi ari "Virusi y'Ubushinwa", iryo jambo rikaba rifatwa n'abanenga ko ari ivangura kandi rirwanya Abashinwa.
Protesters in Ukraine attacked buses carrying Ukrainian and foreign evacuees from Wuhan to Novi Sanzhary.
Abigaragambyaga muri Ikereni bateye bisi zitwaye abimuwe muri Ikereni n'abanyamahanga bava muri Wuhan berekeza muri Novi Sanzhary.
Students who come from Northeast India, which shares a border with China, and study in major Indian cities have reportedly experienced harassment related to the coronavirus outbreak.
Abanyeshuri baturuka mu majyaruguru y'iburasirazuba bw'Ubuhinde, busangiye umupaka n'Ubushinwa, kandi biga mu mijyi minini yo mu Buhinde ngo barahohotewe bitewe n'icyorezo cya koronavirusi.
The Bharatiya Janata Party's State unit president in West Bengal Dilip Ghosh stated that the Chinese had destroyed nature and "that's why the God took revenge against them."
Perezida w'ishami ry'Ishyaka rya Bharatiya Janata muri Bengali y'Iburengerazuba Dilip Ghosh yavuze ko Abashinwa bangije ibidukikije "ko ari yo mpamvu Imana yabahannye."

The remarks were later condemned by the Chinese consulate in Kolkata, calling it "erroneous".In China, xenophobia and racism agains non-Chinese residents has been inflamed by the pandemic, with foreigners described as "foreign garbage" and targeted for "disposal".

Ibi byahise byamaganirwa kure n'ibiro bihagarariye Ubushinwa i Kolukata, bitangaza ko ari "ibintu bidakwiye". Mu Bushinwa ibikorwa byo kwanga abanyamahanga n'irondabwoko byatijwe umurindi n'icyorezo, aho abanyamahanga bitwaga "imyanda mvamahanga" kandi ikwiye kujugunywa kure.
Many newspapers with paywalls have removed them for some or all of their coronavirus coverage.
Ibinyamakuru byinshi bifite imbuga za interineti zishyuza abazisura byakuyeho bimwe mu biciro cyangwa byose byishyuzwaga ku nkuru zerekeye koronavirusi.
Many scientific publishers made scientific papers related to the outbreak available with open access.
Abanditsi ba siyansi basohoye inyandiko za siyansi zerekeye icyorezo kandi zishobora kubonwa na buri wese uzishaka.
Some scientists chose to share their results quickly on preprint servers such as bioRxiv.
Bamwe mu bahanga mu bya siyansi bahisemo gusangiza abandi ibyo bagezeho mu bushakashatsi vuba kuri seriveri za porogaramu nka bioRxiv.
Emerging infectious disease – Infectious disease of emerging pathogen, often novel in its outbreak range or transmission mode
Indwara zandura zigenda zigaragara - Indwara zandura ziterwa na virusi, akenshi ziba ari nshya mu buryo zigaragaza cyangwa mu buryo zandura
Globalization and disease – Overview of globalization and disease transmission
Ikusanyabukungu n'indwara - Incamake y'ikusanyabukungu n'uburyo indwara yandura
List of epidemics and pandemics – A list of death tolls due to infectious disease
Urutonde rw'indwara n'ibyorezo – Urutonde rw'impfu ziterwa n'indwara z'ibyorezo
Wildlife smuggling and zoonoses – Health risks associated with the trade in exotic wildlife
Ubushimusi bw'inyamaswa n'indwara inyamaswa zanduza abantu - Ingaruka z'ubuzima zijyanye n'ubucuruzi bw'inyamaswa zo mu ishyamba

Laboratory testing for the respiratory coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the associated SARS-CoV-2 virus includes methods that detect the presence of virus and those that detect antibodies produced in response to infection.

Gupimira muri raboratwari indwara yo mu myanya y'ubuhumekero ya koronavirusi 2019 (COVID-19) na virusi bijyanye ya SARS-CoV-2 bikubiyemo uburyo bwo gushaka virusi n'uburyo bwo gutahura abasirikare b'umubiri umubiri ukora mu kurwanya indwara.
The presence of viruses in samples is confirmed by RT-PCR, which detects the coronavirus' RNA.
Kuba virusi ziri mu bizamini byafashwe byemezwa na RT-PCR, itahura RNA ya koronavirusi.
This test is specific and is designed to only detect the RNA of the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
Iki kizamini kirihariye kandi cyagenewe gutahura gusa RNA ya virusi ya SARS-CoV-2.
It is used to confirm very recent or active infections.
Gikoreshwa mu kwemeza abanduye vuba cyangwa abakirwaye.
Detection of antibodies (serology) can be used both for diagnosis and population surveillance.
Gutahura abasirikare b'umubiri (ikizamini cy'amaraso) bishobora gukoreshwa haba mu gupima no kugenzura abaturage.
Antibody tests show how many people have had the disease, including those whose symptoms were too minor to report or who were asymptomatic.

Ibizamini by'abasirikare b'umubiri byerekana umubare w'abantu barwaye iyo ndwara, harimo n'abafite ibimenyetso bito cyane ku buryo bitatuma bamenyesha ababishinzwe ko banduye cyangwa abadafite ibimenyetso.
An accurate mortality rate of the disease and the level of herd immunity in the population can be determined from the results of this test.
Umubare nyakuri w'impfu zitewe n'icyorezo n'urwego rw'ubudahangarwa mu baturage ushobora kugenwa uhereye ku byavuye muri iki kizamini.
Due to limited testing, as of March 2020 no countries had reliable data on the prevalence of the virus in their population.
Kubera imibare mike y'abari bamaze gupimwa, muri Werurwe 2020 nta gihugu cyari gifite amakuru yizewe ku bijyanye n'ubwiganze bwa virusi mu baturage bacyo.
By 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of their population, and there are massive variations in how much testing has been done across countries.
Kugeza ku ya 23 Werurwe, nta gihugu na kimwe cyari cyarapimye abaturage bacyo barenga 3%, kandi hari itandukaniro rinini ku buryo ibizamini byagiye bikorwa mu bihugu byose.
This variability is also likely to be significantly affecting reported case fatality rates, which are likely to be significantly over-estimated in some countries.
Iyi mihindagurikire na yo ishobora kugira ingaruka zikomeye ku mibare y'abapfuye, bikaba bishoboka ko byakabirizwa cyane mu bihugu bimwe na bimwe.
Using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) the test can be done on respiratory samples obtained by various methods, including nasopharyngeal swab or sputum sample.

Hakoreshejwe uburyo bwihuse mu gufata no gusesengura ibipimo by'ubwandu (rRT-PCR), gupima iyi ndwara bishobora gukorerwa ku bizamini byafashwe mu myanya y'ubuhumekero bibonekahakoreshejwe uburyo bunyuranye, burimo ibizamini by'igikororwa cyangwa amatembabuzi yo mu muhogo.
Results are generally available within a few hours to 2 days.
Muri rusange, ibisubizo biboneka hagati y'amasaha make kugeza ku minsi 2.
The RT-PCR test performed with throat swabs is only reliable in the first week of the disease.
Ikizamini cya RT-PCR gikorwahafashwe ibipimo byo mu muhogo ni bwo buryo bwonyine bwizewe gusa mu cyumweru cya mbere cy'indwara.
Later on the virus can disappear in the throat while it continues to multiply in the lungs.
Nyuma virusi ishobora gushira mu muhogo mu gihe ikomeza kwiyongera mu bihaha.
For infected people tested in the second week, alternatively sample material can then be taken from the deep airways by suction catheter or coughing up material (sputum) can be used.
Ku bantu basuzumwe bagasanga baranduye mu cyumweru cya kabiri, byaba byiza bongeye gufatwa ibindi bizamini bitandukanye hapimwa nk'igikorora.

One of the early PCR tests was developed at Charité in Berlin in January 2020 using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR), and formed the basis of 250,000 kits for distribution by the World Health Organization (WHO).

Kimwe mu bipimo biheruka hifashishijwe PCR cyageragerejwe ahitwa Charité mu mugi wa Berlin muri Mutarama 2020 aho bifashishije uburyo bwihuse mu gufata no gusesengura ibipimo by'ubwandu (rRT-PCR) n'ibikoresho ibihumbi 250 000 byatanzwe n'Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku Buzima.

The United Kingdom had also developed a test by 23 January 2020.The South Korean company Kogenebiotech developed a clinical grade, PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit (PowerChek Coronavirus) on 28 January 2020.

Ubwongereza nabwo bwari bwarateguye ikizamini bitarenze ku ya 23 Mutarama 2020. Ku ya 28 Mutarama 2020, Isosiyete yo muri Koreya y'Epfo yitwa Kogenebiotech yateguye igerageza ry'igikoresho cyo kwa muganga cyo gutahura SARS-CoV-2 ishingiye kuri PCR (PowerChek Coronavirus).

It looks for the "E" gene shared by all beta coronaviruses, and the RdRp gene specific to SARS-CoV-2.In China, BGI Group was one of the first companies to receive emergency use approval from China's National Medical Products Administration for a PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit.In the United States, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is distributing its 2019-Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel to public health labs through the International Reagent Resource.

Ishakisha akaremangingo ka "E" gakwirakwizwa n'ubwoko bwa koronavirusi iba mu mubiri w'umuntu, ndetse n'akaremangingo ka RdRp kagaragara muri SARS-CoV-2. Mu gihugu cy'Ubushinwa, BGI Group ni imwe muri kompanyi za mbere mu kwemererwa n'Ikigo cy'Igihugu gishinzwe ibikoresho byo mu buvuzi gukoresha ibikoresho bipima SARS –CoV-2 ishingiye kuri PCR. Muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe Z'Amerika, ikigo gishinzwe kugenzura no kurwanya ibyorezo (CDC) kirimo gukwirakwiza ibikoresho bya RT-PCR Diagnostic byifashishwa mu gupima Koronavirusi nshya 2019 (2019-nCoV) muri za raboratwari rusange binyujijwe mu kigo cyitwa International Reagent Resource.

One of three genetic tests in older versions of the test kits caused inconclusive results due to faulty reagents, and a bottleneck of testing at the CDC in Atlanta; this resulted in an average of fewer than 100 samples a day being successfully processed throughout the whole of February 2020.

Kimwe mu bizamini bitatu byerekana imiterere y'uturemangingo muri verisiyo ya kera y'ibikoresho byifashishwa mu gupima byatumye hatangwa ibisubizo bidasobanutse bitewe n'imiti itujuje ubuziranenge yakoreshejwe, ndetse n'imbogamizi mu gupima ku Kigo gishinzwe kugenzura indwara (CDC) muri Atlanta; ibi byatumye impuzandengo y'ibizamini 100 ku munsi bisuzumwa neza muri Gashyantare 2020 yose.
Tests using two components were not determined to be reliable until 28 February 2020, and it was not until then that state and local laboratories were permitted to begin testing.
Ibizamini byakoresheje ibice bibiri ntabwo byari biteganyijwe ko byizerwa kugeza ku ya 28 Gashyantare 2020, kandi kugeza icyo gihe ni bwo raboratwari za Leta n'iz'uturere zemerewe gutangira gupima.
The test was approved by the Food and Drug Administration under an Emergency Use Authorization.US commercial labs began testing in early March 2020.

Ikizamini cyemejwe n'ubuyobozi bushinzwe ibiribwa n'imiti byemewe n'uruhushya rwo gukoresha mu buryo bwihutirwa. Raboratwari z'ubucuruzi muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika zatangiye gupima mu ntangiriro za Werurwe 2020.
As of 5 March 2020 LabCorp announced nationwide availability of COVID-19 testing based on RT-PCR.
Kugeza ku ya 5 Werurwe 2020, LabCorp yatangaje mu gihugu hose ko habonetse uburyo bwo gupima COVID-19 bushingiye kuri RT-PCR.
Quest Diagnostics similarly made nationwide COVID-19 testing available as of 9 March 2020.
Quest Diagnostics nayo yakoze mu gihugu hose ibizamini bya COVID-19 biboneka guhera ku ya 9 Werurwe 2020.
No quantity limitations were announced; specimen collection and processing must be performed according to CDC requirements.
Nta mubare ntarengwa watangajwe; gukusanya no gutunganya ingero zafashwe bigomba gukorwa hakurikijwe ibisabwa n'Ikigo gishinzwe kugenzura indwara (CDC).
In Russia, the COVID-19 test was developed and produced by the State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology VECTOR.
Mu Burusiya, ikizamini cya COVID-19 cyateguwe kandi gikorwa n'ikigo cya Leta cy'ubushakashatsi kuri virusi n'ikoranabuhanga mu binyabuzima VECTOR.

On 11 February 2020 the test was registered by the Federal Service for Surveillance in Healthcare.On 12 March 2020, Mayo Clinic was reported to have developed a test to detect COVID-19 infection.On 13 March 2020, Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for a test which could be performed within 3.5 hours in high volume, thus allowing one machine to do approximately 4,128 tests in a 24-hour period.

Kuwa 11 Gashyantare 2020, Ikigo cya Leta Gishinzwe kwita ku buvuzi cyatangiye gupima iyi virusi. Kuwa 12 Werurwe 2020, byatangajwe ko Ivuriro rya Mayo ryakoze igikoresho gishobora gupima icyorezo cya COVID-19. Kuwa 13 Werurwe 2020, Roche Diagnostics yemerewe na FDA gukora imashini yo gupima iyi virusi yagombaga gutanga ibisubizo mu masaha 3,5 ku kigero cyo hejuru, ibi bikaba byaratumaga imashini imwe ishobora gupima abantu 4 128 mu gihe cy'amasaha 24.

On 19 March 2020, the FDA issued emergency use authorization (EUA) to Abbott Laboratories for a test on Abbott's m2000 system; the FDA had previously issued similar authorization to Hologic, LabCorp, and Thermo Fisher Scientific.

Ku ya 19 Werurwe 2020, FDA yatanze uruhushya rwo gukoresha ku buryo bwihutirwa (EUA) kuri Raboratwari ya Abbott kugira ngo ikore ikizamini kuri sisitemu ya m2000 ya Abbott; FDA yari yaratanze uburenganzira busa na Hologic, LabCorp, na Thermo Fisher Scientific.
On 21 March 2020, Cepheid similarly received EUA from the FDA for a test that takes about 45 minutes.
Ku ya 21 Werurwe 2020, Cepheid nayo yahawe uruhushya rwo gukoresha uburyo bwihutirwa ruvuye muri FDA kugira ngo hakorwe ikizamini kimara iminota 45.
The FDA has approved a test that uses isothermal nucleic acid amplification technology instead of PCR.
FDA yemeje ikizamini gikoresha ikoranabuhanga ryo kongera ibipimo by'ubushyuhe kuri aside nikileyiki aho gukoresha PCR.
Since this does not require a series of alternating temperature cycles this method can deliver positive results in as little as five minutes and negative results in 13 minutes.
Kubera ko ibi bidasaba urukurikirane mu guhinduranya ubushyuhe ubu buryo bushobora gutanga ibisubizo by'uwanduye mu minota mike nk'itanu n'ibisubizo by'utanduye mu minota 13.

There are currently about 18,000 of these machines in the U.S. and Abbott expects to ramp up manufacturing to deliver 50,000 tests per day.A test which uses a monoclonal antibody which specifically binds to the nucleocapsid protein (N protein) of the novel coronavirus is being developed in Taiwan, with the hope that it can provide results in 15 to 20 minutes just like a rapid influenza test.

Kugeza ubu muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika hari imashini z'ubu bwoko zigera kuri 18 000 kandi Abbot iteganya kongera ubushobozi ku buryo ibipimo byagera kuri 50 000 ku munsi. Muri Tayiwani harimo gukorwa Igipimisho gikoresha abasirikare b'umubiri bihuza n'intungamubiri zo mu bwoko bwa N za Koronavirusi, kandi hari ikizere ko gishobora gutanga ibisubizo hagati y'iminota 15 na 20 mbese nk'imashini ipima ibicurane ku buryo bwihuse.
A March 2020 literature review concluded that "chest radiographs are of little diagnostic value in early stages, whereas CT [computed tomography] findings may be present even before symptom onset."

Muri Werurwe 2020, inyandiko z'ubushakashatsi zanzuye ko "mu ntangiriro kunyura mu cyuma harebwa mu gatuza bidafite akamaro cyane mu kwisuzumisha, naho ibyerekanwa n'uburyo bw'ikoranabuhanga bwa CT [computing tomografiya] bishobora kuba bihari na mbere y'uko ibimenyetso bitangira."
Typical features on CT include bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacificities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution.
Ibiranga uburyo bw'ikoranabuhanga bwa CT mu kunyuza mu cyuma birimo kubasha kureba impande zose z'ibihaha, bugaragaza neza ku ruhande, hagati ndetse n'igice cy'inyuma.
Subpleural dominance, crazy paving and consolidation develop as the disease evolves.
Akugara k'igice cyo munsi y'ibihaha, kwitsindagira cyane kw'ibice bimwe bigize ibihahaha bigenda byiyongera uko icyorezo kirushaho gukomera.

A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan at the point of origin of the current pandemic has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.

Ubushakashatsi bwakozwe hagamijwe kugereranya ibyo bipimo bya PCR na CT muri Wuhan hashakishwa inkomoko y'icyo cyorezo bwerekanye ko ibyo bimenyetso bigaragaza ko icyorezo cyari gikomeye cyane i Wuhan kuko ho kivanze n'izindi ndwara zibasira imyanya y'ubuhumekero kurushaho.

As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".As of March 2020, the CDC recommends PCR for initial screening.

Kugera mu kwezi kwa Werurwe 2020, Ishuri rikuru ry'Ubuvuzi bwo kunyuza mu cyuma muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika ryategetse ko "Uburyo bukoreshwa i Wuhan butakongera gukoreshwa mu gusuzuma KoronavirusiCOVID-19". Kuva muri Werurwe 2020, Ikigo gishinzwe kugenzura indwara (CDC) gisaba ko PCR ari yo yakoreshwa mu kwisuzumisha mbere.
Part of the immune response to infection is the production of antibodies including IgM and IgG.
Bumwe mu buryo bw'ubudahangarwa umubiri ushyiraho urwanya ubwandu ni ugukora abasirikare b'umubiri barimo IgM na IgG.

These can be used to detect infection in individuals starting 7 days or so after the onset of symptoms, to determine immunity, and in population surveillance.Assays can be performed in central laboratories (CLT) or by point-of-care testing (PoCT).

Ibi byafasha mu kuvumbura ubwandu mu bantu guhera ku munsi wa 7 cyangwa nyuma yo kubona ibimenyetso by'ibanze,mu kureba ingano y'ubwirinzi no gukora igenzura mu baturage. Isesengura ry'ibipimo rishobora gukorerwa muri raboratwari zisanzwe (CLT) cyangwa ahandi hantu hagenewe gupimira ( PoCT).
The high-throughput automated systems in many clinical laboratories will be able to perform these assays but their availability will depend on the rate of production for each system.
Uburo bukoreshwa mu gupima abantu benshi muri raboratwari nyinshi zo kwa muganga, buzakoreshwa mu gusesengura, ariko kuboneka kw'ibisubizo bizaterwa n'umuvuduko w'imikorere.
For CLT a single specimen of peripheral blood is commonly used, although serial specimens can be used to follow the immune response.
Muri raboratwari zisanzwe, urugero rumwe rw'amaraso yafashwe ni rwo rusanzwe rukoreshwa, n'ubwo ingero zikurikirana zishobora gukoreshwa hagamijwe gukurikirana ubudahangarwa bw'umubiri.
For PoCT a single specimen of blood is usually obtained by skin puncture.
Ku handi hantu hagenewe gupimirwa, urugero rumwe rw'amaraso rusanzwe ruboneka habayeho gutobora uruhu.

Unlike PCR methods an extraction step is not needed before assay.On March 26, 2020, the FDA named 29 entities that provided notification to the agency as required and are now therefore able to distribute their antibody tests.

Bitandukanye n'uburyo bwa PCR, uburyo bwo kubanza kuvoma ibigomba gupimwa ntabwo bukenewe mbere yo gupima. Ku ya 26 Werurwe 2020, FDA yatangaje ibigo 29 byayimenyesheje nk'uko bisabwa noneho bikaba bishobora gutanga ibizamini by'abasirikare b'umubiri byakoze.

As of April 7, 2020, only a single test has been approved by the FDA under an emergency use authorization.In late March 2020, Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics and Epitope Diagnostics received European approvals for their test kits, which can detect IgG and IgA antibodies against the virus in blood samples.

Guhera ku ya 7 Mata 2020, ikizamini kimwe gusa ni cyo cyemejwe na FDA ko kigomba gukorwa babiherewe uburenganzira igihe byihutirwa.Mu mpera za Werurwe 2020, Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics na Epitope Diagnostic byahawe ibyemezo by'Iburayi ku bikoresho byabo byo gupima, bishobora kumenya abasirikare b'umubiri ba IgG na IgA mu kurwanya virusi mu bizamini by'amaraso.
The testing capacity is several hundred samples within hours and therefore much faster than the conventional PCR assay of viral RNA.

Ubushobozi bwo gupima ubwandu bushobora kugera ku bizamini amagana bisuzumwa mu masaha noneho bikihuta cyane ugereranyije n'ikizamini cya PCR cyari gisanzwe gikoreshwa cyo gupima RNA iterwa na virusi.
The antibodies are usually detectable 14 days after the onset of the infection.In early April, the UK found none of the antibody test kits it purchased were sufficiently good to use.

Ubusanzwe abasirikare b'umubiri bagaragara mu minsi 14 nyuma y'uko ubwandu butangiye. Mu ntangiriro za Mata, Ubwongereza bwasanze nta bikoresho bipima ingano y'abasirikare b'umubiri bwaguze nta na kimwe gishobora gukoreshwa ku buryo buhagije.

Hong Kong has set up a scheme where suspected patients can stay home, "emergency department will give a specimen tube to the patient", they spit into it, send it back and get a test result a while after.The British NHS has announced that it is piloting a scheme to test suspected cases at home, which removes the risk of a patient infecting others if they come to a hospital or having to disinfect an ambulance if one is used.In drive-through testing for COVID-19 for suspected cases, a healthcare professional takes sample using appropriate precautions.

Hongukongo yashyizeho uburyo umuntu wese uketsweho ubwandu ashobora kuguma mu rugo, ishami rishinzwe ubutabazi rikamuha "agakoresho kabugenewe", agaciramo hanyuma akakabasubiza bakazamuha igisubizo nyuma. Serivisi zishinzwe ubuzima mu Bwongereza (NHS) zatangaje ko ziteganya gushyiraho uburyo bwo gupimira mu rugo abantu bakekwaho ubwandu, ibi bikazakuraho ibyago byo kuba umurwayi ashobora kwanduza abandi igihe baje mu bitaro, cyangwa se hakaba hasabwa gutera imiti yica udukoko twanduza indwara mu modoka yazanye umurwayi. Mu gikorwa cyo gufata ibizamini by'uwaketsweho COVID-19, umuganga abikora mu buryo bwa kinyamwuga yubahiriza amabwiriza yose.

Drive-through centers have helped South Korea do some of the fastest, most-extensive testing of any country.In Germany, the National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians said on 2 March, that it had a capacity for about 12,000 tests per day in the ambulatory setting and 10.700 had been tested in the prior week.

Ahantu ho gupimira abantu bari mu binyabiziga byabo hafashije Koreya y'Epfo gukora bimwe mu bizamini byihuta cyane, kandi byinshi cyane kurusha ibindi bihugu. Mu Budage, ku ya 2 Werurwe, Ishyirahamwe ry'ubwishingizi bw'ubuzima bw'abaganga ryatangaje, ko rifite ubushobozi bwo gupima hafi 12,000 ku munsi hakoreshejwe imbangukiragutabara kandi abagera ku 10 700 barapimwe mu cyumweru kibanziriza iki.
Costs are borne by the health insurance when the test is ordered by a physician.
Ibiciro byishyurwa n'ubwishingizi bw'ubuzima mu gihe ikizamini gitegekwa na muganga.
According to the president of the Robert Koch Institute, Germany has an overall capacity for 160,000 tests per week.
Nk'uko byatangajwe na perezida w'ikigo cya Robert Koch, Ubudage bufite ubushobozi rusange bwo gupima abantu 160 000 buri cyumweru.
As of 19 March drive in tests were offered in several large cities.
Kuva ku ya 19 Werurwe uburyo bwo gupima bwakorewe mu mijyi minini myinshi.
As of 26 March 2020 the total number of tests performed in Germany was unknown, because only positive results are reported.
Kugeza ku ya 26 Werurwe 2020 umubare rusange w'ibizamini byakorewe mu Budage ntiwari uzwi, kubera ko havuzwe gusa abanduye.

A first lab survey revealed that as of calendar week 12/2020 a total of at least 483,295 samples were tested up to and including week 12/2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) tested positive for SARS-CoV-2.In Israel, researchers at Technion and Rambam Hospital developed and tested a method for testing samples from 64 patients simultaneously, by pooling the samples and only testing further if the combined sample is found to be positive.In Wuhan a makeshift 2000-sq-meter emergency detection laboratory named "Huo-Yan" (Chinese: 火眼, or "Fire Eye" in English) was opened on 5 February 2020 by BGI, which can process over 10,000 samples a day.

Ubushakashatsi bwa mbere bwakozwe na raboratwari bwatangaje ko mu cyumweru cya 12/2020 hari hamaze gupimwa abantu bagera nibura kuri 483 295 ubariyemo n'icyumeru cya 12/2020, muri bo abagera kuri 33 491 (6,9%) basanganywe SARS-CoV-2. Muri Isiraheli, abashakashatsi bo mu bitaro bya Technion na Rambam bavumbuye kandi bagerageza uburyo bwo gupima abarwayi 64 icyarimwe, aho bafata ibizamini bakaza kongera kubipima nyuma iyo hari uwo basanganye uburwayi. Muri Wuhan, raboratwari y'ubutabazi ifite ubuso bwa m2 2000 yitwa "Huo-Yan" 火眼 mu Gishinwa, cyangwa "Ijisho ry'umuriro" mu Kinyarwanda, yafunguwe ku mugaragaro kuwa 5 Gashyantare 2020 n'ikigo cyitwa BGI, ishobora gupima abantu barenga 10 000 ku munsi.

With the construction overseen by BGI-founder Wang Jian and taking 5-days, modelling has show cases in Hubei would have been 47% higher and the corresponding cost of the tackling the quarantine would have doubled if this testing capacity hadn't come on line.

Imirimo yo kubaka yagenzuwe n'uwashinze BGI, Wang Jian kandi yamaze igihe cy'iminsi 5, ingero zafashwe zerekanye ko ubwandu muri Hubei bwari kwiyongeraho 47% kandi ikiguzi cyo guhangana n'abari gushyirwa mu kato cyari kwikuba kabiri iyo ubu bushobozi bwo gupima butaboneka.
The Wuhan Laboratory has been promptly followed by Huo-Yan labs in Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, and Shanghai, in a total of 12 cities across China.
Raboratwari ya Wuhan yahise ikurikirwa na raboratwari za Huo-Yanmu Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, na Shanghai, mu mijyi 12 yose mu Bushinwa.

By 4 March 2020 the daily throughput totals were 50,000 tests per day.Open source, multiplexed designs released by Origami Assays have been released that can test as many as 1122 patient samples for COVID19 using only 93 assays . These balanced designs can be run in small laboratories without the need for robotic liquid handlers.

Kugeza ku ya 4 Werurwe 2020, muri rusange hakorwa ibipimo 50 000 ku munsi. Uburyo bwihuse kandi bushobora gukoreshwa na buri wese bwashyizwe ahagaragara na Origami Assays bushobora gupima ibizamini by'abarwayi 1 122 ba COVID19 hakoreshejwe ibipimo 93 gusa. Ubu buryo bugererenyije bushobora gukorerwa muri raboratwari ntoya bitabaye ngombwa kwitabaza robo zitunganya ibisukika.
By March, shortages and insufficient amounts of reagent has become a bottleneck for mass testing in the EU and UK and the US.

The main medical purpose of washing hands is to cleanse the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals which can cause harm or diseases.

This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but also an important practice for the general public.

Gukora isuku, bijyana no gukoresha amazi ahagije..
Solid soap, because of its reusable nature, may hold bacteria acquired from previous uses.
Amasabune atari ay'amazi, bitewe n'uko ashobora kongera gukoreshwa, ashobora kugumana udukoko twanduza indwara yavuye ku bayakoresheje mbere.
A small number of studies which have looked at the bacterial transfer from contaminated solid soap have concluded transfer is unlikely as the bacteria are rinsed off with the foam.

Umubare muto w'ubushakashatsi wasuzumye uburyo bwo kwanduza k'udukoko twanduza indwara zivuye mu isabune yanduye maze hanzurwa ko kwanduzwabidashoboka kuko utwo dukoko twanduza tuba twahanaguwe n'ifuro.
The CDC still states "liquid soap with hands-free controls for dispensing is preferable".
Ikigo gishinzwe kugenzura indwara (CDC) kiracyavuga ko "isabune y'amazi hamwe n'aho kuyikoreshereza hadasaba ko ukoraho uyisohora ari bwo buryo bwiza".
Antibacterial soaps have been heavily promoted to a health-conscious public.
Isabune yica udukoko twanduza indwara yashimiwe cyane abantu bashishikajwe no kwita ku buzima bwabo.
To date, there is no evidence that using recommended antiseptics or disinfectants selects for antibiotic-resistant organisms in nature.
Kugeza ubu, nta kimenyetso cyerekana ko gukoresha imiti irinda ubwandu cyangwa imiti yica udukoko duhitamo imiti ihangana n'udukoko tuzwiho kwihanganira imiti yica bagiteri.
However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.
Nyamara, amasabune yica udukoko twanduza arimo imiti yica udukoko nka triclosan, ifite urutonde runini rw'udukoko tudapfa guhangarwa.
So, even if antibiotic resistant strains aren't selected for by antibacterial soaps, they might not be as effective as they are marketed to be.
Bityo rero, nubwo imiti irinda ubwandu bw'indwara itatoranyijwe mu miti y'isabune zica udukoko twanduza, ishobora kuba idakora neza cyane nk'uko yamamazwa.

Besides the surfactant and skin-protecting agent, the sophisticated formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts).A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that plain soaps are as effective as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from the hands.

Usibye kuba yarinda ahantu hadatwikiriye ndetse n'uruhu, iyo miti ishobora kuba irimo za aside (aside asetike, aside asikorbike, aside lakitiki) nko kuringaniza ingano ya Idolojene, aside benzoyike irwanya udukoko twanduza indwara n'izindi zirinda uruhu (igikakarubamba, intungamubiri, menthol, n'indi miti ikomoka ku bimera). Ubusesenguzi bwimbitse bwakozwe na Kaminuza y'Ishuri ry'ubuvuzi rusange rya Oregon bwagaragaje ko amasabune asanzwe afite ubushobozi bwo kurinda indwara no gukura ku ntoki udukoko twanduza indwara ku rwego rumwe n'amasabune yagenewe kurwanya udukoko twanduza indwara.
Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.
Amazi ashyushye ashobora gukoreshwa mu gukaraba intoki ntabwo aba ashyushye bihagije kugira ngo yice udukoko twanduza indwara.
Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37 °C).
udukoko twanduza indwara dukura vuba cyane ku gipimo cy'ubushyuhe bw'umubiri (37 ° C).
However, warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing natural oils which hold soils and bacteria.
Nyamara, amazi ashyushye, arimo isabune afite akamaro kuruta amazi akonje, arimo isabune mu gukuraho amavuta karemano afite ubutaka n'udukoko twanduza.
Contrary to popular belief however, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on hands.
Bitandukanye n'uko abantu benshi babyemera, ubushakashatsi bwa siyansi bwerekanye ko gukoresha amazi ashyushye ntacyo bimara mu kugabanya ingano ya mikorobe ku ntoki.
A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a non-water-based hand hygiene agent.
Umuti usukura intoki cyangwa umuti urinda ubwandu bw'intoki ni umuti w'isuku y'intoki utarimo amazi.

In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, alcohol rub non-water-based hand hygiene agents (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.

Mu mpera z'umwaka wa 1990 no mu ntangiriro z'ikinyejana cya 21 gukaraba intoki hifashishije imiti yagenewe kwica udukoko twanduza indwara (isanzwe izwi nk'imiti yo gusukura intoki irimo arukoro) byatangiye kumenyekana no gukundwa n'abantu benshi.

Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated together with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (polymer of acrylic acid) into a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin into a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to decrease the drying effect of the alcohol.

Inyinshi iba ikozwe muri arukoro ya "isopropyl" cyangwa "ethanol" ikorwa havanzwe ibyo bita Carbomer mu mavuta buzi cyangwa yongera ubuhehere nka giriserini ikabihinduramo ibisukika cyangwa ifuro mu rwego rwo koroshya ikoreshwa ryayo no kugabanya ingaruka z'arukoro zituma umuntu yumagana.
Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.
Kongeramo Idolojene-peroxide ifunguye byongera ubushobozi bwo kurwanya mikorobe. Imiti isukura intoki irimo nibura 60 kugera kuri 95% by'arukoro, ishobora gukora neza mu kwica mikorobe.

Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.

Imiti yo gusukura intoki irimo arukoro yica udukoko twanduza indwara, udukoko duhangana n'imiti myinshi (MRSA na VRE), igituntu, n'izindi virusi (zirimo virusi itera SIDA, herpes, RSV, rinovirusi, vakisiniya, ibicurane, na hepatite) ndetse na virusi itera ibimeme.

Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.

Imiti yifashishwa mu gusukura intoki ifite 70% yica 99,97% (3,5 by'igabanuka, bingana n'igabanuka rya desibeli 35) y'udukoko two ku ntoki mu masegonda 30 nyuma yo kuwukoresha na 99,99% kugera kuri 99,999% (igabanuka riri hagati ya 4 na 5) y'udukoko two ku ntoki nyuma y'umunota 1 nyuma yo gukoreshwa. Imiti yifashishwa mu gusukura intoki ikora neza cyane mu kurwanya udukoko twanduza indwara ariko ikaba idafite ubushobozi bwinshi bwo kurwanya za virusi.

Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.

Imiti yifashishwa mu gusukura intoki isa nkaho nta bushobozi ifite bwo kurwanya norovirusi (Norwalk) ikunze gutera indwara z'igifu. Imiti yifashishwa mu gusukura intoki igomba gukoreshwa ku buryo itosa cyangwa ikwira ku biganza byombi.
The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.
Imbere n'inyuma h'ibiganza no hagati no ku mpera h'intoki zose harakubwa hafi mu gihe cy'amasegonda 30 kugeza amazi, ifuro cyangwa umuti usukura byumye.

Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.

Ni ngombwa gukaraba neza imitwe y'intoki uyikubira hamwe mu biganza byombi. Ikigo gishinzwe kugenzura no gukumira ibyorezo cya Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika gisaba abantu gukaraba bakoresheje imiti yica udukoko mu biganza cyane cyane iyo bigaragara ko ibiganza byanduye.
