Avoid overloading students and parents by asking them to download and test too many applications or platforms.
Kwirinda kunaniza abanyeshuri n’ababyeyi ubasaba gukurura no kugerageza porogaramu cyangwa imbuga nyinshi.
Develop distance learning rules and monitor students’ learning process: Define the rules with parents and students on distance learning.
Gushyiraho amabwiriza agenga kwiga hakoreshejwe iyakure no gukurikirana imyigire y’abanyeshuri: Gusobanurira ababyeyi n’abanyeshuri amabwiriza agenga kwiga hakoreshejwe iyakure.
Design formative questions, tests, or exercises to monitor closely students’ learning process.
Gutegura ibibazo, isuzumabumenyi cyangwa imyitozo mu gukurikiranira hafi imyigire y’abanyeshuri.
Try to use tools to support submission of students’ feedback and avoid overloading parents by requesting them to scan and send students’ feedback
Kugerageza gukoresha ibikoresho bifasha abanyeshuri gutanga ibitekerezo no kwirinda kunaniza ababyeyi ubasaba ko basikana bakanohereza ibitekerezo by’abanyeshuri

Define the duration of distance learning units based on students’ self-regulation skills: Keep a coherent timing according to the level of the students’ self-regulation and metacognitive abilities especially for livestreaming classes.

Gusobanura igihe amasomo yo kwiga hakoreshejwe iyakure amara hashingiwe ku bumenyi bw’umunyeshuri bwo kwigenzura: Gukomeza gushyiraho igihe kidahinduka hakurikijwe urugero rw’abanyeshuri rwo kwigenzura n’ubushobozi bw’ubwenge bwabo, cyane cyane mu masomo atangwa ako kanya hakoreshejwe ikoranabuhanga.
Preferably, the unit for primary school students should not be more than 20 minutes, and no longer than 40 minutes for secondary school students.
Ibyiza ni uko amasomo y’abanyeshuri bo mu mashuri abanza atagomba kurenza iminota 20, no kutarenza iminota 40 ku banyeshuri biga mu mashuri yisumbuye.

Create communities and enhance connection: Create communities of teachers, parents, and school managers to address sense of loneliness or helplessness, facilitate sharing of experience and discussion on coping strategies when facing learning difficulties.

Gushyiraho amatsinda no kurushaho gukorana: Gushyiraho amatsinda y’abarimu, ababyeyi n’abayobozi b’amashuri yo gukemura ibibazo byo kumva umuntu ari wenyine cyangwa ntawe umufasha, koroshya uburyo bwo guhana ubumenyi no kungurana ku ngamba zo guhangana n’ingorane mu kwiga.
290 million students out of school due to COVID-19: UNESCO releases first global numbers and mobilizes response, UNESCO.
Abanyeshuri miriyoni 290 ntibiga kubera COVID-19: UNESCO yatanze imibare ya mbere ku isi yose isaba ko hafatwa ingamba zo kuyirwanya, UNESCO.
Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19
Ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo cya COVID-19 ahakorerwa akazi
Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19 are the application of occupational safety and health methodologies for hazard controls to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
Ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo cya COVID-19 ahakorerwa akazi ni zo za ngombwa mu gushaka umutekano n’ubuzima bwiza ahakorerwa akazi mu rwego rwo kwirinda indwara ya koronavirusi yo mu 2019 (COVID-19).

The proper hazard controls in the workplace depend on the worksite and job task, based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, disease severity in the community, and risk factors of individual workers who may be vulnerable to contracting COVID-19.

Ingamba nziza zo kurwanya icyorezo ahakorerwa akazi ziterwa n’aho abantu bakorera n’akazi bakora, hashingiwe ku isesengurangaruka ry’ahashobora guturuka indwara, ubukana bw’indwara mu baturage n’ibyago abakozi ku giti cyabo bafite intege nke bafite byo kwandura COVID-19.

According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.

Hakurikijwe Urwego rw’Amerika rushinzwe umutekano n’ubuzima bwiza ahakorerwa akazi (OSHA), akazi karimo ibyago bike byo kwandura virusi kaba ari akazi aho abakozi bategerana cyane n’abantu n’abandi bakozi bakorana, aho ingamba z’ibanze zo kwirinda ubwandu zitegetswe, harimo gukaraba intoki, gushishikariza abakozi kuguma mu rugo igihe barwaye, amabwiriza yo kwirinda indwara z’ubuhumekero no gukora isuku bihoraho no gutera imiti yica udukuko ahakorerwa akazi.

Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected with COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.

Akazi karimo ibyago biringaniye byo kwandura virusi kaba ari akazi kagusaba guhura kenshi cyangwa kwegerana n’abantu hatazwi cyangwa bikekwa ko banduye COVID-19, ariko bashobora kuba baranduye bitewe ni uko abantu bari kwanduza bagenzi babo cyangwa barakoze ingendo mu mahanga.
This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.
Harimo abakozi begerena n’abantu muri rusange nk’abakora mu mashuri, abakorera ahaba hari abantu benshi n’amaduka yakira abakiriya benshi.

Hazard controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.

Kurwanya icyorezo kuri abo bakozi byiyongera ku mabwiriza y’ibanze yo kurwanya indwara, harimo gutanga umwuka uhagije hakoreshejwe ibyuma biyungurura umwuka, ibikoresho bigukingira iyo witsamuye no kuba hari imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe mu gihe uhuye n’umuntu wanduye COVID-19.

OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.

Urwego rwa OSHA rusaba ko abakora mu buvuzi n’uburuhukiro bahuye n’uwanduye cyangwa bikekwa ko yanduye COVID-19 baba bafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura, bikaba bibongerera ibyago byinshi iyo abo bakozi bakora ibikorwa byo kongerera abarwayi umwuka, gufata cyangwa gusuzuma ibipimo by’umuntu uzwi cyangwa bikekwa ko afite COVID-19.
Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.
Uburyo bwiza bwo kurwanya icyorezo kuri abo bakozi harimo gukoresha ibikoresho byabugenewe nk’ibyumba bitageramo umwuka n’imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe ijyanye n’akazi bakora.
COVID-19 outbreaks can have several effects within the workplace.
Icyorezo cya COVID-19 gishobora kugira ingaruka nyinshi ahakorerwa akazi.
Workers may be absent from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.
Abakozi bashobora kutaza ku kazi bitewe no kurwara, bakeneye kwita ku bandi cyangwa bafite ubwoba bwo kuba bakwandura.
Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).

Imiterere y’ubucuruzi ishobora guhinduka, yaba mu byerekeye uko ibicuruzwa bitumizwa n’uburyo bwo kugura ibyo bicuruzwa (nko guhaha ibicuruzwa mu masaha bitari kugurwa cyane cyangwa serivisi zo kugemura cyangwa gushyikirizwa ibicuruzwa mu modoka).
Lastly, shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted.An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.

Hanyuma, kohereza ibicuruzwa bivuye mu duce twashegeshwe n’icyorezo cya COVID-19 bishobora gukomwa mu nkokora. Gahunda yo kwitegura guhangana no kurwanya indwara yandura bishobora kwifashishwa mu bikorwa byo kwirinda.

Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.

Gahunda zigaragaza ibyago biri ahantu henshi hakorerwa akazi n’akazi ubwako, harimo aho ushobora kwandura biturutse, ibyago byaturuka mu rugo no mu baturage n’ibyago abakozi bafite ubwabo bitewe n’ubusaza cyangwa kurwara indwara zidakira.
They also outline controls necessary to address those risks, and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of outbreaks.
Zinagaragaza imirongo ya ngombwa mu kurwanya indwara hakurwaho ibyo byago n’izindi ngamba zakoreshwa biramutse bitagenze neza mu gihe cy’icyorezo.
Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.
Gahunda zo kwitegura no kurwanya indwara yandura zishobora gukurikizwa ku rwego rw’igihugu cyangwa akarere.

Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.

Ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo mu bantu runaka harimo kugabanya kwanduzanya hagati y’abakozi, kurinda abantu bafite ibyago byinshi bitewe n’izindi ndwara barwaye, gukomeza gufungura ibikorwa by’ubucuruzi no kugabanya ingaruka byagira ku bindi bigo mu bikorwa byo gutunganya no kugemura ibicuruzwa.
The disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.
Ubukana bw’indwara mu baturage aho ibikorwa by’ubucuruzi biherereye bishobora kugira ingaruka ku ngamba zafashwe.
The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.
Urukurikirane rw’ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo rukoreshwa cyane mu kurwanya icyorezo harindwa umutekano n’ubuzima bwiza bw’ahakorerwa akazi hakurikijwe umusaruro zitanga.
Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.

Aho bidashoboka guhashya icyorezo cya COVID-19, uburyo butanga umusaruro mu kurwanya icyorezo ni ugukoresha ibikoresho byabugenewe, bigakurikirwa n’ingamba z’ubuyobozi n’imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe.
Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.
Kurwanya ubwandu hakoreshejwe ibikoresho byabugenewe ni ukurinda abakozi ibyago bijyanye n’akazi hatagendewe ku myitwarire y’umukozi kandi bishobora kudahenda mu kubishyira mu bikorwa.
Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.
Ingamba z’inzego z’ubuyobozi ni impinduka mu mabwiriza agenga akazi cyangwa imikorere bisaba ko bishyirwa mu bikorwa n’umukozi cyangwa umukoresha.
Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.
Imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe (PPE) ni yo ifatwa ko idatanga umusaruro cyane nk’izo ngambwa ebyiri zabanje, ariko ishobora gufasha mu kwirinda kuba umuntu yakwandura.

All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.

Amoko yose ya PPE agomba gutoranywa hashingiwe ku byago umukozi afite, bijyanye neza n’akazi akora (urug.: uduhumekero), kuyambara buri gihe kandi neza, guhora igenzurwa, igafatwa neza inahindurwa uko bibaye ngombwa kandi ikavanwamo, igasukurwa ikabikwa cyangwa ikajugunywa mu kugira ngo hirindwekwandura.
According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers.
Hakurikijwe ibivugwa n’Urwego rwa OSHA muri Amerika, akazi karimo ibyago bike byo kwandura ni akazi karimo kutegerena cyane n’abantu muri rusange cyangwa n’abo mukorana.

Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.

Ingamba z’ibanze zo kwirinda ubwandu zigomba kubahirizwa n’ahakorerwa akazi hose kandi harimo gukaraba intoki kenshi, gushishikariza abakozi kuguma mu rugo igihe barwaye, amabwiriza yo kwirinda indwara z’ubuhumekero harimo kwipfuka igihe ukoroye cyangwa witsamuye, gutanga udutumbaro tw’isuku n’aho tujugunywa habugenewe, gutegura guhanahana amakuru hakoreshejwe ikoranabuhanga, kwirinda ko abakozi basimburanwa ku kazi binjirira cyangwa basohokera rimwe niba bikenewe, kubuza abakozi gukoresha ibikoresho bya bagenzi babo no gusukura no gutera umuti wica udukoko kenshi ahakorerwa akazi.
Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.
Guhita umenya ukanashyira mu kato abantu bashobora kuba banduye ni igikorwa cy’ingenzi mu kurinda abakozi, abakiriya, abasura n’abandi bari ahakorerwa akazi.

The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees who have symptoms of acute respiratory illness are to stay home until they are free of fever, signs of a fever, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing or other symptom-altering medicines, and that sick leave policies are flexible, permit employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees are aware of these policies.

Ikigo cya CDC cyo muri Amerika gisaba ko abakozi bafite ibimenyetso by’indwara y’ubuhumekero ikaze baguma mu rugo kugeza batagifite umuriro, ibimenyetso by’umuriro n’ibindi bimenyetso byibuze bakamara amasaha 24 badakoresheje imiti igabanya umuriro cyangwa indi miti ivura ibimenyetso bafite no koroshya ingamba zo gusaba ikiruhuko cy’uburwayi, guha uruhushya abakozi bakaguma mu rugo hari uwo mu muryango wabo urwaye no kumenyesha abakozi iby’izo ngamba.

According to OSHA, medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within six feet (1.8 m) of people who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients, but may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing community transmission around the business location, or because the individual has recent international travel to a location with widespread COVID-19 transmission.

Ku bw’Urwego rwa OSHA, akazi karimo ibyago biringaniye byo kwandura virusi ni akazi kagusaba guhura kenshi cyangwa kwegerana mu ntera itageze muri m 1,8 n’abantu hatazwi cyangwa bikekwa ko banduye COVID-19, ariko bashobora kuba barwaye virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 bitewe no kwanduzanya hagati y’abantu bari ahakorerwa ibikorwa by’ubucuruzi cyangwa kubera ko abantu baherutse gukorera ingendo ahantu harangwa ubwandu bwa COVID-19.

These include workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.Engineering controls for this and higher risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service.Administrative controls for this and higher risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communications, establishing staggered shifts, discontinuing nonessential travel to locations with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, developing emergency communications plans including a forum for answering workers’ concerns, providing workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, training workers who need to use protecting clothing and equipment how to use it, providing resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring regular hand washing, limiting customers' and the public's access to the worksite, and posting signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures.Depending on the work task, workers with at least medium exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, a gown, a face shield or face mask, or goggles.

Harimo abakozi bakunda kwegerana n’abantu muri rusange nk’abakora mu mashuri, abakorera ahaba hari abantu benshi n’amaduka yakira abakiriya benshi. Kurwanya ubwandu hakoreshejwe ibikoresho byabugenewe kuri aba bakozi n’andi matsinda afite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura harimo ibyuma biyungurura umwuka, kongera umubare w’ibyuma bitanga umwuka, no gushyiraho ibigaragaza aho umuntu atarenga nk’ibikoze muri purasitike bigukingira iyo witsamuye no gushyiraho idirishya rigenewe abakiriya bahaha batavuye mu modoka. Ingamba z’ubuyobozi mu kurwanya ubwandu muri aba bakozi n’andi matsinda y’abakozi afite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura harimo gushishikariza abakozi barwaye kuguma mu rugo, guhindura inama zabaga imbonankubone zikaba hakoreshejwe ikoranabuhanga, kwirinda ko abakozi basimburanwa ku kazi binjirira cyangwa basohokera icyarimwe, guhagarika ingendo zitari ngombwa ujya ahari icyorezo cya COVID-19, gushyiraho gahunda yo guhanahana amakuru mu buryo bwihutirwa harimo ihuriro risubiza impungenge z’abakozi, guha abakozi ubumenyi bugezweho n’amahugurwa ku byago byo kwandura no kwirinda COVID-19, guhugura abakozi bakeneye gukoresha imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe, ubaha ibikoresho n’aho gukorera habafasha kugira isuku bwite isaba gukaraba intoki kenshi, kugabanya umubare w’abakiriya n’abagera ahantu rusange ku kazi no gushyiraho ibyapa bikangurira abantu gukaraba intoki n’izindi ngamba zo kwirinda COVID-19. Bitewe n’akazi, abakozi byibuze bafite ibyago biringaniye byo kwandura virusi bashobora kwambara imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe harimo kwambarira icyarimwe uturindantoki, ikanzu, masike cyangwa agapfukamunwa cyangwa amataratara.
Workers in this risk group rarely require use of respirators.
Abakozi bari muri iri tsinda ry’abafite ibyago basabwa gake gukoresha agahumekero.

If a person becomes sick on an airplane, proper controls to protect workers and other passengers include separating the sick person from others by a distance of 6 feet, designating one crew member to serve the sick person, and offering a face mask to the sick person or asking the sick person to cover their mouth and nose with tissues when coughing or sneezing.

Iyo umuntu arwaye ari mu ndege, hagomba gushyirwaho ingamba ziboneye zo kurinda abakozi n’abandi bagenzi harimo gushyira umurwayi ahawenyine ntakomeze kuba hamwe n’abandi agasigamo intera ya metero 2, hagashyirwaho ukora mu ndege umwe akaba ari we uha umurwayi ibyo akeneye, kumuha agapfukamunwa cyangwa kumusabai kwipfuka umunwa n’amazuru akoresheje udutambaro igihe akoroye cyangwa yitsamuye.

Cabin crew should wear disposable medical gloves when tending to a sick traveler or touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces, and possibly additional personal protective equipment if the sick traveler has fever, persistent cough, or difficulty breathing.

Abakora mu ndege bagomba kwambara uturindantoki two kwa muganga dutabwa tumaze gukoreshwa igihe bari gufasha umurwayi uri mu ndege cyangwa gukora ku matembabuzi yo mu mubiri cyangwa gukora ahantu hashobora kuba handuye no kwambara imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe igihe ari ngombwa iyo umurwayi uri mu ndege afite umuriro, inkorora y’akayi cyangwa guhumeka nabi.

Gloves and other disposable items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected afterwards.For commercial shipping, including cruise ships and other passenger vessels, hazard controls include postponing travel when sick, and self-isolating and informing the onboard medical center immediately if one develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.

Uturindantoki n’ibindi bikoresho bitabwa bimaze gukoreshwa bigomba gushyirwa mu ishashi yabugenewe kandi ahantu handuye hagomba guhanagurwa no guterwa umuti wica udukoko nyuma yo kuhakoresha. Ku mato atwara abagenzi, harimo n’amato atembereza ba mukerarugendo n’andi mato atwara abagenzi, kurwanya virusi harimo gusubika ingendo igihe hari urwaye no kwishyira mu kato no kubimenyesha ivuriro ryo mu bwato ako kanya iyo hari umuntu ugize umuriro cyangwa ugaragaje ibindi bimenyetso ari mu bwato.

Ideally, medical follow-up should occur in the isolated person's cabin.For schools and childcare facilities, CDC recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.

Ibyiza ni uko yakurikiranwa n’abaganga igihe uwo muntu yashyizwe mu cyumba cya wenyine. Ku bigo by’amashuri n’amarerero, Ikigo cya CDC gisaba ko afungwa by’igihe gito kugira ngo asukurwe cyangwa aterwemo umuti wica udukoko igihe umuntu wanduye agaragaye mu nyubako y’ishuri hatitwawe ku kuba umuntu yanduza mugenzi we.

When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as canceling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.

Nubwo haba hari umubare muto cyangwa munini wo kwanduzanya hagati y’abantu, ingamba zo kwirinda kwegerana zishobora gukurikizwa hahagarikwa ingendoshuri n’amateraniro y’abantu benshi nk’imyitozo ngororamubiri cyangwa amasomo yo kuririmba muri korari cyangwa gufatira amafunguro muri kantine, kongera umwanya hagati y’intebe n’indi, gusiga umwanya hari uwinjiye cyangwa usohotse, kureka ibyo gusura bitari ngombwa no gukoresha ivuriro riri ahandi ku bana bagaragaza ibimenyetso bimeze nk’iby’ibicurane.

When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.For law enforcement personnel performing daily routine activities, the immediate health risk is considered low by CDC.

Iyo hari ukwanduzanya mu baturage bo mu gace runaka, usibye ingamba zo kwirinda kwegerana gufunga amashuri igihe kirekire bishobora gutekerezwaho. Ku bakora mu nzego z’umutekano bakora buri munsi akazi gahoraho, ibyago byo kwandura ako kanya ni bike hakurikijwe ibitangazwa n’Ikigo cya CDC.

Law enforcement officials who must make contact with individuals confirmed or suspected to have COVID-19 are recommended to follow the same guidelines as emergency medical technicians, including proper personal protective equipment.

Abashinzwe umutekano bahuye n’umuntu byemejwe ko yanduye cyangwa bikekwa ko afite COVID-19 basabwa kubahiriza amabwiriza amwe nk’ay’abaganga bakora aho bikomeye, harimo kwambara imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe.

If close contact occurs during apprehension, workers should clean and disinfect their duty belt and gear prior to reuse using a household cleaning spray or wipe, and follow standard operating procedures for the containment and disposal of used PPE and for containing and laundering clothes.

Iyo habayeho kwegerana mu gihe cyo gufata umuntu, abakozi bagomba guhanagura no gutera umuti wica udukuko imikandara baba bambaye n’ibikoresho byabo mbere yo kongera kubikoresha bakoresheje imiti ihanagura ikoreshwa mu rugo cyangwa udutambaro duhanagura no gukurikiza amabwiriza asanzwe yo kubika no guta imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe yakoreshejwe no kubika no kumesa imyenda.
OSHA considers certain healthcare and mortuary workers to be at high or very high categories of exposure risk.
Urwego rwa OSHA rusaba ko bamwe mu bakora mu nzego z’ubuzima n’uburuhukiro bari mu byiciro byo hejuru cyangwa hejuru cyane byo kuba bafite ibyago byo kwandura.
High exposure risk jobs include healthcare delivery, support, laboratory, and medical transport workers who are exposed to known or suspected COVID-19 patients.

Akazi karimo ibyago byinshi byo kwandura harimo abakora mu buvuzi, muri raboratwari, n’abatwara abagiye cyangwa bavuye kwa muganga bashobora kuba bahuye n’umuntu bizwi ko arwaye cyangwa bikweka ko arwaye COVID-19.
These become very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected COVID-19 patients.

Abo baba bafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura iyo abakora ako kazi bakora ibikorwa birimo kongerera abarwayi umwuka, gufata cyangwa gusuzuma ibipimo by’umuntu bizwi ko arwaye cyangwa bikekwa ko arwaye COVID-19.
Aerosol-generating procedures include intubation, cough induction procedures, bronchoscopies, some dental procedures and exams, or invasive specimen collection.

Ibikorwa byo kongerera abarwayi umwuka harimo kumushyira uduheha mu mubiri, gutuma akorora, kumushyiramo uduheha ahumekeramo, bumwe mu buvuzi bw’amenyo no kuyasuzuma cyangwa gufata ibipimo by’imbere mu mubiri.

High exposure risk mortuary jobs include workers involved in preparing the bodies of people who had known or suspected cases of COVID-19 at the time of their death; these become very high exposure risk if they perform an autopsy.Additional engineering controls for these risk groups include isolation rooms for patients with known or suspected COVID-19, including when aerosol-generating procedures are performed.

Ibyago byinshi byo kwandurira mu buruhukiro bifitwe n’abakozi bategura imibiri y’abantu bazwiho cyangwa bikekwa ko banduye COVID-19 ubwo bapfaga; bagira ibyago biri hejuru igihe bakora ibizamini byo kureba ikishe umuntu. Kandi kurwanya ubwandu hakoreshejwe ibikoresho byabugenewe harimo amatsinda y’ibyago hakubiyemo ibyumba by’akato ku barwayi bazwiho kurwara cyangwa bakekwaho kurwara COVID-19, harimo gukora ibikorwa byo kongerera umwuka abarwayi.
Specialized negative pressure ventilation may be appropriate in some healthcare and mortuary settings.
Igikoresho gitanga umwuka cyihariye gishobora kuba kiboneye kuri bamwe mu bavuzi n’abakora mu buruhukiro.
Specimens should be handled with Biosafety Level 3 precautions.
Ibipimo bigomba gufatwa hakurikijwe amabwiriza yo mu rwego rwa 3 rw’umutekano wo kwa muganga.

The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends that incoming patients be separated into distinct waiting areas depending on whether they are a suspected COVID-19 case.In addition to other PPE, OSHA recommends respirators for those who work within 6 feet of patients known to be, or suspected of being, infected with SARS-CoV-2, and those performing aerosol-generating procedures.

OMS isaba ko abarwayi baza mu bitaro bashyirwa ukwabo aho bategerereza bitewe no kuba bakekwaho COVID-19. Kandi yaba imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe, Urwego rwa OSHA rusaba gukoresha uduhumekero ku bakorera mu ntera itageze muri metero 2 y’abazwiho kurwara cyangwa bikekwa ko barwaye, banduye virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 n’abakora ibikorwa byo kongerera umwuka abarwayi.

In the United States, NIOSH-approved N95 filtering facepiece respirators or better must be used in the context of a comprehensive, written respiratory protection program that includes fit-testing, training, and medical exams.

Muri Amerika, uduhumekero twemejwe n’Urwego rwa NIOSH two mu bwoko bwa N95 cyangwa utwiza kurushaho tugomba gukoreshwa hakurikijwe gahunda iboneye, yanditse yo kwirinda hakoreshejwe uduhumekero harimo gusuzuma ko gakwiye ukambara, guhugurwa uko kambarwa n’ibizamini byo kwa muganga.

Other types of respirators can provide greater protection and improve worker comfort.The WHO does not recommend coveralls, as COVID-19 is a respiratory disease rather than being transmitted through bodily fluids.

Ubundi bwoko bw’uduhumekero dushobora kurinda utwambaye neza kurushaho no gutuma umukozi yumva yisanzuye kurushaho. OMS ntisaba ko abakozi bambara amakanzu kuko COVID-19 ari indwara y’ubuhumekero aho kuba ari indwara yandura binyuze mu matembabuzi y’umubiri.
WHO recommends only a surgical mask for point-of-entry screening personnel.
OMS isaba ko hambarwa gusa udupfukamunwa two kwa muganga ku bakozi bakira abagana ibigo bitandukanye.

For those who are collecting respiratory specimens from, caring for, or transporting COVID-19 patients without any aerosol-generating procedures, WHO recommends a surgical mask, goggles, or face shield, gown, and gloves.

Ku bafata ibipimo byo mu myanya y’ubuhumekero, abita ku barwayi, cyangwa abatwara abarwayi ba COVID-19 batabongerera umwuka, OMS isaba ko bambara agapfukamunwa ko kwa muganga, amataratara cyangwa kasike, ikanzu n’uturindantoki.
If an aerosol-generating procedure is performed, the surgical mask is replaced with an N95 or FFP2 respirator.
Iyo hakozwe igikorwa cyo kongerera umwuka umurwayi, agapfukamunwa ko kwa muganga gasimburwa n’uduhumekero twa N95 cyangwa FFP2.

Given that the global supply of PPE is insufficient, WHO recommends minimizing the need for PPE through telemedicine, physical barriers such as clear windows, allowing only those involved in direct care to enter a room with a COVID-19 patient, using only the PPE necessary for the specific task, continuing use of the same respirator without removing it while caring for multiple patients with the same diagnosis, monitoring and coordinating the PPE supply chain, and discouraging the use of masks for asymptomatic individuals.

Bitewe ni uko kugemura imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe (PPE) bidahagije ku isi, OMS isaba ko hagabanywa ibituma hakenerwa imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe hagakoreshwa ubuvuzi bw’iyakure, gushyiraho ibituma abantu bategerena nk’amadirishya abonerana, no gutuma abatanga ubuvuzi butaziguye ari bo bonyine binjira mu cyumba kirimo umurwayi wa COVID-19, gukoresha PPE igihe ari ngombwa gusa mu kazi kihariye, gukomeza gukoresha agahumekero kamwe nta kukavanamo igihe uri kwita ku barwayi benshi barwaye kimwe, kubakurikirana no guhuza ibikorwa byo gukora no kugemura PPE no kubuza ikoreshwa ry’udupfukamunwa ku batagaragaza ibimenyetso.
WHEREAS on March 4, 2020, I proclaimed a State of Emergency to exist in California as a result of the threat of COVID-19;
MU GIHE ku wa 4 Werurwe 2020, natangaje ko leta ya California iri mu bihe bidasanzwe bitewe n’icyorezo cya COVID-19;
and WHEREAS in a short period of time, COVID-19 has rapidly spread throughout California, necessitating updated and more stringent guidance from federal, state, and local public health officials;

kandiMU GIHE gito gishoboka, icyorezo cya COVID-19 kikaba cyarakwiriye byihuse muri California, bigatuma havugururwa hanashyirwaho amabwiriza akomeye atanzwe n’inzego z’ubuzima rusange z’igihugu, iza leta n’izo mu gace utuyemo;

and WHEREAS for the preservation of public health and safety throughout the entire State of California, I find it necessary for all Californians to heed the State public health directives from the Department of Public Health.

kandiMU GIHE habungwabunga ubuzima rusange n’umutekano muri leta ya California, ni ngombwa ko abatuye muri California bose bubahiriza amabwiriza yatanzwe n’urwego rw’ubuzima rusange rwa leta atangwa n’Ishami ry’ubuzima rusange.

NOW, THEREFORE, I, GAVIN NEWSOM, Governor of the State of California, in accordance with the authority vested in me by the State Constitution and statutes of the State of California, and in particular, Government Code sections 8567, 8627, and 8665 do hereby issue the following Order to become effective immediately:

KUBERA IZI MPAMVU, NJYEWE, GAVIN NEWSOM, Guverineri wa leta ya California, nkurikije ububasha mpabwa n’Itegeko Nshinga rya leta n’amategeko ya leta ya California; cyane cyane Itegeko rigenga leta mu bice byaryo bya 8567, 8627 na 8665 ntanze Itegeko rikurikira kandi rigahita ritangira kubahirizwa:
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT:
BITEGETSWE KO:

1) To preserve the public health and safety, and to ensure the healthcare delivery system is capable of serving all, and prioritizing those at the highest risk and vulnerability, all residents are directed to immediately heed the current State public health directives, which I ordered the Department of Public Health to develop for the current statewide status of COVID-19.

1) Habungwabungwa ubuzima rusange n’umutekano no guharanira ko ubuvuzi bugera kuri bose no gushyira imbere abafite ibyago byinshi n’intege nke kandi abaturage bose barasabwa guhita bubahiriza amabwiriza y’ubuzima rusange ya leta ariho nategetse Ishami ry’ubuzima gutegura nkurikije uko ibintu bimeze muri leta ku bijyanye n’icyorezo cya COVID-19.
Those directives are consistent with the March 19, 2020, Memorandum on Identification of Essential Critical Infrastructure Workers During COVID-19 Response, found at: https://covid19.ca.gov/.
Ayo mabwiriza ajyanye n’inyandiko yo ku wa 19 Werurwe 2020, akaba ari Inyandiko yo kumenyesha abakora mu nzego za ngombwa mu kurwanya icyorezo cya COVID-19, iboneka kuri: https://covid19.ca.gov/.
ORDER OF THE STATE PUBLIC HEALTH OFFICER
ITEGEKO RITANZWE N’UFITE UBUZIMA RUSANGE MU NSHINGANO ZE

To protect public health, I as State Public Health Officer and Director of the California Department of Public Health order all individuals living in the State of California to stay home or at their place of residence except as needed to maintain continuity of operations of the federal critical infrastructure sectors, as outlined at https://www.cisa.gov/critical-infrastructure-sectors.

Mu kurinda ubuzima rusange, njyewe nk’Ufite ubuzima rusange mu nshingano ze n’Umuyobozi Mukuru w’Ishami ry’ubuzima rusange muri California ntegetse abatuye bose muri leta ya California kuguma mu rugo cyangwa aho batuye keretse ari ngombwa mu gukomeza ibikorwa by’inzego za ngombwa zagenwe n’igihugu, nk’uko byasobanuwe muri https://www.cisa.gov/critical-infrastructure-sectors.

In addition, and in consultation with the Director of the Governor's Office of Emergency Services, I may designate additional sectors as critical in order to protect the health and well-being of all Californians.

Kandi, maze kugisha inama Umuyobozi Mukuru w’Ibiro bya Guverineri bishinzwe ubutabazi bwihuse, nshobora gushyira izindi nzego mu nzego za ngombwa mu kurinda ubuzima n’imibereho by’abatuye bose muri California.

Pursuant to the authority under the Health and Safety Code 120125, 120140, 131080, 120130(c), 120135, 120145, 120175 and 120150, this order is to go into effect immediately and shall stay in effect until further notice.

Hashingiwe ku bubasha mpabwa n’Itegeko rigenga ubuzima n’umutekano 120125, 120140, 131080, 120130(c), 120135, 120145, 120175 na 120150, iri tegeko rigomba guhita ritangira gukurikizwa kandi bigakomeza gutyo kugeza igihe hazatangwa andi mabwiriza.

The federal government has identified 16 critical infrastructure sectors whose assets, systems, and networks, whether physical or virtual, are considered so vital to the United States that their incapacitation or destruction would have a debilitating effect on security, economic security, public health or safety, or any combination thereof.

Leta y’igihugu yagaragaje inzego za ngombwa 16 aho imitungo, imikorere n’ihuzamurongo ryazo yaba ifatika cyangwa idafatika bifatwa ko ari ngombwa n’Amerika kandi kudakora kwabyo cyangwa kwangirika kwabyo bikaba byagira ingaruka ku mutekano, ubuzimra rusange cyangwa umutekano cyangwa bibiri muri ibyo.
I order that Californians working in these 16 critical infrastructure sectors may continue their work because of the importance of these sectors to Californians' health and well-being.
Ntegetse abatuye muri California bakora muri izo nzego za ngombwa uko ari 16 ko bagomba gukomeza gukora kubera ko ari inzego z’ingenzi ku buzima n’imibereho by’abatuye muri California.
This Order is being issued to protect the public health of Californians.
Iri Tegeko rishyizweho mu rwego rwo kurinda ubuzima rusange bw’abatuye muri California.
The California Department of Public Health looks to establish consistency across the state in order to ensure that we mitigate the impact of COVID-19.
Ishami ry’ubuzima rusange rya California rigamije gushyiraho amabwiriza akurikizwa kimwe muri leta yose mu rwego rwo kugabanya ingaruka z’icyorezo cya COVID-19.
Our goal is simple, we want to bend the curve, and disrupt the spread of the virus.
Intego yacu irumvikana, turifuza kugabanya umubare w’abandura no gukumira ikwirakwira rya virusi.
The supply chain must continue, and Californians must have access to such necessities as food, prescriptions, and health care.
Gutunganya no kugemura ibicuruzwa bigomba gukomeza n’abatuye muri California bagomba kubona ibikenerwa by’ibanze nk’ibiribwa, imiti n’ubuvuzi.

When people need to leave their homes or places of residence, whether to obtain or perform the functions above, or to otherwise facilitate authorized necessary activities, they should at all times practice social distancing.

Iyo abantu bakeneye kuva mu rugo rwabo cyangwa aho batuye, yaba bagiye gusaba serivisi cyangwa gukora mu nzego zavuzwe haruguru cyangwa gufasha mu bikorwa bya ngombwa byemewe, igihe cyose bagomba kwirinda kwegerana.

2) The healthcare delivery system shall prioritize services to serving those who are the sickest and shall prioritize resources, including personal protective equipment, for the providers providing direct care to them.

2) Inzego z’ubuvuzi zigomba gushyira imbere serivisi zo kuvura abarwaye cyane no gushyira imbere kubona ibikoresho bihagije, harimo imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe yo guha abatanga serivisi bita ku barwayi mu buryo butaziguye.
3) The Office of Emergency Services is directed to take necessary steps to ensure compliance with this Order.
3) Ibiro bishinzwe ubutabazi bwihuse busabwa gufata ingamba za ngombwa mu guharanira ko hubahirizwa iri Tegeko.
4) This Order shall be enforceable pursuant to California law, including, but not limited to, Government Code section 8665.
4) Iri Tegeko rigomba gushyirwa mu bikorwa hakurikijwe amategeko yo muri California, harimo ariko bitagarukiye gusa ku Itegeko rigenga leta igice cya 8665.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that as soon as hereafter possible, this Order be filed in the Office of the Secretary of State and that widespread publicity and notice be given of this Order.
HANATEGETSWE KO vuba bishoboka, iri Tegeko rigomba gushyirwa mu gitabo cy’amategeko cyo mu Biro by’Umunyamabanga wa leta kandi rigatangazwa hose.

This Order is not intended to, and does not, create any rights or benefits, substantive or procedural, enforceable at law or in equity, against the State of California, its agencies, departments, entities, officers, employees, or any other person.

Iri Tegeko ntirigamije kandi ntiribereyeho, gutanga uburenganzira cyangwa ibyo abantu bagenerwa, kwifashishwa mu kugena ibigize ikirego cyangwa guca imanza, gukurikizwa mu byerekeye amategeko cyangwa mu by’imitungo, igihe biregwa leta ya California, ibigo byayo, amashami yayo, inzego zayo, abakorera mu biro bayo, abakozi bayo cyangwa undi muntu.
IN WITNESS WHEREOF I have hereunto set my hand and caused the Great Seal of the State of California to be affixed this 19th day of March 2020.
BITYO nkaba mbishyizeho umukono n’Ikirangantego cya leta ya California kuri uyu wa 19 Werurwe 2020.

We find ourselves in remarkable circumstances this month.
Twisanze mu bihe bidasanzwe muri uku kwezi.
The COVID-19 epidemic is something that makes clear our global human interconnectedness and the responsibilities we have to one another.
Icyorezo cya COVID-19 ni ikintu kigaragaza neza ko isi yabaye umudugudu kandi ko tugomba gufashanya.

We don’t have precedent for its challenges, but we do know that our best response relies on the sort of global empathy, cooperation, and community building that sits at the heart of this organization.
Ntabwo twigeze duhura n’izi mbogamizi, ariko tuzi ko guhangana n’icyorezo mu buryo bwiza ari ukumva ibibazo biri hirya no hino ku isi, gufatanya no gukomeza kunga ubumwe muri uyu muryango.
The camaraderie and care we have seen among all of our colleagues over email, calls, and chats is a remarkable validation of the incredible humans we are fortunate enough to work with.
Ubusabane no kwita ku bandi twabonye mu bo dukorana bose hakoreshejwe imeyiri, guhamagara no kuganira ni ikigaragaza ubumuntu budasanzwe twagize amahirwe yo gukorana namwe bihagijea.
I couldn’t be more grateful and proud to count you all as colleagues.
Ntabwo nabona uko mbashimira cyangwa ngongaragaze uko ntewe ishema namwe mwese nk’abantu dukorana.
Last week, someone shared with me their appreciation for our work.
Icyumweru gishize, hari umuntu wangaragarije uko yishimira akazi dukora.
They reminded me how meaningful it is for the world to be able to turn to Wikipedia right now, and what a powerful symbol it is for this critical resource to remain online and available to all.

Yanyibukije uko muri iki gihe isi yose iri kwifashisha cyane Wikipedia, bikaba ari ikimenyetso gikomeye cy’uko ari urubuga rutanga amakuru y’ingirakamaro kandi rugomba kuguma kuri interineti no kuboneka kuri bose.
Your work makes this possible, whether you keep the sites stay up or our colleagues paid or our communities safe.
Akazi mukora ni ko gatuma bishoboka, yaba ari ugukomeza gutuma urubuga rukora cyangwa abo dukorana bishyurwa cyangwa aho dukorera hagira umutekano.
The world needs the information that Wikipedia provides, now more than ever.
Isi ikeneye amakuru atangwa na Wikipedia muri iki gihe kurusha igihe cyabayeho cyose.
This is a moment in which not only what we do, but how we do it, will make a meaningful impact on the world.
Iki ni igihe kitari ukureba gusa ibyo dukora, ahubwo tunareba uko tubikoramo, bizatuma tugira impinduka y’ingirakamaro ku isi.
Because of the importance of this mission and your role in it, we will be making some significant adjustments to how we work together, starting this coming week.
Kubera akamaro k’izi nshingano n’uruhare ubifitemo, tugiye kugira ibyo duhindura bya ngombwa byerekeye uko dukorana, guhera mu cyumweru gitaha.
Adjustments to our work and schedules
Kugira ibyo duhindura ku byo dukora n’ingengabihe yacu
As Robyn mentioned previously, the c-team met last night to discuss our approach and schedule for the coming days and months.
Nk’uko Robyn yabivuze, itsinda ryacu ryahuye mu ijoro ryakeye mu kungurana ibitekerezo ku buryo bwacu n’ingengabihe yacu y’iminsi n’amezi biri imbere.
In that conversation, we considered what we thought would be an appropriate response to what we’re facing and the best way to keep the organization sustainable during this time.
Muri icyo kiganiro, twasuzumye ibyo twatekereje ko byaba ari igisubizo kiboneye ku byo turi guhurana na byo n’uburyo bwiza bwo gukomeza gutuma umuryango uramba muri ibi bihe.
Overwhelmingly we wanted to remove stress and support our mission for the long term.
Mu buryo budasanzwe, twifuzaga kuvanaho imbogamizi no gushyigikira inshingano zacu igihe kirekire.
If you need to dial back, that’s okay.
Niba wifuza guhamagara, ntacyo bitwaye.
For all staff, contractors, and contract workers:
Ku bakozi, abahawe amasezerano n’abakorera ku masezerano bose:
our daily working expectations will be about 4 hours a day, or 20 hours a week until further notice.
amasaha twiteze ko umuntu azajya akora buri munsi ni amasaha 4 cyangwa amasaha 20 mu cyumweru kugeza hatanzwe andi mabwiriza.
We’re not declaring a holiday - if you are able to work more normal hours, the mission can use you.
Ntitwavuga ko ari ikiruhuko; niba ushoboye gukora amasaha asanzwe twakwifashisha mu nshingano dufite.
However, the world is unpredictable right now, and whether you need to care for loved ones, get groceries, or go to the doctor, your well-being is our priority.
Ariko, muri iki gihe ibibera ku isi biri gutungurana kandi ubaye ukeneye kwita ku bo ukunda, guhaha ibiribwa cyangwa kujya kwa mu ganga; ubuzima bwawe ni bwo bushyizwe imbere.
We are not tracking your time.
Ntituri gukurikirana igihe ukora.
If you are sick, do not work.
Niba urwaye, ntujye ku kazi.
This should go without saying, but we’re saying it.
Ntibyakavuzwe ariko tubikomojeho.
No sick days or PTO required - just tell your manager and help your team revise calendars and schedules to make sure key areas of work are covered.

Si ngombwa ko usaba ikiruhuko cy’uburwayi cyangwa cyishyurwa, ukwiye kubibwira umuyobozi wawe maze agafasha itsinda ryawe gusubiramo indangaminsi n’ingengabihe ku buryo akazi k’ibanze gakomeza gukorwa.
(If you are diagnosed positive for COVID-19, please let Bryan within T&C Ops know so T&C can help with support and make sure your situation gets appropriate attention from management).
(Iyo upimwe bakagusangamo COVID-19, bimenyeshe Bryan ukora muri T&C Ops kugira ngo T&C iguhe ubufasha mu kibazo ufite no kwitabwaho n’ubuyobozi mu buryo bukwiye).
Hourly folks will be fully paid.
Abishyurwa ku isaha bazishyurwa amafaranga yose.
We have already said, and are recommitting to honor our commitments to our contractors and hourly staff colleagues.
Twabigarutseho kandi twongeye kwiyemeza kubahiriza inshingano zacu dufitiye abo twagiranye amasezerano na bagenzi bacu bishyurwa ku isaha.
Everyone will be paid on the basis of their usual hours worked during normal circumstances.
Buri wese azishyurwa hashingiwe ku masaha nyirizina yakoze mu bihe bisanzwe.
This includes if you are sick and unable to work.
Harimo n’igihe urwaye utanabasha gukora.
If you want to work, we support you.
Niba wifuza gukora, turagushyigikiye.
Many people use work as a way of channeling their stress with the world around us.
Abantu benshi bifashisha akazi nk’uburyo bwo kwiyibagiza umuhangayiko ubagaragiye muri iyi isi.
What we do can be incredibly rewarding, especially during times like this.
Ibyo dukora bishobora kugira akamaro kanini cyane by’umwihariko muri ibi bihe.
Again, this is about your self-care.
Na none, ikigamijwe ni uko wiyitaho.
Our ask is that you communicate with your manager, so we know what to expect and can adjust accordingly.
Inshangano zacu ni uko wavugana n’umuyobozi wawe, kugira ngo tumenye icyo twakwitega no guhindura imikorere mu buryo bukwiye.
Some work is considered essential.
Hari akazi gafatwa nk’ingenzi.
There are some things that we must keep doing.
Hari ibintu dukwiye gukomeza gukora.
The SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety, and Fundraising teams (among others) do critical work that may need additional support.
Amatsinda ya SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety n’ashinzwe gukusanya inkunga (hamwe n’ayandi) akora akazi k’ingenzi gakenera ubundi bufasha.
We’ll begin a process with all departments to assess current objectives and shift our focus to supporting what’s essential for our mission.
Tuzatangira kugenzura mu mashami yose kugira ngo dusuzume intego ziriho no guhindura ibyo twibandaho mu rwego rwo gufasha iby’ingenzi mu nshingano dufite.
There’s plenty to do for all of us, we just will all focus on the most essential projects.
Hari iby’ingenzi twese tugomba gukora, ariko hari imishinga y’ingenzi tugomba kwibandaho.
Slowing now won’t hurt later.
Gukora ibikorwa bike ubu nta ngaruka bizateza.
We do not plan to go “double-time to catch up” once the pandemic has passed.
Ntiduteganya “gukora hafi inshuro ebyiri kugira ngo twisubize igihe twatakaje” icyorezo nikirangira.
You will not be expected to work extra hours to meet deadlines which are now unrealistic.
Ntiwitezweho gukora amasaha y’ikirenga kugira ngo igihe wahawe kitakurengana kuko ubu bitashoboka.
We accept that circumstances have changed, and will work to set new targets and timelines where appropriate.
Twemera ko ibintu byahindutse kandi tuzakora kugira ngo dushyireho intego n’ingengabihe bishya aho biboneye.
What happens with the APP (Annual Planning)?
Bizagenda bite ku igenamigambi ry’umwaka?
To adjust to our new reality and daily working hour expectations, we intend to adjust the timeline for the delivery of our 2020-2021 Annual Plan.
Kugira ngo duhindure duhuze ni uko ibintu bisigaye bimeze n’amasaha y’akazi ya buri munsi, turifuza guhindura ingengabihe y’igenamigambi ry’umwaka wa 2020-2021.

Our intention is to propose an extension of our 2019-2020 plan that allows more time for budgeting to allow employees to prioritize critical work, self-care, and care for loved ones while accommodating those who need or wish to work a reduced schedule over the next few weeks.

Icyo tugamije ni ugusaba ko igihe cy’igenamigambi ryo mu 2019-2020 cyongerwa kugira ngo haboneke igihe cyo kugena ingengo y’imari mu gutuma abakozi bashyira imbere akazi k’ibanze, kwiyitaho no kwita ku bo bakunda mu gihe dufasha abashaka cyangwa abifuza gukora amasaha make mu byumweru bike biri imbere.
This timeline extension greatly reduces current planning workloads and pressure across the whole organization.
Uko kongera ingengabihe bigabanya cyane akazi kari gateganyijwe n’igitutu mu muryango wose.
We will introduce our proposal to the Board next week and will update delegates and teams on the next steps as soon as we have confirmation.
Tuzageza icyifuzo cyacu ku Nama y’ubuyobozi mu cyumweru gitaha kandi nzaha amakuru mashya abahagarariye abandi n’amatsinda ku mabwiriza akurikiyeho vuba bishoboka nibimara kwemezwa.
Thank you to the APP team for your leadership in this.
Itsinda rishinzwe igenamigambi ryagize neza ku bushobozi bw’imiyoborere ryagaragaje.
Office status, exposure, and cleaning
Imimerere y’ibiro, uko abantu bashobora kwandura indwara no gukora isuku
Last week, we learned that one of our SF-based colleagues may have been exposed to the COVID-19 virus.
Mu cyumweru gishize, twamenye ko umwe mu bo dukorana ukorera muri SF yahuye n’umuntu ushobora kuba waramwanduje virusi ya COVID-19.
However, out of an abundance of caution, we employed an antiviral cleaning crew to disinfect all surfaces in the San Francisco office.
Ariko, bitewe no kwitwararika cyane, twahaye akazi itsinda rishinzwe isuku yo kurwanya virusi kugira ngo ritere umuti wica udukuko ahantu hose mu biro byo muri San Francisco.
They utilized a hospital-grade anti-viral solution to disinfect every surface, as well as the lobby and elevator banks accessing our floor.
Bakoresheje uburyo bwo kurwanya virusi buri ku rwego rw’ibitaro maze bica udukuko ahantu hose, aho abantu binjirira no muri esanseri za banki zigera kuri etaje dukoreramo.
The building is employing its own duty-of-care protocol utilizing products that support the safety of their tenants.
Inyubako iri gukoresha amabwiriza yo kurwanya virusi hakoreshejwe ibikoresho bibungabunga umutekano w’ababikoresha.
We feel comfortable that the office will be well-prepared for when we decide to return.
Dufite icyizere ko ibiro bizaba biteguye neza niduhitamo kubisubiramo.
Our DC office is located in a WeWork, which has shared its COVID-19 protocol with us and all DC-based staff members.
Ibiro byo muri DC byacu biherereye muri WeWork, byasangije porotokore yabyo yo kurwanya COVID-19 natwe ndetse n’abakozi bose bakorera muri DC.
As of last week, our DC office moved to a fully remote setup in line with the guidance shared with San Francisco.
Kugeza mu cyumweru gishize, ibiro byacu byo muri DC byarahinduye bikora ku buryo busesuye hakoreshejwe iyakure mu rwego rwo kubahiriza amabwiriza yatanzwe na San Francisco.
As some of our NYC-based colleagues know, we have also been in discussion about leasing a location in Brooklyn.
Nk’uko bamwe mu bo dukorana bakorera muri NYC babizi, twari twatangiye ibiganiro byo gukodesha inzu muri Brooklyn.
These discussions are continuing but may be delayed.
Ibyo biganiro birakomeje ariko bishobora gutinda.
Some of our colleagues are working remotely for the first time.
Bamwe mu bo dukorana bari gukora hakoreshejwe iyakure ku nshuro yabo ya mbere.
Our long-time remote colleagues know that it can be an adjustment, and wanted to offer you some advice:
Abo dukorana basanzwe bakoresha iyakure barabizi ko bishobora guhindurwa kandi turifuza kubagira inama:
Limit the length of meetings to at most one or two hour increments.
Mugabanye igihe inama imara ijye imara isaha imwe cyangwa ebyiri igihe yatinze.
If longer sessions are required, consider how they can be broken up over the course of several days.
Niba sesiyo zitagikenewe, mwatekereza uko mwazigabanya mo amasomo yigwa mu minsi myinshi.
Clearly define the meeting, have an agenda, and send reading materials in advance.
Gusobanura neza inama, kugira umurongo w’ibyigwa usobanuye neza no kohereza inyandiko zayo mbere y’igihe.
Make video the default, with tools like Google Docs and Zoom to facilitate live collaboration and connection.
Reka gukoresha videwo ari byo biba iby’ibanze ukoresheje porogaramu nka Google Docs na Zoom mu koroshya imikoranire no gusangira amakuru mu buryo bw’ako kanya.
Have a lead to facilitate every meeting, someone to monitor the chat for questions and track the speaker list, and someone to help take notes (or do collaborative note-taking).

Kureka umuyobozi mukuru akaba ari we uyobora buri nama, hakagira umuntu ureba ku biganiro ahabazwa ibibazo no gukurikirana urutonde rw’abari buvuge n’umuntu ufata ibyavugiwe mu nama (cyangwa ufatanya n’abandi mu kwandika ibyavugiwe mu nama.
Send an email to tech support if you need a comfortable headset.
Koherereza imeyiri abatanga ubufasha mu bya tekiniki igihe ukeneye ekuteri zivuga neza.
Use your wellness reimbursement for snacks.
Gufata amafunguro yoroheje kugira ngo ukomeze kugira ubuzima bwiza.
Join the #remoties channel in Slack to talk with your colleagues about distributed work
Kujya ku muyoboro wa #remoties kuri porogaramu ya Slack kugira ngo uvuge imbogamizi uhura na zo mu gukora akazi wahawe
The HR Operations team is looking into webinar-based ergonomics guidance to support the increase in distributed work across the Foundation.
Ibikorwa by’itsinda rishinzwe abakozi risuzuma amabwiriza agenga imigendekere y’amahugurwa atangirwa kuri interineti mu rwego rwo gufata ubufasha no kongera akazi gatangwa mu Muryango.
This past week we asked all community grant recipients to cancel Wikimedia-funded public events, such as editathons, until the WHO declares the pandemic to be over.

Iki cyumweru gishize, twasabye ibigo byose bihabwa inkunga guhagarika ibikorwa rusange bigamije gushakira inkunga Wikimedia nk’amahugurwa yo guhugura abanditsi bo kuri interineti bashya, kugeza OMS itangaje ko icyorezo kirangiye.

We let them know that we understood that our request for cancellations and other restrictions could make it impossible to complete their agreed-upon grant activities and that no one would be penalized for having to delay or modify those goals.

Twababwiye ko tuzi ko kubasaba guhagarika ibyo bikorwa no kubahiriza andi mabwiriza bituma bitoroha na gato gusoza ibikorwa byo gukusanya inkunga biyemeje kandi nta muntu n’umwe uzabahanira ko batinze cyangwa bahinduye intego bari bihaye.
This coming week we will follow up with additional guidance on Wikimania and other regional and thematic community conferences.
Icyumweru gitaha, tuzakurikirana andi mabwiriza kuri Wikimania n’izindi nama zo mu karere n’izihariye mu duce runaka.
The general sentiment from around the global community seems to be both sadness at the disruption but relief at the clarity and ability to focus on their own communities, Wikimedia and otherwise.
Imitekerereze rusange ku miryango yo ku isi ni akababaro ku bwo guhagarika ibikorwa ariko hari ihumure, gusobanukirwa neza n’ubushobozi bwo kwibanda ku miryango yabo bwite, Wikimedia n’indi.
Going forward, the CRT is working to set up a page on Meta-Wiki to provide a space for the community to monitor the impact and follow our communications with them.
Bityo, CRT iri gushyiraho paji kuri Meta-Wiki kugira ngo ihe umwanya umuryango wo gukurikirana ingaruka no gukurikirana amakuru duhana nawo.
Staying in touch around COVID-19 related issues
Gukomeza guhanahana amakuru ku bibazo bya COVID-19
We’ll be sending an invitation to your calendars for next Thursday, 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT for a special staff meeting.
Tuzohereza ubutumire ku ndangaminsi yawe ku wa kane utaha, saa 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT ku nama idasanzwe y’abakozi.
We’ll use this time to share additional updates, answer your questions and spend some time connecting with each other.
Tuzifashisha uwo mwanya mu kubagezaho amakuru mashya, gusubiza ibibazo mufite no kumarana undi mwanya duhanahana amakuru.
We’re in this together and here to help however we can.
Twese twifatanyije muri iki cyorezo kandi turahari kugira ngo dufatanye uko dushoboye.
In the meantime, you can continue to find the information from this email, and all other essential COVID-19 related information, on Office Wiki.
Hagati aho, ushobora gukomeza kubona amakuru akubiye muri iyi imeyiri n’andi makuru ya ngombwa yerekeye COVID-19 ku Biro bya Wiki.
The CRT will keep these pages updated and all the information in one place.
CRT izakomeza gutuma izi paji zishyirwaho amakuru mashya kandi amakuru yose azaba ari ahantu hamwe.
We are also working to maintain regular communications with staff who reside in countries that are currently significantly affected.
Turi noi gushaka uburyo twakomeza guhana amakuru n’abakozi batuye mu bihugu kuri ubu byugarijwe n’icyorezo.
If you have any questions about travel, events, a major workstream, or coverage challenge, or anything else you may need help with, please don’t hesitate to notify and work with the CRT.
Niba ufite ikibazo ku byerekeye ingendo, ibikorwa, imikorere cyangwa ikibazo cya interineti cyangwa ikindi icyo ari cyo cyose ukeneye gufashwamo, ntutinde kubitumenyesha no gukorana na CRT.
We’re here to help provide support and liaise as needed.
Turi hano kugira ngo tuguhe ubufasha tunahuze ibikorwa mu buryo bukenewe.
If you have a confidential or sensitive matter, please email Bryan Judan - Director of HR International Global Operations.
Niba ufite ikibazo cy’ibanga cyangwa kigomba kwitonderwa, oherereza imeyiri Bryan Judan, Umuyobozi Mukuru ushinzwe abakozi n’ibikorwa ku rwego rw’isi.
None of these changes should be seen as an abandonment of our work and obligations.
Nta mpinduka n’imwe muri izi igomba kubonwa nko kureka akazi dukora cyangwa inshingano dufite.
Rather, they are a recognition that at this moment, our work and obligations will likely need to adapt in a way we have not in the past.
Ahubwo ni ukugaragaza ko muri iki gihe, akazi dukora n’inshingano dufite bishoboka cyane ko byahinduka mu buryo butigeze bubaho mu minsi ishize.
These are the steps we believe are necessary to support this one another so that we can continue to work, provide our movement with the support they need, and the world with the service they rely on.
Izo ni zo ngamba twizera ko ari ngombwa mu gufashanya kugira ngo dukomeze gukora, dukora akazi dushinzwe hakurikijwe ubufasha bakeneye no guha isi serivisi ishobora kugenderaho.
Our planned work will be there waiting for us when the time comes.
Akazi twari twarateganyije kazaba kagihari kadutegereje kugeza igihe nikigera.
For now, it is time to support one another and create space for the important work that will be coming in the weeks and potentially months ahead.
Kugeza ubu, turi mu gihe cyo gufashanya no gushaka umwanya wo gukora akazi k’ingenzi kazaza mu byumweru biri imbere biranashoboka ko kaza mu mezi ari imbere.
We need all of you to make that happen, and so we need you all to take care of yourself and your families so that you can be at your best when the need arises.
Turabakeneye mwese kugira ngo bigerweho kandi tunakeneye ko mwiyitaho mukanita ku miryango yanyu kugira ngo mube mumeze neza nimukenerwa.
Now, please -- wash your hands and don’t touch your face!
None ubu, mukwiye gukaraba intoki no kutikora mu maso!

Katherine, the CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S), and the rest of the Leadership Team (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, and Toby N).

Katherine, CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S), n’abandi bose bagize Itsinda ry’ubuyobozi (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M na Toby N).
The SARS-CoV-2 virus is the cause of COVID-19 (coronavirus disease 2019), a contagious respiratory disease that was first identified in December 2019, in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
Virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 ni yo itera COVID-19 (indwara ya koronavirusi yo mu 2019), ikaba ari indwara y’ubuhumekero yandura yagaragaye bwa mbere mu Ukuboza 2019, muri Wuhan, Hubei, mu Bushinwa.
The disease is a type of coronavirus, the same family that includes SARS, MERS, and some varieties of the common cold.
Indwara ni ubwoko bwa koronavirusi, ikaba iri mu muryango umwe na SARS, MERS n’andi moko y’ibicurane.
It was declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization (WHO) on 11 March 2020.
Ku ya 11 Werurwe 2020, ni bwo yatangajwe ko ari icyorezo n’Ishami ry’Umuryango w’Abibumbye ryita ku buzima (OMS).
While much about COVID-19 is still unknown, preliminary data suggests that it is more virulent and contagious than the seasonal flu, and less virulent but more contagious than SARS and MERS.

Mu gihe hari byinshi bitaramenyekana kuri COVID-19, amakuru y’ibanze agaragaza ko itera indwara kandi yandura cyane kurusha ibicurane biza mu gihe runaka kandi ikaba idatera indwara cyane ariko ikandura cyane kurusha SARS na MERS.
Older people and those with underlying conditions are the most at risk of serious complications including death.
Abageze mu zabukuru n’abafite izindi ndwara ni bo bafite ibyago byinshi byo kuzahazwa na yo harimo no gupfa.
Due to the spread of the disease, you are advised not to travel unless necessary, to avoid being infected, quarantined, or stranded by changing restrictions and cancelled flights.

Bitewe n’ukuntu iyi ndwara yandura, ugirwa inama yo kudakora ingendo zitari ngombwa, wirinda ko wakwandura, washyirwa mu kato, wahera ahantu rukana bitewe n’amabwiriza yahindutse n’ingendo z’indege zahagaritswe.
Avoid crowded places whenever possible.
Irinde kujya ahantu hari abantu benshi igihe cyose bishoboka.
This is not just to protect you, but also those you come in contact with.
Ntibigamije kukurinda wowe gusa, ahubwo binagamije kurinda abandi muhura.
As it happens, you probably aren't missing much by staying home, as many attractions around the world are closing their doors to avoid spreading the disease.
Uko ibintu bimeze, birashoboka cyane ko kuguma mu rugo bitatuma hari byinshi uhomba, kuko ahantu henshi nyaburanga ku isi hafunzwe mu rwego rwo kwirinda ikwirakwira ry’indwara.

If you do need to travel, take precautions as you would for other infections: wash your hands frequently, avoid touching your face, cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and avoid contact with sick people.

Niba ukeneye gukora ingendo, irinde kugira ngo utandura: karaba intoki kenshi, irinde kwikora mu maso, korora unitsamure ukoresheje mu mfuruka y’inkokora zawe cyangwa ukoreshe agatambaro unirinde kwegera abantu barwaye.
Before traveling, read up on the extensive and fast-changing array of travel restrictions that have been imposed around the world.
Mbere yo gukora urugendo, soma amabwiriza yose agenda avugururwa ku ngendo yashyizweho ku isi yose.
After travel, monitor your health and consider self-isolation for two weeks to avoid transmitting the disease to others.
Uvuye mu rugendo, genzura ubuzima bwawe kandi unatekereze kwishyira mu kato ibyumweru bibiri kugira ngo wirinde kwanduza abandi indwara.
Transportation from long-distance passenger flights to local buses has been curtailed or completely shut down in many countries due to low demand or government orders.

Ingendo z’abagenzi bari mu ndege zijya kure bakavizamo bakajya mu mabisi zaragabanijwe cyangwa zirahagarikwa burundu mu bihugu byinshi bitewe n’uko abazikoresha babaye bake cyane cyangwa hakurikijwe amategeko ya leta.
Many international and regional borders are closed.
Imipaka myinshi mpuzamahanga n’iyo mu karere irafunze.
If you are away from home, and especially if you are in another country, consider returning home as soon as possible; this may get even more difficult as restrictions continue to change.
Niba utari mu rugo; by’umwihariko, niba uri mu kindi gihugu, shaka uko wasubira mu gihugu cyawe vuba bishoboka kuko bishobora kurushaho gukomera bitewe ni uko amabwiriza akomeza guhinduka.
In some cases it may simply not be possible, even if you're healthy and meet the legal requirements for entry.
Hari aho bidashobora gushoboka, nubwo ufite ubuzima bwiza kandi wujuje ibisabwa n’amategeko kugira ngo winjire mu gihugu.
If you can't find a way back to your country, contact your nearest embassy or consulate for assistance.
Igihe utabasha kubona uko wasubira mu gihugu cyawe, bimenyesha ambasade cyangwa konsira bikwegereye kugira ngo bigufashe.
They may be able to organize an evacuation, identify non-regularly scheduled flights, or give you an emergency loan to pay for transport.
Bashobora gushyiraho gahunda yo gutahukana abaturage, bakaba bagushakira indege zikora ingendo zihutirwa cyangwa bakaguha inguzanyo y’ingoboka yo kwishyura urugendo.
In case they can't, make preparations in case you need to stay where you are for an extended period.
Igihe batabishoboye, itegure mu gihe bibaye ngombwa ko uguma aho uri igihe kirekire.
If you do find a way back home, be prepared that it may be expensive, inconvenient, and have unusual restrictions (such as no checked baggage).
Nutabona uko usubira mu rugo, itegure ko bishobora kuguhenda, kukugorakandi ukaba wanahabwa amabwiriza adasanzwe (nko kutemera imizigo itagenzuwe).
As of early April 2020, the number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 is approaching one million.
Kugeza mu ntangiriro za Mata 2020, umubare w’abemejwe ko banduye COVID-19 wenda gagusatira miriyoni imwe.
Though the disease started in mainland China, it has spread around the world and China has fewer confirmed cases and deaths than several other countries.
Nubwo indwara yatangiriye mu Bushinwa, yakwiriye isi kandi Ubushinwa bugira umubare muto w’abemejwe ko banduye n’abapfuye kurusha mu bindi bihugu byinshi.
Europe is the new epicenter of the pandemic.
Uburayi ni bwo bwabaye izingiro rishya ry’icyorezo.

All but a handful of countries have reported at least one case, with the highest numbers of reported cases in the United States, Spain, Italy, Germany, France, mainland China, Iran, and the United Kingdom.

Ibindi bihugu bike na byo byatangaje ko byibuze bifite umuntu umwe wanduye, naho umubare munini w’abanduye wagaragaye muri Amerika, Esipanye, Ubutaliyani, Ubudage, Ubufaransa, Ubushinwa, Irani n’Ubwongereza.
Local transmission is established in many countries in all major inhabited regions of the world except some Pacific island nations.
Kwanduzanya hagati y’abaturage byagiye bitangazwa mu bihugu byinshi mu bice bituwe cyane ku isi keretse bimwe mu bihugu byo mu birwa bya Pasifika.
(See updates from the WHO.)
(Reba amakuru mashya yatangajwe na OMS.)
The full extent of the spread is uncertain, due in part to limited testing.
Urugero virusi ishobora kwanduramo ntiruzwi bitewe ni uko gupima abantu bitaragera hose.

Many countries are experiencing a severe shortage of test kits, and the authorities have not been able to test everybody who is at high risk, so the real number of cases is probably much higher than the official one.

Ibihugu byinshi biri guhura n’ibibazo by’ubuke bw’ibikoresho byo gupima kandi inzego z’ubuyubozi ntizabashije gupima buri muntu ufite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura, rero birashoboka cyane ko imibare nyayo y’abanduye iri hejuru kurusha itangazwa.
Countries also differ in their testing and reporting practices, so comparisons of the number of reported cases do not tell the full story of how the epidemic has progressed in different areas.

Kandi ibihugu bitandukanye mu buryo bikoresha bipima abantu n’uburyo bitangazamo abanduye; rero kugerereranya imibare y’abanduye yatangajwe ntibigaragaza neza uko icyorezo cyagiye gikwira mu bice bitandukanye.
The virus is transmitted through respiratory droplets and through objects.
Virusi yandura binyuze mu matembabuzi yo mu nzira z’ubuhumekero no gukora ku bintu n’ahantu byanduye.
The coronavirus is a relatively large virus, meaning it is not truly airborne: it will settle down in respiratory droplets.
Koronavirusi ni virusi yandura cyane, nubwo itandurira neza neza mu mwuka, ariko yibera mu matembuzi yo mu nzira z’ubuhumekero.
Staying two metres (six feet) away from other people is usually enough to prevent transmission through this route.
Kuguma muri metero ebyiri witaruye abandi bantu akenshi ni intera ihagije yo kwirinda ko wakwandura binyuze muri ayo matembabuzi.
Transmission from objects can happen, for example, if someone sneezes, touches a doorknob, and then other people touch the doorknob and then touch their faces.

Biranashoboka ko wakwandura binyuze ku gukora ku bintu cyangwa ahantu handuye; urugero, iyo umuntu wanduye yitsamuye, akoze kuri serire y’urugi maze abandi bantu bagakora kuri ya serire y’urugi barangiza bakikora mu maso.
The SARS-CoV-2 virus may last on cardboard for up to 24 hours and on plastic for up to 3 days.
Virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 ishobora kumara ku ikarito igihe kigera ku masaha 24 no kuri purasitikie kugeza ku minsi 3.
Transmission via the fecal–oral route may also be possible.
Biranashoboka ko yandura binyuze mu musarani.
Evidence suggests that COVID-19 is contagious even without symptoms, though to what extent is still being investigated.
Ibimenyetso bigaragaza ko COVID-19 yandura uwayanduye atagaragaza ibimenyetso, nubwo ibyo bikigenzurwa.
Common symptoms include a fever, dry cough, and fatigue.
Ibimenyetso rusange birimo umuriro, inkorora y’akayi n’umunaniro.
Other less common symptoms include shortness of breath, a sore throat, headache, muscle pain, or sputum production.
Ibindi bimenyetso birimo kubura umwuka, kubabara mu muhugo, kuribwa umutwe, kubabara imikaya cyangwa kuzana igikororwa.
Some patients have very mild symptoms, similar to a cold.
Abantu bamwe na bamwe bashobora kugira ibimenyetso byoroheje bisa nk’iby’ibicurane.
Serious complications include pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, and multi-organ failure leading to disability or death.
Ibimenyetso bikomeye harimo umusonga, indwara y’ubuhumekero ikaze no kunanirwa gukora kw’ingingo nyinshi z’umubiri bituma uyirwaye amugara cyangwa agapfa.
About 80% of infections result in mild symptoms, while the remaining may result in hospitalization.
Hafi 80% by’abanduye virusi bagaragaza ibimenyetso bidakomeye, mu gihe abasigaye bishobora kurangira bajyanwe mu bitaro.
Case fatality rate is estimated at 1-3% of infected individuals, most of whom are elderly with underlying health conditions.
Igipimo cy’abicwa na virusi ni 1-3% by’abayanduye, aho abenshi mu bapfa biba bitewe n’izabukuru no kurwara inzindi ndwara.
The fatality rate is much higher for those over 70 but significantly lower for those under 40.
Igipimo cy’abapfa kiri hejuru cyane ku barengeje imyaka 70 ariko kikaba kiri no hasi cyane ku batarangeje imyaka 40.

Those most at risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications are the elderly and those with weakened immune systems or underlying health conditions like cardiovascular disease, diabetes, hypertension, chronic respiratory disease, and cancer.

Abafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura COVID-19 n’abagira ibimenyetso bikomeye byayo baba ari abageze mu zabukuru n’abafite abasirikare b’umubiri bacitse intege cyangwa bakaba barwaye izindi ndwara nk’indwara y’umutima, diyabete, umuvuduko mwinshi w’amaraso, indwara y’ubuhumekero idakira na kanseri.
Not many cases are reported in children and most of these are mild or moderate, though a significant fraction do get pneumonia.
Nta bwandu bukabije buvugwa mu bana kandi n’abanduye bagaragaza ibimenyetso byoroheje cyangwa bidakomeye cyane nubwo hari umubare w’abarwara umusonga.
Occupationally, health care workers have higher risk compared to others with clusters of disease among workers and in health care settings.
Mu rwego rw’akazi, abakora mu nzego z’ubuvuzi ni bo bafite ibyago byinshi ugereranyije n’abandi bakozi banduye banakora mu nzego z’ubuzima.

The time between being exposed to the virus and the emergence of symptoms (incubation period) is typically between 2 and 14 days, though there has been one reported case in China where symptoms appeared 27 days after exposure.

Igihe kiri hagati yo guhura na virusi no kugaragaza ibimenyetso (igihe gishira kugira ngo ibimenyetso bigaragare) akenshi ni hagati y’iminsi 2 na 14, nubwo hari uwavuzweho kwandura mu Bushinwa aho yagaragaje ibimenyetso mu minsi 27 amaze guhura na virusi.
As of February 2020, the period of infectiousness is unknown, but is likely most significant when people are symptomatic.
Kugeza muri Gashyantare 2020, igihe cyo kwanduza virusi ntikizwi, ariko birashoboka cyane ko ari igihe abantu bagaragaje ibimenyetso.
There is evidence of transmission from people who don't have symptoms, although to what extent is still being investigated.
Hari ibimenyetso byo kwanduza byavuye mu bantu batagaragaza ibimenyetso, nubwo bikiri kugenzurwa.
It is unclear whether it is possible to be reinfected with the virus after recovering from it the first time around.
Ntibigaragara neza niba bishoboka ko wakongera kwandura virusi nyuma yo kuyikira bwa mbere.
Long-term effects for people who have recovered remain unclear, but there is evidence of reduced lung capacity in some recovered patients.
Ingaruka z’igihe kirekire ku bantu bakize ntizirasobanuka neza, ariko hari ibimenyetso by’uko habaho igabanuka ry’ubushobozi bw’ibihaha ku barwayi bamwe na bamwe bakize.
Testing for the virus usually consists of a swab inserted through the nose or a throat swab which is analysed in a laboratory for the virus.
Akenshi mu gupima virusi hifashishwa agakoresho kabugenewe kinjizwa mu izuru cyangwa mu muhugo maze ibikuwemo bigasuzumirwa muri raburatwari harebwa niba nta virusi irimo.
The current "gold standard" test involves extracting the genetic material from the sample and analysing it for known genetic markers of the virus.
Uburyo bwo gupima bufatwa nk’"ubugenderwaho" ni ukuvana jene mu bipimo byafashwe maze igapimwa igereranywa n’ibiranga jene ya virusi.
There is no established test assessing for the virus or antibodies in the blood, although tests are being developed.
Nta gupima mu buryo buhamye aho bapima virusi cyangwa abasirikare barwanya virusi mu maraso, nubwo ibikoresho byifashishwa gupima muri ubwo buryo biri gukorwa.
There is no test to establish immunity to the virus.
Nta bipimo birakorwa ku buryo hakwemezwa ko hari ubudahangarwa buhari kuri iyi virusi.
Many governments around the world have advised their citizens not to travel unnecessarily amid the pandemic.
Ibihugu byinshi ku isi byagiriye inama abaturage babyo zo kudakora ingendo zitari ngombwa mu gihe cy’icyorezo.
Lots of airlines and package holidays are making it easy for you by waiving cancellation and change fees.
Amasosiyete y’indege menshi na gahunda z’ingendo z’ibihuruko biri korohereza abantu kuvanaho amafaranga yo guhagarikisha itike cyangwa yo kongeresha igihe cy’itike.
Particularly avoid cruise ship travel.
By’umwihariko, irinde kugendera mu bwato butembereza ba mukerarugendo.

Older travelers and those with underlying health conditions are most at risk and should avoid travel that puts them at risk, such as long plane flights, visits to crowded places, and especially cruises, even outside of severely affected areas.

Abageze mu zabukuru bakora ingendo n’abarwaye izindi ndwara bafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura kandi bagomba kwirinda gukora ingendo zibashyira muri ibyo byago, nko gufata ingendo z’indege ndende, gusura ahantu hari abantu benshi by’umwihariko amato atembereza ba mukerarugendo no gutemberera hanze mu duce twashegeshwe na virusi.
In affected areas, most experts recommend a practice known as social distancing.
Mu duce twashegeshwe na virusi, abenshi mu nzobere basaba ko abantu bakwirinda kwegerana.
This means minimising contact with others by keeping a distance of six feet or two meters from them and avoiding gathering together in groups.
Bivuze ko ugomba kuguma mu ntera ya metero ebyiri utegereye abandi no kwirinda kujya mu matsinda y’abantu benshi bateranye.
Some areas permit small groups; others prohibit all group gatherings.
Uduce tumwe na tumwe twemera ko abantu bake baterana, utundi tukabuza ko abantu uko baba bangana kose baterana.
Measures you are encouraged to take include working from home whenever possible, avoiding crowds and avoiding leaving your home unless absolutely necessary.
Ingamba abantu basabwa gukurikiza harimo gukorera mu rugo aho bishoboka, kwirinda ahantu hari abantu benshi no kwirinda kuva mu rugo keretse igihe ari ngombwa gusa.
If you must go out, try to stay at least 2 meters (6 feet) away from other people.
Iyo ugomba kujya hanze, ugerageza kuguma muri metero 2 akaba ari yo ntera usiga hagati yawe n’abandi bantu.
In many places these measures are required.
Ahantu henshi ayo mabwiriza ni itegeko.
Follow hygiene practices like for flu prevention.
Kubahiriza amabwiriza y’isuku ameze nk’ayo kwirinda ibicurane.
Frequently wash your hands with soap and warm water, and then dry your hands on a clean towel.
Gukaraba intoki kenshi ukoresheje isabune n’amazi maze ukazihanaguza isume isa neza.
As coronaviruses are enveloped viruses, washing your hands with soap kills the virus by disrupting the mostly fat-based viral envelope.
Mu gihe koronavirusi ari virusi iba iri mu kugara, gukaraba intoki byica virusi bikanica akugara ka virusi kagizwe n’ibisa n’amavuta.
Effective hand washing requires rubbing your hands for at least 20 seconds.
Koga neza intoki bisaba kuzikuba no kuzitsirima byibuze amasegonda 20.
Drying your washed hands physically removes some germs from your skin (so don't skip that step, and don't share towels).
Kumutsa intoki zawe umaze gukarababikuraho udukoko ku ruhu rwaw (rero ntusibe kubikora kandi ntukoreshe isume yakoreshejwe n’abandi).
If soap and water are not available, then use a >60% alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
Niba isabane n’amazi bidahari, koresha umuti wagenewe gusukura intoki urimo byibuze >60% by’arukoro.

Alcohol is a quick germ-killer, but it's not quite instant, so this still requires the same 20 seconds of rubbing your hands together, making sure that every single scrap of skin gets wet, and then you have to wait about another minute, for the alcohol to completely dry.

Arukoro ni umuti wica vuba udukoko, ariko si ako kanya n’ubundi bigusaba ya masegonda 20 ukuba unatsirima intoki zawe ku zindi, ukora ku buryo usiga arukoro ku bice byose by’intoki maze ugategereza undi munota kugira ngo arukoro yiyumishe.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with your hands.
Irinde gukora mu maso yawe, ku mazuru no mu kanwa ukoresheje intoki.
Most people touch their faces every few minutes, all day long.
Abantu benshi bikora mu maso buri minota mike, umunsi wose.
Try to do this less, and try to wash your hands before touching your face.
Gerageza kubigabanya kandi ukarabe intoki zawe mbere yo kwikora mu maso.
Also, try to avoid touching surfaces you don't have to touch in the first place, at least with your bare hands.
Kandi unagerageza kwirinda gukora ahantu utakoze bwa mbere, nunahakora ntuhakoreshe intoki zawe ntakizitwikiriye.
Cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and then immediately throw away the tissue and wash your hands.
